story:
“I am not the same having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.” - Mary Anne Radmacher 

 Who I Am...

My name is Jacqueline Vidal and I am a history teacher at East Austin College Prep in Austin, Texas. The first in my own family to graduate from college, I take great pride in working with the diverse students who are on track to become firsts in their own family. I work hard to provide my students with unique opportunities to learn, explore and discover the world around them. In my third year of teaching, I enjoy the challenge of showing my students the things they cannot get from a classroom environment. I have taken my students to Spanish missions, Washington D.C., museums around Texas, and even brought camels to school! I enjoy these challenges and the look on the faces of my students when they learn something new, something I know they will remember for the rest of their lives. 

   

                  


  Who We Are...

The vision of our school is to serve as a model school with a rigorous curriculum that successfully prepares all students, regardless of economic background, for graduation and success in college and career, while also instilling a commitment to community service. 

Why East Austin College Prep?
For too long children growing up in East Austin have been expected to settle in their educational and professional aspirations. At East Austin College Prep, we create a positive, nurturing atmosphere of high expectations with a results-driven bottom line: 100% of our students will go to college. Period.

EAPrep doesn’t just get students excited to attend college. It prepares them with the academic and social skills necessary to survive in the university environment and beyond. That means a strong foundation in math and science and a comprehensive extracurricular program that includes visual and performing arts, as well as athletics.


 Why we need your help...

This year, we have embarked on a very challenging and exciting adventure that will change the lives of our students and impact our community. East Austin College Prep is home to a very diverse group of minority students, many of whom will be the first in their family to graduate from high school. This campaign will not only impact our students, but their brothers, sisters and future generations to come.  

  Working toward our goal...

Since September of 2013, we have been fundraising in every way possible to work toward our goal of $30,000 that will pay for flights, room and board, excursions and other expenses for 11 students and 2 teachers. We have raised quite a bit and are thankful for all the help our community has given, but we still need help in reaching our goal. You will be paying for student meals, historic educational excursions, and room accommodations and every penny helps. 

While in Madrid, students will participate in 3-4 hours of Advanced Spanish instruction at a different site where they will practice proper grammar and conversation in the natural environment. They will keep a journal to record their adventures and will be asked to create a project that showcases their own personal experience, highlighting key educational events and areas of personal growth. When we return, they will present their project to their peers and the community. Students trust teachers to teach them what they need to know to be successful; we have proven that our students trust us to show them. Through our fundraising efforts and dedication to our goals, we are teaching and showing them how to work hard for something they want, how to appreciate others, and how to make a difference. 

 Your Impact on our students...

If you have a love for traveling and exploring the world, imagine what it would be like for a 16 year-old who has never left his/her city, never been on a plane, never imagined the  impact that experiencing other cultures could have on their lives, nor imagined that they would have a chance to experience the places we learn about in class before graduating high school. Would this opportunity not change your life for the better, forever? We encourage our kids to dream big, learn as much as they can, and be the best person they can be. At East Austin College Prep, we not only encourage these things, but we strive to give our students all the opportunities to do so. The students selected are all of Mexican descent and are as curious to learn more about how the country of Spain has impacted their lives as they are about whether or not they will fit in with people that are different from them. There is so much opportunity in traveling to grow as a person, and combined with a young and eager mind, the impact this trip will have is something that we cannot ever put a price on. 


Your contribution will not only help our students get to Spain, but it will change the way they see the world forever and empower them. If you yourself are a world traveler or have dreams of traveling the world someday, please consider contributing to our campaign. If you cannot contribute financially, please share our video with your fellow world travelers alike using the Indiegogo share tools! To learn more about our school, please visit our website!

 

From our hearts, thank you!

East Austin College Prep, Class of 2016

Jacqueline Vidal

story:
For English please see below!

Voyez ci-dessous pour la version française!



Tiyatro ve ben,

Merhaba,

Bu, genç bir ağacın sahneye çıkma ve meyve verme hayali üzerine bir yazı.

Ben Emre Yıldızlar, henüz sadece 24 yaşındayım. Burdur, Samsun, Kars ve Antalya'da yaşadıktan sonra, üniversite eğitimim için İstanbul'a gittim. Galatasaray Üniversitesi Fransız Dili ve Edebiyatı Bölümü'nü başarıyla bitirdim. Henüz yaş iken eğildim tiyatroya, hala eğiliyorum ve ağaç rolünü kapana kadar da eğilmeye devam edeceğim. Zira şimdiye kadar yuttuğum sahne tozu beni doyurmadı. Bugüne kadar birçok tiyatro atölyesine katıldım, oyun yazdım, kısa bir oyun yönettim, ödül aldım, ödül alamadım, Fransızca tiyatroda rol aldım, dekora, kostüme, ışığa, kısacası bir oyun izlediğinizde gördüğünüz her şeye elimden geldiğince katkıda bulundum. Bir de baktım ki okuldan çok tiyatroya vakit ayırıyorum, ama bana hala yetmiyor. Sonra kalktım, bir çay demledim ve dedim ki "Bu dünyada senin üreteceğin bir şey varsa o da tiyatro." Ufak bir uğraş böylece büyük bir hayale dönüştü. Ben de bu hayali gerçekleştirmeye koyuldum, çünkü o an erteleseydim, hala erteliyor ve yolun yarısına gelmemiş olacaktım. Hiçbir yere gelmemiş olacaktım, hala düşünüyor ama hareket etmiyor olacaktım. Hep yaptığımız gibi...Ama yolun yarısından geri dönmeye de niyetim yok.

Şu an ilk senesinin son sömestrinde olduğum okulun adı "Ecole Internationale de Theatre LASSAAD" (http://www.lassaad.com). Brüksel'de, dünyanın birçok ülkesinden gelen öğrencileri ağırlayan bu okul vücut, hareket ve maske tiyatrosu üzerine öğrencilerine 2 yıl süren yoğun bir eğitim veriyor. 

31 yıllık bu okulun ilk Türk öğrencisiyim. Fakat Türk olmak ve eğitim için tiyatroyu seçmiş olmak, maddi destek bulabilmek için yeterince büyük engeller. İlk seneyi, emekli memur olan babamın ve evde zaman zaman terzilik yapan annemin birikimleri ve abimin destekleriyle tamamlamak üzereyim. Fakat hayalimi yarıda bırakmamak için okulun ikinci ve son senesini de okuyup, artık meyve vermek üzere yola koyulmam gerek. Ve bunun için tek sıkıntı, ne 2. bir ailemin ne de bir memuriyet daha bekleyecek vaktimin olması. Bu yüzden, “çevremde bulunan sizlerden ve sizin çevrenizden oluşan geniş bir ailenin destekleriyle belki de hayalimi gerçekleştirebilirim”  düşüncesiyle bu projeyi sunmaya karar verdim.

Bağış

Hedefimi gerçekleştirmek için ihtiyacım olan okulun bir senelik ücreti : 4950 avro. Sitenin ve paypal'ın keseceği komisyon bana ait olacak. Brüksel'deki geçimimi ise (bir senedir vize talebim beklemede olduğu için resmi olarak bir işte çalışamasam da, öğrenci buldukça özel dil dersleri veriyorum.) kendim ve ailemin destekleriyle karşılamaya devam edeceğim. Hedefime ulaştığım ve okulu bitirdiğim takdirde, Türkiye'de henüz az tanınan bu tiyatro pedagojisini, Avrupa'nın diğer şehirlerinde benzer bir eğitim alan arkadaşlarımla birlikte Türkiye'de de yaymayı ve geliştirmeyi, sizin de desteklerinizle belki de bir tiyatro ormanı yaratmayı düşlüyoruz. Ayrıca, aldığım 2 yıllık eğitimin sonunda Jacques Lecoq tarafından yazılmış olan "Le Corps Poétique" eserini Türkçe'ye kazandırmayı hedefliyorum. 

Size nasıl teşekkür edeceğim

Bu düşü gerçekleştirmemde bana destek vermek isterseniz, paypal üzerinden yanda gördüğünüz veya sizin belirlediğiniz miktarlarda bağış yapabilirsiniz. 

Ben de bu bağışlarınız karşılığında size ayrı ayrı, tiyatroyla teşekkür etmek isterim: 

10 Avro - Yağmur Damlası

Biliyorum ki yağmur damlaları birikerek bir fidanı ağaca dönüştürecek. Ben de her yağmur damlası için herhangi bir sosyal medya hesabınıza, selam verdiğim bir fotoğraf göndererek teşekkür edeceğim.

25 Avro - Bir Bardak Su

Her susadığımda bana bir bardak su verecek insanlar olduğunu bilmek güzel. Ben de size, arkasında size özel bir not bulunan tiyatro temalı bir kartpostal atarak teşekkür edeceğim

50 Avro - Çeşmebaşı

Yorulup mola verdiğimde, çeşmebaşında bana soğuk su verip yola devam etmeme destek olduğunuz için teşekkürler. Ben de vardığım yerden size tiyatro temalı bir kartpostal ve kendim hazırlayacağım ufak bir hediye göndereceğim.

100 Avro - Yaz Yağmuru

Tam sıcaktan bunalmışken yağan bir yaz yağmuru ve arkasından açan gökkuşağı kadar değerli bu yardımınız için ben de size, içine size özel bir not yazacağım bir tiyatro oyunu göndereceğim ve ilerde dilediğiniz bir oyunuma benim davetlim olarak katılacaksınız.

500 Avro - Engin Deniz

Koca bir yokuşu tırmanırken tam "kayboldum" dediğiniz anda tepeye ulaştığınızda gördüğünüz deniz kadar umut dolu olduğunuz için teşekkürler. Bu kadar cömert bir yardım karşısında ben de size, sizin için özel olarak yapacağım bir tiyatro maskesi göndermek isterim. Ayrıca, gelebildiğiniz her oyunuma da davetlim olarak katılacaksınız.




Theater and me,

Hello,

My project is about planting a theater tree and growing it up. And this tree is me!

I am Emre Yıldızlar and I’m a 24 year-old young passionate with theater. After having lived in different cities of Turkey, I moved to İstanbul and studied French Literature in Galatasaray University. I put forth my roots on theater when I was really young and all I need now is some water that you can give me.

So far, I’ve participated in many workshops, written plays, put on a short play, got rewards and couldn’t get rewards, I performed in Turkish and in French, and I’ve tried my best to be helpful to anything you can see on a theater play (décor, lights, costumes, etc.) These are all my amateur experiences. But last year, when I was drinking my tea and thinking about my future like all of my undergraduate friends, I said to myself: “If there’s something that you can create in this world, it is theater.” While theater was an ordinary occupation, it occupied my whole life and became my dream. Thus, I set out to realize this dream. Because I know; if I had waited then, I would be waiting all my life… as we do all the time, as we don’t do anything…

As of now, I’m in the last trimester of the first year of “Ecole Internationale de Theatre LASSAAD” in Brussels. (http://www.lassaad.com). The education offered by the school to its international students from all over the world is based on the physical playing of the actor, movement and the mask theater. This special pedagogy is taught during 2 years in an intensive way.

I’m the first Turkish student of this 31 year-old school. However, being a Turkish and choosing theater as a career are two biggest obstacles if you want to have a scholarship. I cannot have a scholarship in Europe since I’m not European and there is no scholarship for theater studies in Turkey. But, these obstacles are not strong enough to stop me from realizing my dream. I paid the first year of the school with the help of my parents’ buildup. But unfortunately, I don’t have a second family for my second and last year at school. That’s why I launch this project and that’s why I try to create a second family consisting of you. In brief, that’s why I need your support. 

Funding

The amount I need to raise is 4950 euros which is the annual tuition fee of the school. After the commissions of the website and Paypal, I’ll get more or less 4500 euros. I will make my living by working this summer and next year during the school. Upon reaching my goal of finishing this school, I dream - with my other friends who are studying theater in different cities in Europe – of introducing and spreading this pedagogy in Turkey where it is not well known yet. Therefore, any support that you can give me will help us grow up a theater forest! I hope that you consider giving some water to this tree. Besides, at the end of my 2 years education, I'm planning to translate the masterpiece called "The Moving Body" written by Jacques Lecoq into Turkish.

How will I thank you

I created five different categories for the donations, but you are free to modify the amount. And in return, I would like to thank you with theater.




Théâtre et moi,

Bonjour,

Mon projet, le voici, je veux planter un arbre, un arbre de théâtre que je pourrais nourrir, arroser.

Et… Cet arbre c'est moi!

Je suis Emre Yıldızlar, un jeune de 24 ans passionné par le théâtre. Apres avoir vécu dans différentes villes en Turquie, je suis allé à İstanbul où j’ai étudié la Littérature Française à l’Université de Galatasaray.

J’ai commencé à prendre racine dans le théâtre alors que j’étais tout jeune et ce dont j’ai besoin, maintenant, c'est d'un peu d’eau, l'eau que vous pourrez me donner.

Jusqu’à présent, j’ai participé à des ateliers, j’ai écrit des pièces, j’ai aussi mis un spectacle en scène et j’ai obtenu des prix. J’ai joué en turc et en français, et j’ai fait de mon mieux pour aider à tout ce qui peut contribuer à la réalisation d'un spectacle (décor, lumières, costumes, etc.). Toutes mes expériences furent en tant qu'amateur, on peut dire cela.

Mais l’année dernière, alors que je buvais mon thé, un de ces matins, j'ai pensé à mon avenir, comme tous mes amis étudiants, (comme beaucoup d'étudiants en fait!) et je me suis dit «S’il y a un moyen de créer, de sublimer les choses, pour moi, dans ce monde, ce sera grâce au théâtre ».

Alors que le théâtre était un simple passe-temps pour moi, il a occupé toute ma vie et il est devenu mon rêve. Ainsi, je me suis mis à réaliser mon rêve. Parce que j'ai su à ce moment-là que je ne pouvais plus attendre, que si j'attendais encore je serais encore en train d’attendre aujourd'hui. Comme on le fait tout le temps, comme on ne fait rien qu’attendre…

Voilà, à présent, je suis au dernier trimestre de la première année de « L’Ecole Internationale de Théâtre LASSAAD » à Bruxelles. (http://www.lassaad.com). Elle propose un enseignement théâtral basé surle mouvement, l'art de la maîtrise du corps et du jeu.


Une formation intensive de 2 ans, offrant un parcours allant du Masque Neutre au jeu, à travers tous les styles : Pantomime, Bandes dessinées, Cinéma muet, Mélodrame, Mélomime, Conteur, Tragédie, Commedia dell'Arte, Bouffons, Clowns, Masques expressifs et larvaires...

Je suis le premier élève turc de cette école de 31 ans d'existence. Pourtant, être un turc et choisir le théâtre en tant que profession sont de grands obstacles si vous voulez demander une bourse.

En effet, je ne peux pas obtenir une bourse en Europe parce que je ne suis pas européen et il n’y a pas de bourses en Turquie pour les études pratiques théâtrales. Mais pourtant ces obstacles ne m’empêcheront pas de réaliser mon rêve. J’ai payé la première année grâce aux épargnes de ma famille. Malheureusement je n’ai pas de deuxième famille pour la deuxième et dernière année de l’école!

Ainsi j’ai lancé ce projet afin de créer ma deuxième famille, vous.

J’ai besoin de votre soutien.

Donations

La somme dont j'ai besoin s'élève à 4950 euros, cette somme recouvre les frais d'une année d'enseignement à l'école Lassâad. Apres les commissions du site et Paypal, je recevrai plus ou moins 4500 euros.

Aussi, je vais travailler cet été ainsi que l’année prochaine, en dehors de l’école, pour gagner ma vie et subvenir aux frais extérieurs. Si je peux atteindre mon but dans ce projet, je rêve, avec mes amis étudiant en théâtre, tous dans différentes villes d’Europe, d’introduire et propager cette pédagogie spéciale en Turquie aussi. Ainsi, tout le soutien que vous pourrez me donner nous permettra de créer une forêt de théâtre. En plus, a la fin des études de 2eme année, je bute de traduire "Le Corps Poétique" de Jacques Lecoq en turc.

J’espère que ce projet vous donne envie de nourrir mon arbre. 

Comment vous remercierai-je?

J’ai mis cinq catégories différentes pour les donations mais vous êtes libre de modifier le montant que vous voulez donner. En retour, c'est à travers le théâtre que j’aimerais vous remercier :  

10 euros – Goutte de pluie

Je sais que les gouttes de pluie vont tomber et faire grandir cet arbre.

Pour chaque goutte de pluie j’aimerais vous remercier en vous envoyant une photo où je vous salue comme je le ferai sur scène.

25 euros – Un verre d’eau

C’est bien de savoir qu’il y a des gens qui vont me donner un verre d’eau chaque fois que j’ai soif.

 Pour vous remercier, je vous enverrai une carte postale avec un thème concernant le théâtre.

50 euros – Fontaine

Merci d’être là et de me soutenir chaque fois que je suis fatigué et que je donne prend une pause à cote d'une fontaine. 

Je vous enverrai une carte postale avec un thème concernant le théâtre et un cadeau fait main pour vous remercier.

100 euros – Pluie d’été

Ce soutien est aussi précieux que la pluie d’été qui arrive avec l'arc-en-ciel.

Afin de vous remercier pour ce soutien, je vous enverrai une pièce de théâtre dans laquelle je mettrai un mot pour vous et vous serez mon invité à l’un de mes futurs spectacles.

500 euros – Océan

Votre aide est plein d’espoir comme le moment où vous arrivez à l’océan après avoir monté une colline en pensant que vous êtes perdu. En retour de cet aide très généreuse, je vous enverrai un masque de théâtre que je ferai pour vous et vous serez mon invité dans mes futurs spectacles.

olacak. Brüksel'deki geçimimi ise (bir senedir vize talebim beklemede olduğu
için resmi olarak bir işte çalışamasam da, öğrenci buldukça özel dil dersleri
veriyorum.) kendim ve ailemin destekleriyle karşılamaya devam edeceğim.
Hedefime ulaştığım ve okulu bitirdiğim takdirde, Türkiye'de henüz az tanınan bu
tiyatro pedagojisini, Avrupa'nın diğer şehirlerinde benzer bir eğitim alan
arkadaşlarımla birlikte Türkiye'de de yaymayı ve geliştirmeyi, sizin de
desteklerinizle belki de bir tiyatro ormanı yaratmayı düşlüyoruz. Ayrıca, aldığım 2 yıllık eğitimin sonunda Jacques Lecoq tarafından yazılmış olan "Le Corps Poétique" eserini Türkçe'ye kazandırmayı hedefliyorum.  
Size nasıl teşekkür edeceğimBu düşü gerçekleştirmemde bana destek vermek
isterseniz, paypal üzerinden yanda gördüğünüz veya sizin belirlediğiniz
miktarlarda bağış yapabilirsiniz. Ben de bu bağışlarınız karşılığında size ayrı ayrı,
tiyatroyla teşekkür etmek isterim: 10 Avro - Yağmur DamlasıBiliyorum
ki yağmur damlaları birikerek bir fidanı ağaca dönüştürecek. Ben de her yağmur
damlası için herhangi bir sosyal medya hesabınıza, selam verdiğim bir fotoğraf
göndererek teşekkür edeceğim.25 Avro - Bir Bardak SuHer
susadığımda bana bir bardak su verecek insanlar olduğunu bilmek güzel. Ben de
size, arkasında size özel bir not bulunan tiyatro temalı bir kartpostal atarak
teşekkür edeceğim50 Avro - ÇeşmebaşıYorulup
mola verdiğimde, çeşmebaşında bana soğuk su verip yola devam etmeme destek
olduğunuz için teşekkürler. Ben de vardığım yerden size tiyatro temalı bir
kartpostal ve kendim hazırlayacağım ufak bir hediye göndereceğim.100 Avro - Yaz YağmuruTam
sıcaktan bunalmışken yağan bir yaz yağmuru ve arkasından açan gökkuşağı kadar
değerli bu yardımınız için ben de size, içine size özel bir not yazacağım bir tiyatro oyunu göndereceğim ve ilerde dilediğiniz bir oyunuma benim davetlim olarak
katılacaksınız.500 Avro - Engin DenizKoca bir
yokuşu tırmanırken tam "kayboldum" dediğiniz anda tepeye
ulaştığınızda gördüğünüz deniz kadar umut dolu olduğunuz için teşekkürler. Bu
kadar cömert bir yardım karşısında ben de size, sizin için özel olarak
yapacağım bir tiyatro maskesi göndermek isterim. Ayrıca, gelebildiğiniz her oyunuma da davetlim olarak
katılacaksınız.
Theater and me,Hello,My project is about planting a theater tree and growing it up. And this tree is me!I am Emre Yıldızlar and I’m a 24 year-old young passionate with theater. After having lived in different cities of Turkey, I moved to İstanbul and studied French Literature in Galatasaray University. I put forth my roots on theater when I was really young and all I need now is some water that you can give me.So far, I’ve participated in many workshops, written plays, put on a short play, got rewards and couldn’t get rewards, I performed in Turkish and in French, and I’ve tried my best to be helpful to anything you can see on a theater play (décor, lights, costumes, etc.) These are all my amateur experiences. But last year, when I was drinking my tea and thinking about my future like all of my undergraduate friends, I said to myself: “If there’s something that you can create in this world, it is theater.” While theater was an ordinary occupation, it occupied my whole life and became my dream. Thus, I set out to realize this dream. Because I know; if I had waited then, I would be waiting all my life… as we do all the time, as we don’t do anything…As of now, I’m in the last trimester of the first year of “Ecole Internationale de Theatre LASSAAD” in Brussels. (http://www.lassaad.com). The education offered by the school to its international students from all over the world is based on the physical playing of the actor, movement and the mask theater. This special pedagogy is taught during 2 years in an intensive way.I’m the first Turkish student of this 31 year-old school. However, being a Turkish and choosing theater as a career are two biggest obstacles if you want to have a scholarship. I cannot have a scholarship in Europe since I’m not European and there is no scholarship for theater studies in Turkey. But, these obstacles are not strong enough to stop me from realizing my dream. I paid the first year of the school with the help of my parents’ buildup. But unfortunately, I don’t have a second family for my second and last year at school. That’s why I launch this project and that’s why I try to create a second family consisting of you. In brief, that’s why I need your support. FundingThe amount I need to raise is 4950 euros which is the annual tuition fee of the school. After the commissions of the website and Paypal, I’ll get more or less 4500 euros. I will make my living by working this summer and next year during the school. Upon reaching my goal of finishing this school, I dream - with my other friends who are studying theater in different cities in Europe – of introducing and spreading this pedagogy in Turkey where it is not well known yet. Therefore, any support that you can give me will help us grow up a theater forest! I hope that you consider giving some water to this tree. Besides, at the end of my 2 years education, I'm planning to translate the masterpiece called "The Moving Body" written by Jacques Lecoq into Turkish. How will I thank youI created five different categories for the donations, but you are free to modify the amount. And in return, I would like to thank you with theater.Théâtre et moi,
Bonjour,
Mon projet, le voici, je veux planter un
arbre, un arbre de théâtre que je pourrais nourrir, arroser.
Et… Cet arbre c'est moi!
Je suis Emre Yıldızlar, un jeune de 24 ans
passionné par le théâtre. Apres avoir vécu dans différentes villes en Turquie,
je suis allé à İstanbul où j’ai étudié la Littérature Française à l’Université
de Galatasaray.
J’ai commencé à prendre racine dans le
théâtre alors que j’étais tout jeune et ce dont j’ai besoin, maintenant, c'est
d'un peu d’eau, l'eau que vous pourrez me donner.
Jusqu’à présent, j’ai participé à des
ateliers, j’ai écrit des pièces, j’ai aussi mis un spectacle en scène et j’ai obtenu
des prix. J’ai joué en turc et en français, et j’ai fait de mon mieux pour
aider à tout ce qui peut contribuer à la réalisation d'un spectacle (décor,
lumières, costumes, etc.). Toutes mes expériences furent en tant qu'amateur,
on peut dire cela.
Mais l’année dernière, alors que je buvais mon
thé, un de ces matins, j'ai pensé à mon avenir, comme tous mes amis étudiants,
(comme beaucoup d'étudiants en fait!) et je me suis dit «S’il y a un moyen de
créer, de sublimer les choses, pour moi, dans ce monde, ce sera grâce au
théâtre ».
Alors que le théâtre était un simple
passe-temps pour moi, il a occupé toute ma vie et il est devenu mon rêve.
Ainsi, je me suis mis à réaliser mon rêve. Parce que j'ai su à ce moment-là que
je ne pouvais plus attendre, que si j'attendais encore je serais encore en
train d’attendre aujourd'hui. Comme on le fait tout le temps, comme on ne fait
rien qu’attendre…
Voilà, à présent, je suis au dernier
trimestre de la première année de « L’Ecole Internationale de Théâtre
LASSAAD » à Bruxelles. (http://www.lassaad.com). Elle propose un
enseignement théâtral basé surle mouvement, l'art de
la maîtrise du corps et du jeu.
Une formation intensive de 2 ans, offrant un parcours allant du Masque Neutre au jeu, à
travers tous les styles : Pantomime, Bandes dessinées, Cinéma muet, Mélodrame,
Mélomime, Conteur, Tragédie, Commedia dell'Arte, Bouffons, Clowns, Masques
expressifs et larvaires...
Je suis le premier élève turc de cette école de 31 ans
d'existence. Pourtant, être un turc et choisir le théâtre en tant que
profession sont de grands obstacles si vous voulez demander une bourse.
En effet, je ne peux pas obtenir une bourse en Europe parce que je
ne suis pas européen et il n’y a pas de bourses en Turquie pour les études
pratiques théâtrales. Mais pourtant ces obstacles ne m’empêcheront pas de
réaliser mon rêve. J’ai payé la première année grâce aux épargnes de ma
famille. Malheureusement je n’ai pas de deuxième famille pour la deuxième et
dernière année de l’école!
Ainsi j’ai lancé ce projet afin de créer ma deuxième famille,
vous.
J’ai besoin de votre soutien. 
Donations
La somme dont j'ai besoin s'élève à 4950
euros, cette somme recouvre les frais d'une année d'enseignement à l'école
Lassâad. Apres les commissions du site et Paypal, je recevrai plus ou moins
4500 euros.
Aussi, je vais travailler cet été ainsi que
l’année prochaine, en dehors de l’école, pour gagner ma vie et subvenir aux
frais extérieurs. Si je peux atteindre mon but dans ce projet, je rêve, avec
mes amis étudiant en théâtre, tous dans différentes villes d’Europe,
d’introduire et propager cette pédagogie spéciale en Turquie aussi. Ainsi, tout
le soutien que vous pourrez me donner nous permettra de créer une forêt de
théâtre. En plus, a la fin des études de 2eme année, je bute de traduire "Le Corps Poétique" de Jacques Lecoq en turc.
J’espère que ce projet vous donne envie de
nourrir mon arbre.  

Comment vous
remercierai-je?
J’ai mis cinq catégories différentes pour
les donations mais vous êtes libre de modifier le montant que vous voulez
donner. En retour, c'est à travers le théâtre que j’aimerais vous remercier :
 
10 euros – Goutte de pluie
Je sais que les gouttes de pluie vont
tomber et faire grandir cet arbre.
Pour chaque goutte de pluie j’aimerais vous
remercier en vous envoyant une photo où je vous salue comme je le ferai sur
scène.
25 euros – Un verre d’eau
C’est bien de savoir qu’il y a des gens qui
vont me donner un verre d’eau chaque fois que j’ai soif.
 Pour
vous remercier, je vous enverrai une carte postale avec un thème concernant le
théâtre.
50 euros – Fontaine
Merci d’être là et de me soutenir chaque
fois que je suis fatigué et que je donne prend une pause à cote d'une
fontaine.  
Je vous enverrai une carte postale avec un
thème concernant le théâtre et un cadeau fait main pour vous remercier.
100 euros – Pluie d’été
Ce soutien est aussi précieux que la pluie
d’été qui arrive avec l'arc-en-ciel.
Afin de vous remercier pour ce soutien, je
vous enverrai une pièce de théâtre dans laquelle je mettrai un mot pour vous et
vous serez mon invité à l’un de mes futurs spectacles.
500 euros – Océan
Votre aide est plein d’espoir comme le
moment où vous arrivez à l’océan après avoir monté une colline en pensant que
vous êtes perdu. En retour de cet aide très généreuse, je vous enverrai un
masque de théâtre que je ferai pour vous et vous serez mon invité dans mes
futurs spectacles.

story:
Short Summary

  • Idle No More Central Oklahoma is an inclusive, peaceful, grassroots movement committed to positive change through education, conservation, solidarity and reciprocity, acting by consensus. We raise awareness about issues that impact Indigenous people and seek positive change for our communities.
  • We realize that our community and potential allies need to know what our concerns and need are. We understand that positive change begins with education. Native Voices Symposium will offer education about the Indian Child Welfare Act, Removing Barriers to Higher Education, Protecting Turtle Island, Mass Incarceration and the importance of voting. This symposium will generate new ideas, offer opportunities to get involved and build community.
  • This Symposium will spread our ideas and concerns to beyond our 700 Facebook members and will reach many more people, who can then interact with our members in person, creating a more lasting and solid network.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $1000: $325 to rent the facility, $350 for speakers lunch and gift, $150 for publications and $175 for supplies.
  • We will be giving for perks: Check out the perks to the right!
  • Our sincere thanks for helping us educate and strive for positive change.

The Impact

The ripple effect that Native Voices Symposium will have cannot be measured or underestimated. The power of an educated body of people is tremendous and the needs of our community are great. When these two merge, we can expect to see great things like an increase of Native voters, educated and involved citizens who advocate for our planet and the marginalized and a future generation that will benefit.

  • In the past year since we were founded, we have become the largest and most active Idle No More group in the State of Oklahoma. We have started a Youth Group, a Video Production Class and a now a Peer Counseling Class. This symposium will allow us to bring more people in who want to start new projects.
  • Check out our Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/INMCentralOK/

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign in your area and network.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Chris Hartmann. I am in school studying Natural Resource Conservation. As a student, I am unfortunately very broke. Between a full course load and weekend trips for a class that I am TA'ing for or a senior project I have very little time to work.

With your help, I will be able to afford taking the GRE (similar to the SAT but on a graduate level) and the application fees to apply for grad school. You will also be helping me afford the plane tickets to Belize for a study abroad trip where I will continue to gain valuable experience in my field as well as make connections in an area that I wish to continue working.

What is Needed

Here is the break down of costs:

  • $200 to take the GRE.
  • $50 for grad school application fees
  • $800 for plane tickets to Belize (the rest of the trip is paid for by the generosity of my professors who have freed up funds for me to go).

The rest is to help me get through the semester and for spending money once in Belize. 

What You Get

Every person that donates over $75 will receive a photo from my trip to Belize of his or her choice printed out in 8x10 with a personal thank you note accompanying it.

story:
Short Summary

We are Niña and Abi, budding wildlife biologists from the Philippines. Niña is a young instructor in a university in the Philippines, teaching wildlife ecology and conservation. Her interests are on the study of bats and small mammals. On the other hand, Abi is currently a full-time masters student, studying frogs and reptiles and at the same time a museum volunteer. Though both of us are specializing in different groups of animals, we both have the same goal: to learn, understand, and protect the endangered species of our country.

Among over a hundred applicants from across the globe, only 26 students and young researchers were accepted in the 8th Advanced Fieldcourse in Ecology and Conservation at Xishuangbanna Tropical Botanical Garden (XTBG), China which will take place on October 9 – November 20, 2016. We were fortunate to be the representative of the Philippines in this intensive field course.

 

The field course will focus on field research methods, which includes research design, sampling, data analysis, and among others. We personally want to learn more about the use of the statistical tool R, GIS, and spatial modelling. We believe that this training will greatly help us in our future works in ecology and conservation.

To know more about the field course, please see link below.

http://www.pfs-tropasia.org/2016/05/afec-x-2016...

What We Need & What You Get

The $3000 that we are raising will be used for the plane ticket, food and accommodation (for 6 weeks), visa application, insurance, and other incidental expenses. Here is where the $3000 will go:

(1) roundtrip ticket from Manila to Xishuangbanna (through China Southern Airlines) - $700  each (=$1400 for 2)

(2) accommodation (for 6 weeks) - $500 each (=$1000 for 2)

(3) visa application - $50 each (=$100 for 2)

(4) travel insurance - $50 each (=$100 for 2)

(5) incidental expenses - $400

For the organizer's counterpart, they granted us scholarship for the course fee/tuition fee and meals (for 6 weeks). 

Rest assured that all of the funding that we will generate will be used to attend in this once in a lifetime experience. If unluckily we don't reach our entire goal of raising $3000, the funds from those generous backers will be used to at least pay for the airfare. If luckily we raise the entire $3000, exciting perks will be given to our generous backers. We will assure you that you will enjoy the nature trip in the Philippines if you will donate $1000. :)

The Impact

As young wildlife biologists in the Philippines, we have the responsibility to contribute to the understanding of ecology and conservation of Philippine biodiversity. Through this intensive field course and training, we will be equipped with new techniques in field studies, especially the latest techniques in data analysis that could contribute to have a quality results publishable to reputable journals. The knowledge that we will learn from these field studies will contribute to scientific-backed conservation and management that could help in making policies to conserve the dwindling biodiversity. Aside from the scientific aspect, we want to build relationships and collaborations with our co-participants and instructors from across the globe who could help us improve our future conservation works in the Philippines.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make any financial contribution you can still help us by letting your networks know of our plea for assistance. A simple like and share will greatly help. :)

story:
Our Story

Hello! I'm Dana Stackpole and my business partner is Dawn Smith-Theodore.  We met 33 years ago in New York City, both with stars in our eyes and the dream to become professional dancers.  Well, both Dawn and I were fortunate enough to attain that goal. I became a classical ballerina with the American Ballet Theater and then later with the San Francisco Ballet.  I then transitioned into Broadway and spent a decade dancing my heart out in such Tony award winning shows as Contact, Movin' Out , Carousel, On the Town and Phantom of the Opera.  Dawn became an international performer and worked side by side with the legendary Henry LeTang.  She then followed in her mother's footsteps and has been a studio owner for the last 25 years.  33 years later, We've come back together to create Cross Pointe Dance, A Master Class Series and Performance opportunity for Young Dancers across the nation.   Our goal is to give the young  dancers of today, who have the same dream we had, the opportunity to achieve that dream.  Our focus is to give them the best training and to help nurture the artist within.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to achieve this!  That is why we are on Indiegogo.  We are looking to raise $25,000 to help us secure the venues and theaters for our Master Classes and performances around the nation.  It is necessary to put deposits down on these venues way in advance of our events.  Without studios we have no where to teach the dancers and without a stage they have no where to perform.  So we are asking you to help us procure these venues so the young dancers of today may be able to spread their wings and take flight.  Your contributions will be helping to catapult the young artists of today and help them achieve their dreams.  No amount is too small, every dollar counts!  $1 to $10,000!  We have some great perks for your contributions.  Please check out on the side bar.

    The Impact

    Dawn and I both feel strongly that the artistry of dance is being lost to the competition world of dance. Our program does not have the element of competition and is totally focused on letting the dancer find the artist within themselves in a nurturing environment. They are not being judged but nudged to explore who they are in our classes as well as the performance.  They will have the opportunity to learn from the best of the best in dance as our faculty ranges from the classical realm to film, television and the stages of Broadway. 

      Risks & Challenges

      We know that one of our biggest challenges is fighting the trophy.  Yes, Competition is part of the world of dance and has its place but Dawn and I harken back to the days where the competition was you trying to be the best dancer you can be, not better then someone else and not to win a prize!  

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know that not everyone has the means to help monetarily but if you can spread the word to friends and family it would be greatly appreciated. You can also share on Facebook, twitter and instagram.

  The Impact Dawn and I both feel strongly that the artistry of dance is being lost to the competition world of dance. Our program does not have the element of competition and is totally focused on letting the dancer find the artist within themselves in a nurturing environment. They are not being judged but nudged to explore who they are in our classes as well as the performance.  They will have the opportunity to learn from the best of the best in dance as our faculty ranges from the classical realm to film, television and the stages of Broadway. 

  Risks & Challenges We know that one of our biggest challenges is fighting the trophy.  Yes, Competition is part of the world of dance and has its place but Dawn and I harken back to the days where the competition was you trying to be the best dancer you can be, not better then someone else and not to win a prize!  
  Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone has the means to help monetarily but if you can spread the word to friends and family it would be greatly appreciated. You can also share on Facebook, twitter and instagram.

story:
Short Summary

Saint Lucia has always been a place rich in culture and heritage: Our communities today, are home to many a creative soul, but there is a lot of work needed to really complement and support the efforts of the musicians, artists, writers, dancers, crafters, storytellers; film-makers and others who are the voices of Saint Lucian culture.

Culture and heritage have the power to contribute so much to our quality of life: to enrich our communities and benefit our economy, inspire our youth and bond Saint Lucians around the globe! By investing in these areas, we will realize tremendous value for Saint Lucians.

Everyone who loves Saint Lucia is part of the future of our culture – let’s join together to not just keep our culture alive, but to go all the way – build the love, understanding and celebration of Saint Lucian Arts & Culture in the generations to come!

CDF’s work is funded in part by a subvention from the Government of Saint Lucia – but our plans for our work go so far beyond what the Government can invest in us … we need your support, so we’re reaching out to you with this, our first Crowd Funding Campaign where you can make a real difference by investing and helping us reach …and surpass!... our funding goals!

The funds raised in our first campaign will go towards the costs of our innovative Summer of the Arts Programme detailed below – but your support will go much further than just this programme – it will demonstrate the passion the world has for our culture and that will speak volumes to all who contribute to our funding and support – Government, private sector, funding agencies and individuals.

We invite you to join us in building this community - on our website www.cdfstlucia.org where we will be inviting guests to blog about culture and arts and what it means to them; at www.facebook.com/cdfstlucia where you can post and discuss all that relates to Saint Lucian culture too; at http://www.twitter.com/CDFSaintLucia as well…let’s build for Saint Lucia’s future!


What We Need & What You Get

“Summer Of The Arts” is a new collection of programs that support arts, culture, and heritage in communities and on stages across Saint Lucia from July 23 to September 9  and is managed by the Cultural Development Foundation of Saint Lucia.

“Summer Of The Arts” has received generous support from several local entities - SLTB, Ministry of Tourism,  and Ministry of Social Transformation, however we are still short of our target to cover some of the major technical costs which include facilitators, venues and supplies. We need an additional US$26,000.00 in order to defray these costs and as such, we are seeking your support.

Your assistance and participation in the re-sensitization of Saint Lucians, particularly its youth, will ensure that Saint Lucian traditions and cultural heritage is passed on to generations to come.

We want Summer Of The Arts to become a movement - one that you can be a part of.   We seek your collaboration in this venture because:

  • We are proud of our heritage;

  • We recognize the value of creative  expression and because;

  • We know that our youth have their own stories and we want the world to listen to their youthful accounts. 

The Perks

We want to raise as much money as possible to reach as many young people in Saint Lucia through the Summer Of The Arts. To do that, we're offering some really cool products, goodies, and services, including:

  • A digital download of the “Seven Wallpapers from the Helen of the West”-Beautiful images donated by super-generous photographers from Saint Lucia.

  • A digital download of  “Helen of the West” 18-month Digital Desktop Calendar- 18 beautiful pages of photographs donated by super-generous photographers from Saint Lucia, with a discreet calendar inserted for each month.


  • Copy of the Joyce Auguste Collection: The Magic of “Sesenne”-Dame Marie Selipha Descartes.

  • A digital download of a new compilation of Saint Lucian writing/e-book, “Summer with Helen”.

  • Copy of "A Special Christmas Gift"-A collection of Christmas short stories.

  • Mystery book bundles, filled with a selection of novels and anthologies.

And, for those of you who are new to IndieGoGo, you can have as many perks as you’re willing to pay for. You have to do each as a separate transaction, but you don’t have to limit yourself to just one. It’s a whole new ballgame over here.

We'll be sending things out after the campaign as they come back from production, or arrive in the office from the awesome people who are donating them. If we need to collect any additional information from you, we’ll contact you for it once the campaign has ended. We'll keep you updated with the progress of things as the fundraiser goes on, and afterward.

We’re confident that all perks will be delivered in time for the holidays.


The Impact

Creativity

Artists and cultural communities contribute to the quality of life in Saint Lucia. Recognizing the importance of this role, the Cultural Development Foundation offers opportunities in support of artistic works and cultural projects. Summer of the Arts this year will host the book launch of, "Sounding Ground" by Vladimir Lucien, a son of the soil on July 30.  On July 31-August 30, an exhibition featuring the works of promising artists Fiona Compton, Jallim Eudovique and Luigi St. Omer will take place.

Culture

Throughout Saint Lucia, there are buildings, places and stories that connect us to the past. Recognizing the importance of preserving and sharing these vital heritage links, the CDF supports the collection, preservation and interpretation of historic assets. Through the Summer of the Arts programme we will engage our youth and cultivate an environment that maintains and celebrates the native heritage, language, culture and experience of Saint Lucia. Youth Summer Arts Platform is a series of training workshops that brings three weeks of culturally diverse programming to young people across Saint Lucia. The training workshops run from July 23 until August 15 and will take place in theatres, clubs, parks, streets and other spaces around the island.

The training begins with workshops which focus on the development of skills in various areas of arts and culture.

Main Training Areas:

  1. Dance – hip-hip, African, street, folk,  salsa, break dancing, quadrille – ring games
  2. Theatre Arts – drama and music (related to dramatic piece) – acting techniques, stage positions, improvisations, genres of acting, mood,
  3. Creative Writing – poetry, prose, performance poetry, script writing
  4. Craft – costume making (masks, jewelry, headpieces, puppetry, t-shirt art and designing), instrument making
  5. Art – Stage make-up: development of concept, types of make-up etc
  6.  Photography-shooting, editing, publishing
  7. Drumming

Participants in the Youth Summer Arts Platform will receive transcripts which will specify their selected areas of training.  After having participated for three (3) years, trainees will receive certificates which endorse their completion of the programme. Their certificates will qualify them for future advanced youth programmes as well as accredit them as youth trainers.

The final element of the Youth Summer Arts Platform is the staging of a theatrical production in keeping with the theme – “Young artistes – Our Thing”. The trainees will develop a storyline which focuses on the importance of preserving our unique Saint Lucian culture and heritage.

Community

Developing partnerships, creating jobs and fostering sustainability contribute to a community’s health, well-being and social prosperity. To support these activities, the Summer of the Arts programme will enhance assets such as facilities, public places and programs so as to increase and encourage cultural competency among our youth and the public through the medium of experience based learning. 

“Emancipation to La Woz” gives the populace an opportunity to re-familiarize ourselves with our history with the presentation of facts  and to challenge our perspectives in this period of globalization whilst maintaining our Saint Lucian identity. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, there are many other ways you can help us. If you would like to show your support for the belief in developing the appreciation of Saint Lucian arts and culture in our youth, please consider getting involved in any of the following ways:

  • Attend our events - be part of our community, volunteer, say hi and get to know us - let us get to know you!
  • Spread the word online - share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog or anywhere else online:  igg.me/at/SummerOfTheArts 
  • Talk to your friends – discuss the ideas behind Youth Summer Arts Platform with those you know, like co-workers - send us your ideas!
  • Like us on Facebook, and follow us onTwitter to stay on top of everything we do and chat with us

story:
Free education is not an abstract idea. Countries all across the world offer free education and some of those who introduced fees, like Germany, have since removed them realising their failings.

 

Free education is one of the ways to help those most shutout in society into the education system and, that no student deserves to leave education crippled by debt.

We know that despite their own research highlighting their flaws, our government have no intention of removing fees.  In fact, they want to allow the opposite- for them to skyrocket even further out of control. Sitting down and asking nicely is not going to achieve our goal. We need to hype up the pressure, get all of our students involved and make the government listen.

We know this is an issue students care about, in 2012 Edinburgh brought the most students from anywhere outside of London and the Students' Association has more policies on this than anything else. We also know that while students care not all of them can afford a trip to London so, by contributing to travel costs you can ensure that students are able to partake in the demo.

story:
After the fourth year of the Syrian crisis, the world seems to have forgotten about the silent victims of the conflict. While the number of refugees continue to climb, and despite the fact their needs are increasing, humanitarian aid and relief program are in decline . 

The Syrian refugees who have settled in the Bekaa valley and Akkar are among the most vulnerable to enduring inhumane conditions due to the harsh winter climate in the area, and a decline in winterization initiatives provided by the international community to help them cope. 


This project aims to continue Basmeh & Zeitooneh's winterization campaign to assist families of Syrian refugees residing in makeshift camps in the Bekaa valley and Akkar to cope with the harsh winter conditions through the distribution of heating fuel, firewoods, bread, matresses and blankets. Basmeh and Zeitooneh hopes that by providing refugees with these basic goods, we can protect the refugees against the effects of the harsh winter in the Bekaa Valley.

We are also seeking to launch a communal soup kitchen to provide nourishment to the most vulnerable families of refugees residing in the Bekaa Valley. Due to the fact many of the families do not have access to kitchen equipped to make hot meals or the income to secure nourishing food for their families, there is an inherent need to protect these families from malnourishment during the winter.

story:
Hello.

My name is Phil Harrison Stowers and I am a single, 55 year old person living here in Gainesville, Georgia. I have earned a Bachelor of Education degree, a master of Science degree in mental health counseling and hold an international Teaching English as a Foreign Language certificate from ITTPrague, Czech Republic. I am a member of Chi Sigma Iota national honor society and graduated summa cum laude from my educational studies. One of my professional goals is to earn a Ph.D. research degree in Linguistics from Oxford University.

I taught in Prague back in 2008 and was sent into Panasonic, PriceWaterhouseCoopers, and Ceska Sporitelna to teach middle and upper management employees the English language.  In addition, I taught private students. I have two job offers there. They are waiting on me to return.

I have been a teacher for many years and have lived in Mexico, Morocco, and the Czech Republic. When I was in the Czech Republic teaching, I fell in love with the culture, the city, and my students. The students are typically stoic and a bit restrained, but they eventually opened up to me and the learning process. I made many friends there and they still Skype with me. Many of them have had children. They ask me when I am coming back. 

The Czech Republic has been a republic for a while now and the citizens there understand the value of learning English as it is, among other things the international language of business. 

I am a teacher at heart. I sincerely believe by teaching English as a Second Language to students, I am increasing their opportunity to succeed in life. We humans are communicators and knowing how to teach English gives others the skill set they need to become all they were intended to be in this life. Language is power. Those who know how to use that language will have power to grow, power to live, and power to succeed!

Every school and every company that has hired me has given me positive evaluations. My students have declared things such as, "Mr. Phil is very concerned about me as a person." or "Mr. Stowers is really engaging, funny, and interesting." Many of them have said they learned more about English as a result of my teaching methods.

The reason I am putting this campaign on Indiegogo is because I have not been able to find employment here in America. I am registered on www.seriousteachers.com and have job offers around the world. But, I don't appear to be able to land a position in this economic environment.

  1. I need money for the plane ticket. I use www.studentuniverse.com for tickets and prices are ranging from $615.00 to $779.00 one way, depending on time of day and day of the week. This price range is dated for Oct 1, 2014. If it is possible to give away frequent flyer miles, that would work also.
  2. I need the deposit for an apartment. I have found a roommate situation and had this before when I was in Prague. I found the situation here-www.expats.cz. The deposit is $450.00 and the first month's rent is $450.00. By the way, this is a relatively inexpensive rent as I chose to live in Prague 3, or the area farthest from the city center. The closer to the city center one lives, the more expensive accommodation may be. 
  3. I would like to get my name on the Zivnostintsky List. This is a trade license. The definition of TRADE means I would be an independent, self-employed person with the purpose of making a profit. This cost is approximately 8500czk or $400.00.
  4. I need $1000.00 for food, personal needs, unforeseen expenditures and a year transportation pass on the trains/trams. The transportation cost is currently 4,750 CZK or $225.00 for one year.  A monthly pass may also be purchased for 550 CZK or approx $26.00. A pass is necessary as I usually have to travel to companies and private students all over the city.

Grand Total: $3080.00(approx.)

story:
The Basics

If you are reading this you are likely aware of the tough times I’ve been having lately. For those who don’t, the tl;dr is basically that I’ve been struggling to finish my degree at the college of my dreams because of financial troubles. My parents can only do so much to help, and I feel very uncomfortable asking anyone else for a co-signature on a loan, because I never want to risk putting a person in a situation that may make things difficult for them. I had to take a year off, and struggle to get the money to find me a place in town (living off campus is ultimately cheaper, and I don’t need a meal plan that way). 
 My parents and I have worked tirelessly and managed to get the remaining balance down to 4000.00, and with my goal so close I don’t know what I would do to have to give up now. I’m not going to expect help from any one of you, mostly because you already have given me so much kindness, friendship, and even previous assistance. I just wanted to make everyone aware of the issues I am facing, and (as hard as it is on my pride) to ask that if anyone felt the desire to help me in any way in this trying time, that I’d be more than grateful to accept any donations given. 
 I finally wanted to finish by thanking everyone who has stuck around this long, you all mean so much to me and I find myself embarrassed to ask something like this from the people I respect more than anything and wish nothing less than to be a detriment to, I however find myself called by my desire to live the life I’d always dreamed of and I know that I can’t do it without swallowing that pride and asking for things that are out of my reach. I have big dreams, and admittedly lofty ambitions, and no matter what I’ll always keep fighting for those things.

What I can Give

I'm creative and driven, I am a good writer, a decent singer and musician, I know how to draw, to joke, to handle a broadsword, act, and even code a little. 
If you contribute, I cannot offer you anything I can't make, but I am willing to make personalized gifts of your choosing. I can write you a poem, sing you a song, record a drum solo, draw a picture featuring you riding a dinosaur, record your favorite scene in a movie (be kind and rewind-style) or something funny/crazy like chugging soy sauce and putting it on Youtube. My body and talents are as flexible as you are creative, and even my limitations will be padded with the humor of a job attempted with fervor.
And of course any contributor will get a personalized handwritten letter of thanks for what it's worth, because I am deeply thankful for all the assistance I get from everybody and would love to show it the best way I know how.

    The Impact

    I want to teach, to help the world, to see all there is to see so I can make it the best place that it can. My writing is something necessary for my sanity, but for my survival, I do have concrete goals career wise. I wish to become a college professor, teaching English with a specialization in Interactive Literature, a field growing immensely in this technological age. 

    There is so much I can give, but in order to do that I have to stay here for just a little while longer, please help me stay.

      Risks & Challenges

      I know that 4000 is an insane goal. I don't have nearly enough friends for something like that, and many of you have already helped in a variety of ways. Anything you can give will make it a little easier, of course, and if it fails and I have to leave then I'll make sure to not take a cent of your money and return it to you.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        I understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

        • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign, there's a lot of people I know who simply don't use the internet. Let them know that I am in need and that any way they can help would be appreciated.
        • Advice! Tips! Lifehacks! I'm still uneducated remember, there's a lot of ways to make my life easier that I don't even know about. Lend me your wisdom. Knowledge is power and all that
        • Your support and well wishes, even non-financially, means the world to me. I don't expect anything from any of you, and don't harbor hard feelings for what you can't give, but that doesn't mean even a gesture of encouragement doesn't mean the world to me. 
        Thank you for reading if you did, I hope you understand how hard it is for me to do something like this, prideful as I am. You're the best! All of you!
story_txt:
The Basics If you are reading this you are likely aware of the tough times I’ve been having lately. For those who don’t, the tl;dr is basically that I’ve been struggling to finish my degree at the college of my dreams because of financial troubles. My parents can only do so much to help, and I feel very uncomfortable asking anyone else for a co-signature on a loan, because I never want to risk putting a person in a situation that may make things difficult for them. I had to take a year off, and struggle to get the money to find me a place in town (living off campus is ultimately cheaper, and I don’t need a meal plan that way).  My parents and I have worked tirelessly and managed to get the remaining balance down to 4000.00, and with my goal so close I don’t know what I would do to have to give up now. I’m not going to expect help from any one of you, mostly because you already have given me so much kindness, friendship, and even previous assistance. I just wanted to make everyone aware of the issues I am facing, and (as hard as it is on my pride) to ask that if anyone felt the desire to help me in any way in this trying time, that I’d be more than grateful to accept any donations given.  I finally wanted to finish by thanking everyone who has stuck around this long, you all mean so much to me and I find myself embarrassed to ask something like this from the people I respect more than anything and wish nothing less than to be a detriment to, I however find myself called by my desire to live the life I’d always dreamed of and I know that I can’t do it without swallowing that pride and asking for things that are out of my reach.  I have big dreams, and admittedly lofty ambitions, and no matter what I’ll always keep fighting for those things.    What I can Give
I'm creative and driven, I am a good writer, a decent singer and musician, I know how to draw, to joke, to handle a broadsword, act, and even code a little. 
If you contribute, I cannot offer you anything I can't make, but I am willing to make personalized gifts of your choosing. I can write you a poem, sing you a song, record a drum solo, draw a picture featuring you riding a dinosaur, record your favorite scene in a movie (be kind and rewind-style) or something funny/crazy like chugging soy sauce and putting it on Youtube. My body and talents are as flexible as you are creative, and even my limitations will be padded with the humor of a job attempted with fervor.
And of course any contributor will get a personalized handwritten letter of thanks for what it's worth, because I am deeply thankful for all the assistance I get from everybody and would love to show it the best way I know how.

  The Impact I want to teach, to help the world, to see all there is to see so I can make it the best place that it can. My writing is something necessary for my sanity, but for my survival, I do have concrete goals career wise. I wish to become a college professor, teaching English with a specialization in Interactive Literature, a field growing immensely in this technological age. 
There is so much I can give, but in order to do that I have to stay here for just a little while longer, please help me stay.

  Risks & Challenges I know that 4000 is an insane goal. I don't have nearly enough friends for something like that, and many of you have already helped in a variety of ways. Anything you can give will make it a little easier, of course, and if it fails and I have to leave then I'll make sure to not take a cent of your money and return it to you.


  Other Ways You Can Help I understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 
Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign, there's a lot of people I know who simply don't use the internet. Let them know that I am in need and that any way they can help would be appreciated.
Advice! Tips! Lifehacks! I'm still uneducated remember, there's a lot of ways to make my life easier that I don't even know about. Lend me your wisdom. Knowledge is power and all that
Your support and well wishes, even non-financially, means the world to me. I don't expect anything from any of you, and don't harbor hard feelings for what you can't give, but that doesn't mean even a gesture of encouragement doesn't mean the world to me.  
Thank you for reading if you did, I hope you understand how hard it is for me to do something like this, prideful as I am. You're the best! All of you!

story:
Overview

Northern Alberta Basketball is an organization dedicated to developing high-level athletes and growing the game of basketball. NAB runs university-calibre summer leagues, tournaments & youth performance training programs.

We’re building a basketball facility to help develop the athletes of the future. The facility will be a haven for like-minded athletes that want to develop their game and believe in our motto to “eat, sleep, hoop”. 24/7, 365 athletes can gain access to this facility and this is our promise to build a better future for the game.


We’re building this facility to help athletes grow and provide them with resources that were not available to us. These athletes may love the game, but without guidance and a place to train they cannot develop their passion like others that have the resources in different parts of the world. In our city, other sports take precedence and we have select facilities with minimum availability to utilize for basketball. Our focus is the youth, our purpose is to build a platform that will afford them opportunities not readily available to us coming up in this city. We want to dedicate a space to the game we love, and allow the youth to turn their passion into productivity.

The Details: The 3000 square foot facility will house different training components to help build better athletes. The first component will be the extended half court. The warehouse will be turned into a half-court with one stationary basketball hoop and up to two portable hoops depending on the nature of training taking place.

The remainder of the lower level will include a trainer's table, two cold tubs, turf, track and sand training ground, and workout equipment. This facility will be built with basketball as the focal point for all elements. All workout equipment to be placed in this facility is centred around the principles of building better basketball athletes. The training equipment on the lower level will include resistance training, squat racks, strength training and select free weights.

The upper level of the facility will include the remainder of the workout equipment; this area will be designated to sessions that are solely for performance training with personal trainers. The segregation is necessary to allow the free flow of athletes on the lower level, and the priority for the personal training on the upper.

How it will help: The facility will provide an outlet for athletes to spend their time training in a productive manner. Membership fees will be kept to a minimum to allow easier accessibility, and the facility will be personal and basketball training only.

Training: Different areas of the facility will be catered to different types of sports specific training. As mentioned above, the upper level will be catered to the personal training elements and the lower level will be accessible for the court use and free weights for memberships.

Memberships: This will be the primary way to access the facility. There will be a drop in program, but only to allow proper utilization of the facility; drop in will fill the scheduling gaps. The facility will be driven by the athletes that are dedicated to their craft. The half-court facility designed to work on basketball specific training will provide the space needed for working on drills, footwork, etc. while the weight room portion will have all the tools necessary to round out the training accounting for strength training, cardio, resistance and more.

24/7: The facility operates 24/7. This is intended for the facility to offer options to athletes and trainers alike. After hours sessions would have to be pre-booked and free-range access would only be granted to certain levels of membership.

These are the 6 main pillars that we built our programs on, and they are meant to create outstanding athletes on and off the court.

  1. Speed & Agility -We will help you maximize your athletic potential with components focused on speed and agility training. A quick first step is just as important as being able to d-up a quicker defender, we understand that and make it a priority in our athlete development.

  2. Conditioning - Being able to play the game you love is a privilege, conditioning is what allows you to show the world what you can do. Maintaining an in-season level of conditioning year round will allow you to get more from your talents.

  3. Power & Strength - Our strength programs are geared to allow athletes to develop more power in their game, whether your a big man or a point guard being able to hold your own is vital. We focus on growing athletic gains related to the sport.

  4. Basketball IQ - The other half of the equation, your basketball IQ is what allows you to make reads on the court and put yourself and your team in a position to succeed. Our coaches focus on developing our athletes to understand the principles of the game.

  5. Skills Development - The core of our program is to help athletes develop their foundation skills, whether that is mastering the fundamentals or perfecting their step-back jumper. We are focused on adding skills to their skill set and growing their strengths to build hard-working, all-around players.

  6. Excellence - We focus our programs on athletes that want to achieve that level of excellence that will take them above and beyond their goals. Our programs are geared to challenge athletes to grow their skills, leadership and physical conditioning. It is our priority that we maintain a balance of the student-athlete relationship so we make sure our athletes are successful on both levels.

Why? The reason we’re so passionate about the game is because it’s brought us where we are today. Basketball is our anchor among other things; it’s provided us a path to stay out of trouble as youth, a motivation to develop as athletes, opened doors for our education, and allowed us to become mentors to youth in our communities. For us it has opened a gateway of opportunities to impact our personal lives, the lives of others and the well-being of our community. The love for the game is real, even when our bodies won’t let us play we’ll still be involved in one way or another.

Next Steps: Your Support

Your support will allow us to make this dream a reality.  We will finally have a dedicated space with trainers/coaches/athletes that truly love the game of basketball.  This will be the first step in changing YEG basketball for the better.

If you have any inquiries or questions, would like to chat, or would like to get involved in any way, the door is open. Contact us at info@nabasketball.com. Let's make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

We love the game of basketball, and we understand there are more ways then just donations that you can contribute to our campaign:

  • Provide us with construction resources and contacts.
  • Provide us with labour resources and contacts.
  • Help generate some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach more people!

Be sure to follow us on Twitter/Instagram @NAByeg and spread the word!

Pledge Amounts

By pledging any amount over $5000.00 we are able to display your company logo(s) within our facility. We are able to do this through multiple methods such as: banners, wall displays and custom products etc. Contact us for the specifics on logo placement and use; or even just to talk details so we can thank you properly for your support.

Please contact us for more information/clarification at info@nabasketball.com
