story:
Welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for  Unschooling The Kids.

We are Anthony and Lehla. Parents of three children. Identical twin girls, Olive and Amari 11, and a boy, Jahli, 8.

Did you ever think about your education, school and wonder how it could have been better, different?  If you are a parent are you wondering which school is right for your child?  Are you anxious about what and how your kids are learning?

These questions are very much out there and there are almost as many answers as there are adults! Four things stood out for us.

1.  The really BIG questions that we had as our children began to grow up were, "What is the best and most enjoyable way to learn?" "And what exactly do our children need to be able to understand and what skills will be most useful in their world in 20 years from now?"

2.  Children seem to be having their childhoods made shorter and shorter and these childhoods seem to resemble more and more the adult lives all around them. Lives they ought to live when they are adults and not before. We didn't fancy that for our kids either.

3.  We were not drawn to what we call at our house "Parent Slavery!" (More of that in the book)

4. The biggest challenge would be for...us the parents. The adults. The process of change had been stewing for a while and now we realized we had to take the plunge and follow an educational road less travelled.

This is why we are writing this book.

As we began our journey into schooling we started to question the very idea of structured education and approaches to learning. Frankly it seemed to be most effective way of driving healthy curiosity out of our children and encouraging anxiety, depression and even mental health problems.

We witnessed teachers talking to children in ways that we don't talk to each other in our home. Where was the respect? The love? The variety of how children actually are as opposed to how they ought to be?

As our highly active, restless, whole body learning children approached "problem child" status in the UK system we realised what the next leg of our journey would be. It was to change what we were doing and pluck our kids out of a system that wasn't working for any of us.



UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS is our best learning and insights from all of us in our family (yes, the kids get their say too) over the last decade.

What we have learned and done to try to find a way to tap the hugely creative, natural, curious way of growing up and becoming confident human beings, that lies as potential (so we believe) in all children.

To be an Unschooling family is to adopt a set of ideas and principles that lie as a philosophy and understanding of how learning happens. How it rises from a deep bottomless well of natural curiosity about absolutely everything. There are core ideas and we have identified the key 6 aspects which seem important. See below.

1. Live in the Bigger Picture

2. Community

3. Play is the gateway

4. Embrace Everything

5. Creativity

6. To Live is To Learn

We are excited to get this book into the world for a number of reasons.

1.  We wish we had had a book like this to read!

2.  We are connectors and want to be in touch with other families, adults and kids who are interested in some of these ideas and hang out together either literally, face to face, but at the least on our blog.

3.  We are perhaps not typical of what most people tend to think alternative educationalist are. We do not do it for reasons of religious belief. We are not survivalists. We are not eco warriors, we do not shun technology (but see the chapter in this in our book for our position on it) and we are not yet very good at growing organic veggies. (Working on it!) We are not drop outs or drop ins. We represent perhaps a group of people who are not considered to be the ones mostly likely to chose Unschooling as a way of living and learning.

4.  Unschooling works and we now understand why it is compelling and a wonderful way to spend those precious years with your children as they grow into adults.

BOOK SPECS

The book is 260 pages. (the printed copy that is) and is approx 70,000 words. Lehla is working on illustrations and we have a first draft cover design....see below

And you will be able to get it of course as a Kindle or E-Book and the usual formats.


So who is this book for?

Well we think pretty much anyone. But in particular, those of you who are already parents or soon to become parents. We do not advocate that everyone should just chuck up their lives and take up Unschooling. But some of the principles of this approach will certainly be useful in enhancing your own family life. 

And younger people... This book may interest you if only so you can tell us what you think we missed or could add? Or we would love to know what you think about how you would like your learning life to be different?

If you are interested in the book then one tip we do have.

Get a few copies of the book and share it with those close to you. It will make for a lively debate and at least if you do start adopting some Unschooling principles, those close to you will know what you are on about when they see your son driving the car sitting on a cushion (no, that's a joke we do not advocate underage driving!)

So, please do help us bring Unschooling the Kids to a finished published project by contributing to this campaign, sharing it with friends or talking about and sharing it on your social media platforms.

About the Authors

LEHLA ELDRIDGE

I am a mother, writer, illustrator and have written and illustrated 'The South African Illustrated Cookbook', 'The Lovely Book for Wonderful Women'. I have also illustrated 'Excuse Me I'm trying to Read' written by Mary Jo Amani. I trained as an actress and worked in theatre for over 8 years. I now illustrate, write and juggle the kids and myself on our collective journey towards learning!

 Here's what a few people have said about my books:

"Lehla's delightful hints for happiness are so potent I am amazed that they are available without prescription. Take one three times a day. At least" Jon Cousins - Founder, Moodscope.com

“Finally, a book that celebrates being a woman, being happy and being abundantly blessed...the perfect gift for the wonderful women in your life” O Magazine - The Reading Room (Oprah Winfrey Magazine)

"The Lovely Book for Wonderful Women is full of wonderful thoughts and lovely drawings. It shines brightly and illuminates life even for a non-woman, like myself!" Steven Appleby - Cartoonist and illustrator

Review for The South African Illustrated Cookbook'

"Lehla is one of those amazing friends who is always full of fun, passion, love, patience and artistic talent. That's her personality and her cookbook reflects it perfectly-cook with a big smile on your face, a dollop of love, plenty of passion and masses of colour."  Michaela Strachan TV Presenter

ANTHONY ELDRIDGE-ROGERS

I am a social entrepreneur, Recovery and Wellness coach and coach trainer. I run an international organisation to train and develop recovery and wellness coaches working with people facing healthcare challanges from Diabetes type 2 to Substance Misuse. I have trained over 300 coaches and we hope to train many more when we launch our online training portal very soon. You can see more about me here. http://www.recoveryandwellnessblog.com/

I am writing a book about my coaching at the moment called "Become a Recovery and Wellness Coach". If any of you are interested in this field and in healthcare, recovery and wellness generally please connect with me on Linkedin

Here are a few comments made by people about my work:

"Anthony is a visionary who makes things happen. He has a range of skills which have been enhanced by having worked across a number of sectors. He is an excellent communicator with a passion for his work and a real desire to make a difference. Anthony has managed to create a worthwhile and much needed offering at the Foundation for Recovery Coaching." Gladeana McMahon - Executive Coach ★ Therapist ★ Author ★ Co-Founder of Cognitive Behavioural Coaching (UK)

"Anthony trained a number of our staff in foundational Coaching skills. My staff were enthused, inspired and equipped!! We can highly recommend Anthony as a Coach Trainer. He is absolutely the go to guy for anything Coaching and Wellness related." Peter Moorhouse
Regional Manager North Wales at ARCH Futures Cymru

"Anthony is a very talented Coach, Leader and all-round human being! I'm in huge admiration of what he is doing with the Foundation for Recovery Coaching UK. Making good coach training accessible and practically applying it to a wider societal issue. I highly recommend Anthony and the FRC to anyone that wants to become a good coach." Lola Fayemi, Programme Manager at Spark Inside


ABOUT THE FAMILY!

"The Eldridge-Rogers family are an absolute delight to know and it's a privilege and joy to have them in our lives. Each one of them in their unique way is talented, creative, bright and funny. Ant and Lehla teach their children what is truly important about people and life with humility and honesty, knowing that they too are learning all the time. They are our favourite family and we love them to bits!" Coletta Canale (Child Psychologist)

“…these guys will try ANYTHING - with a furious, tenacious, honest and giggly joy. And if there is a rule to their game it seems to be that anyone can join in and ANYTHING might happen. To be in their company is a little bit of magic." Federay Holmes (Actor/writer)

Rewards

All campaign backers will gain early access to the final book, UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS. The more you contribute, the better value the reward. 

You can support us for as little as £4 / $6 ( see rewards on the right)

Here are details about some of the more juicy rewards...

£45 - level backers ( and other rewards packages with T Shirts ) get a COOL COTTON T SHIRT printed with your choice of any illustration from the book or from our designed range.

We have got into making our own T Shirts and we have a small range that have been designed by us all in the family. So you can get a T Shirt for an adult, you or a partner, or friend or family member -  a grown up one or one for the kids. Designed by our kids or the the adults.

If you like Lehla's Illustrations then they go well on a T shirt too!

If you go for any of the rewards options with a T Shirt then we will be in touch straight away and work with you to decide which one you want us to create and send you. Here are some samples below.


£60- Reward backers get limited edition signed illustrations by Lehla. These are themed around key points in the book. Their main use (apart from being lovely to look at) is to be a structure to support you to remember an idea or a principle.

Our brains like cues to remind us of things and this is one way you can have your own copy of one of the ones we use at home.

£130 backers get a 90 minute (hour and a half) conference skype call with us both.

You can use this time we have together to ask us anything you want as well as pick our brains. We will assist you in finding out more or we will help you do your best to make some decisions that you might be wrestling with.

As you might have read, Anthony is a professional coach and Lehla has some very acute coaching skills so expect to have a powerful and insightful session.

And included are 2 copies of the BOOK and the E - BOOK

£450 backers get to bring either Anthony or Lehla out to wherever you are in Europe to run a half day workshop based on our insights in Unschooling the Kids.

This is a great option for any group of people, maybe a few families or a learning club, parents group, even schools and colleges to dig into the ideas in our book and see how some of them play out in a workshop environment. 

Please get in touch before you chose this option so we can talk it through and make sure we can set it up together.

No matter how much you contribute, we will list your name as a wonderful supporter in the back of the e-book and on our blog website.


Stretch Rewards

If this campaign earns more than its £6000 goal, then we will have enough funds to do some more very exciting things....

If we get to £8,000 there will be an Audio Book. We will make it available to all our campaign supporters from Kickstarter.

If we get to £10,000: We will have a Conference!

We really want to meet you and others intersted in the future of learning for our children. So if we have the extra funds we will book the venue and use it to launch the first ever UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE. We will get the most inspiring, speakers and workshop leaders.

We will hold it in Italy near Assisi (Yup, as in St Francis) and have a great inspiring and informative time.

(If you want to be kept up to date on this conference idea please email me at anthony@unschoolingthekids.com)

If we get to this £10,000 target all campaign supporters who have taken any of the rewards above £60 or upwards will get discounted tickets to the conference. This will be according to the level of the reward. If we get there we will let you know what the next steps are.


Illustration Previews

Here are some illustrations so far (Lehla has got started) and also the draft of the cover.

Where we are at with the project

So, in case you missed it we have a blog called www.unschoolingthe kids.com  We are already started with our project and you will find some excerpts from early writings from the book.

Please join us on the blog whether or not you sign up for a reward. We like people.

We have already started writing! And to see what we and our kids are getting up to right now (such as frying ice cubes!) please go and look at www.unschoolingthekids.com

If this campaign works out and is a huge success it will be a huge gift to be able to start working with the editor, the designer and get the printing planned.

Where the Money Goes

The £6000 we are raising is the minimum amount of money we need to professionally and independently finish and publish Unschooling the Kids: 

We are very familiar with the publishing process. We know what is involved when creating a great book and how it really makes a difference to have certain things done by the professionals. Such as layout artists, editors and printers.

The money will go towards:

  • Editing, designer, DTP and publishing fees:  £2650
  • Reward fulfillment (printing & shipping books and rewards):  £2800
  • IndieGoGo (4% if we reach our goal!! And a dreaded 9% if we don't, so we are really invested in reaching our goal!) and credit card (3%) fees: +/- £510

Any additional funds raised go toward stretch goals and the authors.

Once we have completed the IndieGoGo campaign...

The book will be available, aswell as the physical copy, in all the varieties possible. So Kindle, E Book and so on. It will cost in the region of £10 / $ 15 plus shipping. The E Book will cost £6 / $10. 

Finally...

  • If you don't see any reward that we might be able to give but have not thought of please get in touch. Email us at anthony@unschoolingthekids.com
  • Please help us to get there by sharing this campaign with your friends on social media, Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc. We need your support to help us get this book out in to the world!
  • Whether or not you get involved with this please visit our ongoing blog called www.unschoolingthekids.com and thank you so much for taking the time to get down to the bottom of the page!
story_txt:
Welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for  Unschooling The Kids. We are Anthony and Lehla. Parents of three children. Identical twin girls, Olive and Amari 11, and a boy, Jahli, 8.
Did you ever think about your education, school and wonder how it could have been better, different?  If
you are a parent are you wondering which school is right for your child?  Are you anxious about what and how your
kids are learning?
These questions are very much out there and there
are almost as many answers as there are adults! Four things
stood out for us.
1.  The really BIG questions that we had as our children began to grow up were,
"What is the best and most enjoyable way to learn?" "And what
exactly do our children need to be able to understand and what skills will be most useful in their world in 20 years from now?"
2.  Children seem to be having their childhoods made
shorter and shorter and these childhoods seem to resemble more and more 
the
adult lives all around them. Lives they ought to live when they are 
adults and not before. We didn't fancy that for our kids either. 
3.  We were not drawn to what we call at our house "Parent
Slavery!" (More of that in the book) 4. The biggest 
challenge would be for...us the parents. The adults. The process of 
change had been stewing for a while and now we realized we had to take 
the plunge and follow an educational road less travelled.
This is why we are writing this book.
As we began our journey into schooling we started to question the very idea of
structured education and approaches to learning. Frankly it seemed to be
most effective way of driving healthy curiosity out of our children and encouraging
anxiety, depression and even mental health problems. 
We witnessed teachers talking to children in ways
that we don't talk to each other in our home. Where was the respect? The
love? The variety of how children actually are as opposed to how they
ought to be?As our highly active, restless, whole body learning children
approached "problem child" status in the UK system we realised what the next leg of our journey would be. It was to change what we were doing and pluck our kids out of a system that wasn't working for any of us.
UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS is our best learning and insights from all of us in our
family (yes, the kids get their say too) over the last decade. 
What we have
learned and done to try to find a way to tap the hugely creative, natural,
curious way of growing up and becoming confident human beings, that lies as
potential (so we believe) in all children.
To be an Unschooling family is to adopt a set of ideas and principles that
lie as a philosophy and understanding of how learning happens. How it rises from a deep
bottomless well of natural curiosity about absolutely everything. There are
core ideas and we have identified the key
6 aspects which seem important. See below.
1. Live in the Bigger Picture
2. Community
3. Play is the gateway
4. Embrace Everything
5. Creativity
6. To Live is To Learn
We are excited to get this book into
the world for a number of reasons.
1.  We wish we had had a book like this to read! 
2.  We are connectors and want to be in touch with other
families, adults and kids who are interested in some of these ideas and hang
out together either literally, face to face, but at the least on our blog.
3.  We are perhaps not typical of what most people tend to
think alternative educationalist are. We do not do it for reasons of religious
belief. We are not survivalists. We are not eco warriors, we do not shun
technology (but see the chapter in this in our book for our position on it) and
we are not yet very good at growing organic veggies. (Working on it!) We are
not drop outs or drop ins. We represent perhaps a group of people who are not
considered to be the ones mostly likely to chose Unschooling as a way of living
and learning. 
4.  Unschooling works and we now understand why it is compelling and a
wonderful way to spend those precious years with your children as they grow
into adults.
BOOK SPECS
The book is 260 pages. (the printed copy that is) and is approx 70,000
words. Lehla is working on illustrations and we have a first draft cover
design....see below
And you will be able to get it of course as a Kindle or E-Book and the usual
formats.




So who is this book for?
Well we think pretty much anyone. But in particular, those of you who
 are already parents or soon to become parents. We do not advocate
 that everyone should
just chuck up their lives and take up Unschooling. But some of the 
principles
of this approach will certainly be useful in enhancing your own family 
life. 
And younger people... This book may interest you if only so you can
tell us what you think we missed or could add? Or we would love to know what you think about how you
would like your learning life to be different?
If you are interested in the book then one tip we do have. 
Get a few copies of the book and share it with those close to you. It will
make for a lively debate and at least if you do start adopting some Unschooling
principles, those close to you will know what you are on about when they see
your son driving the car sitting on a cushion (no, that's a joke we do not
advocate underage driving!)
So, please do help us bring Unschooling the Kids to a finished published
project by contributing to this campaign, sharing it with friends or talking
about and sharing it on your social media platforms.
About the Authors
LEHLA ELDRIDGE

I am a mother, writer, illustrator and have written and illustrated 
'The South African Illustrated Cookbook', 'The Lovely Book for Wonderful
 Women'. I have also illustrated 'Excuse Me I'm trying to Read' written 
by Mary Jo Amani. I trained as an actress and worked in theatre for over
 8 years. I now illustrate, write and juggle the kids and myself on our 
collective journey towards learning!


 Here's what a few people have said about my books:
"Lehla's
 delightful hints for happiness are so potent I am amazed that they are 
available without prescription. Take one three times a day. At least" Jon Cousins - Founder, Moodscope.com
“Finally,
 a book that celebrates being a woman, being happy and being abundantly 
blessed...the perfect gift for the wonderful women in your life” O Magazine - The Reading Room (Oprah Winfrey Magazine)
"The
 Lovely Book for Wonderful Women is full of wonderful thoughts and 
lovely drawings. It shines brightly and illuminates life even for a 
non-woman, like myself!" Steven Appleby - Cartoonist and illustrator
Review for The South African Illustrated Cookbook'
"Lehla
 is one of those amazing friends who is always full of fun, passion, 
love, patience and artistic talent. That's her personality and her 
cookbook reflects it perfectly-cook with a big smile on your face, a 
dollop of love, plenty of passion and masses of colour."  Michaela Strachan TV Presenter
ANTHONY ELDRIDGE-ROGERS


I am a social entrepreneur, Recovery and Wellness coach and coach trainer. I run an international organisation to train and develop recovery and wellness coaches working with people facing healthcare challanges from Diabetes type 2 to Substance Misuse. I have trained over 300 coaches and we hope to train many more when we launch our online training portal very soon. You can see more about me here. http://www.recoveryandwellnessblog.com/

I am writing a book about my coaching at the moment called "Become a Recovery and Wellness Coach". If any of you are interested in this field and in healthcare, recovery and wellness generally please connect with me on Linkedin



Become a Recovery & Wellness Coach


Here are a few comments made by people about my work:
"Anthony
 is a visionary who makes things happen. He has a range of skills which 
have been enhanced by having worked across a number of sectors. He is an
 excellent communicator with a passion for his work and a real desire to
 make a difference. Anthony has managed to create a worthwhile and much 
needed offering at the Foundation for Recovery Coaching." Gladeana McMahon - Executive Coach ★ Therapist ★ Author ★ Co-Founder of Cognitive Behavioural Coaching (UK)
"Anthony
 trained a number of our staff in foundational Coaching skills. My staff
 were enthused, inspired and equipped!! We can highly recommend Anthony 
as a Coach Trainer. He is absolutely the go to guy for anything Coaching
 and Wellness related." Peter MoorhouseRegional Manager North Wales at ARCH Futures Cymru
"Anthony
 is a very talented Coach, Leader and all-round human being! I'm in huge
 admiration of what he is doing with the Foundation for Recovery 
Coaching UK. Making good coach training accessible and practically 
applying it to a wider societal issue. I highly recommend Anthony and 
the FRC to anyone that wants to become a good coach." Lola Fayemi, Programme Manager at Spark Inside

ABOUT THE FAMILY!
"The Eldridge-Rogers family are an absolute delight to know and it's a privilege and joy to have them in our lives. Each one of them in their unique way is talented, creative, bright and funny. Ant and Lehla teach their children what is truly important about people and life with humility and honesty, knowing that they too are learning all the time. They are our favourite family and we love them to bits!" Coletta Canale (Child Psychologist)




“…these guys will try ANYTHING - with a furious, tenacious, honest and giggly joy. And if there is a rule to their game it seems to be that anyone can join in and ANYTHING might happen. To be in their company is a little bit of magic." Federay Holmes (Actor/writer)







Rewards
All campaign backers will gain early access to the final book, UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS. The more you contribute, the better value the reward. 
You can support us for as little as £4 / $6 ( see rewards on the right)
Here are details about some of the more juicy rewards...
£45 - level backers ( and other rewards packages with T Shirts ) get a COOL COTTON T SHIRT printed with your choice of any illustration from the book or from our designed range.
We
 have got into making our own T Shirts and we have a small range that 
have been designed by us all in the family. So you can get a T Shirt for
 an adult, you or a partner, or friend or family member -  a grown up 
one or one for the kids. Designed by our kids or the the adults.
If you like Lehla's Illustrations then they go well on a T shirt too!
If
 you go for any of the rewards options with a T Shirt then we will be in
 touch straight away and work with you to decide which one you want us 
to create and send you. Here are some samples below.





£60- Reward backers get limited edition signed illustrations 
by Lehla. These are themed around key points in the book. Their main use
 (apart from being lovely to look at) is to be a structure to support 
you to remember an idea or a principle.
Our brains like cues to remind us of things and this is one way you can have your own copy of one of the ones we use at home.
£130 backers get a 90 minute (hour and a half) conference skype call with us both.
You
 can use this time we have together to ask us anything you want as well 
as pick our brains. We will assist you in finding out more or we will help you do your best to make some decisions that you might be 
wrestling with.
As you might have read, Anthony is a professional 
coach and Lehla has some very acute 
coaching skills so expect to have a powerful and insightful session.
And included are 2 copies of the BOOK and the E - BOOK
£450 backers get
 to bring either Anthony or Lehla out to wherever you are in Europe to 
run a half day workshop based on our insights in Unschooling the Kids. 
This
 is a great option for any group of people, maybe a few families or a 
learning club, parents group, even schools and colleges to dig into the 
ideas in our book and see how some of them play out in a workshop 
environment. 
Please get in touch before you chose this option so we can talk it through and make sure we can set it up together.
No
 matter how much you contribute, we will list your name as a wonderful 
supporter in the back of the e-book and on our blog website.

Stretch Rewards
If this campaign earns more than its £6000 goal, then we will have enough funds to do some more very exciting things....
If we get to £8,000 there will be an Audio Book. We will make it available to all our campaign supporters from Kickstarter.
If we get to £10,000: We will have a Conference!
We really want to meet you and others intersted in the future of 
learning for our children. So if we have the extra funds we will book 
the venue and use it to launch the first ever UNSCHOOLING THE KIDS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE. We will get the most inspiring, speakers and workshop leaders. 
We will hold it in Italy near Assisi (Yup, as in St Francis) and have a great inspiring and informative time.
(If you want to be kept up to date on this conference idea please email me at anthony@unschoolingthekids.com)
If we get to this £10,000 target all campaign supporters who have 
taken any of the rewards above £60 or upwards will get discounted 
tickets to the conference. This will be according to the level of the 
reward. If we get there we will let you know what the next steps are.

Illustration Previews
Here are some illustrations so far (Lehla has got started) and also the draft of the cover.



No Pressure!






Physical Learning aka Circus Tricks
The World in your Living Room


Where we are at with the project

So, in case you missed it we have a blog called www.unschoolingthe kids.com  We are already started with our project and you will find some excerpts from early writings from the book.
Please join us on the blog whether or not you sign up for a reward. We like people.
We have already started writing! And to see what we and our kids 
are getting up to right now (such as frying ice cubes!) please go and 
look at www.unschoolingthekids.com
If this campaign works out and is a huge success it will be a huge 
gift to be able to start working with the editor, the designer and get 
the printing planned. 
Where the Money Goes
The £6000 we are raising is the minimum amount of money we need to professionally and independently finish and publish Unschooling the Kids: 
We are very familiar with the publishing process. We know what is 
involved when creating a great book and how it really makes a difference
 to have certain things done by the professionals. Such as layout 
artists, editors and printers.
The money will go towards:

Editing, designer, DTP and publishing fees:  £2650
Reward fulfillment (printing & shipping books and rewards):  £2800

Any additional funds raised go toward stretch goals and the authors.

The book will be
available, aswell as the physical copy, in all the varieties possible. So
Kindle, E Book and so on. It will cost in the region of £10 / $ 15 plus
shipping. The E Book will cost £6 / $10.

If you don't see any reward that we might be able to give but have
     not thought of please get in touch. Email us at
     anthony@unschoolingthekids.com
Please help us to get there by sharing this campaign with your friends on
     social media, Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc. We need your support to help
     us get this book out in to the world!
Whether or not you get involved with this please visit our ongoing

story:
Quick Facts

  • School budgets for health and physical education are shrinking
  • Technology is vital for students to learn in today’s education system – fitness technology can cost upwards of $1,000/school + annual fees
  • 23 million children in the United States are overweight or obese, putting them at risk to potentially life-threatening diseases
  • Childhood obesity is crippling our country's youth and schools need new innovative ways to tackle the issue
  • Daily Fit Log addresses students’ health and wellness habits, encourages students to be more active, and does so for FREE
  • Students use DFL’s educational technology to record physical activity, enter health data, track fitness testing scores, set goals, create personal fitness plans, and most importantly, become educated on how to achieve and maintain a healthy and physically active lifestyle
  • Teachers use the real time data to help students gain a greater awareness around their physical health and improve their fitness habitudes

Our Story

The grassroots health movement that has become Daily Fit Log organically grew from the head and heart of physical education teacher and lifestyle enthusiast, Timothy Palek. 

Armed with an idea, a BS in Kinesiology and a Masters in Health and Physical Education from James Madison University, Tim set out on a journey - not to force students to exercise within the walls of the school gymnasium, but to ingrain pivotal and lasting behavioral changes through the power of pairing education with technology.

This journey has led Tim and his three childhood friends to co-found, self-fund, and release the Daily Fit Log platform to schools across the United States.

Today, Daily Fit Log has over 500 registered schools across 39 states – powered by 1,000+ teachers who are making a daily impact on the health and wellness of the 100,000+ students on DailyFitLog.com. 

Your contribution will enhance health and physical education to combat childhood obesity in the United States AND help grow our life-changing technology to reach all 50 million students across the country, in both affluent and economically disadvantaged schools.

America's Problem to Solve: Childhood Obesity

  • Obese youth are more likely to have risk factors for cardiovascular disease, such as high cholesterol or high blood pressure.
  • Children and adolescents who are obese are at greater risk for bone and joint problems, sleep apnea, and social and psychological problems such as stigmatization and poor self-esteem.
  • Obesity is associated with increased risk for many types of cancer, including cancer of the breast, colon, endometrium, esophagus, kidney, pancreas, gall bladder, thyroid, ovary, cervix, and prostate, as well as multiple myeloma and Hodgkin’s lymphoma.
  • Children and adolescents who are obese are likely to be obese as adults.

100,000 K-12 SCHOOLS IN THE UNITED STATES NEED WAYS TO ADDRESS OBESITY WITH 50 MILLION 21ST CENTURY LEARNERS 

At a time when school budgets are shrinking and teachers are forced to do more with less, physical education tracking technology would cost our education system over $100 million in upfront licensing costs, renewal fees, tech support, training and hosting for every school in the country to use this technology. 


DailyFitLog.com: Helps Combat Childhood Obesity

To help solve this national epidemic, Daily Fit Log offers a FREE, web-based health and physical education platform that improves fitness, health and wellness for American children. Free is not just an introductory price or a hook, it’s the backbone of what we do at Daily Fit Log.

Created by a teacher, for teachers, DFL’s full educational platform offers schools multiple features that work simultaneously with one another – creating a complete educational experience for students. Without DFL’s technology, many teachers are only able to re-create small portions of what the program can do, thus delivering a fraction of what students need in order to learn important lifetime fitness concepts.

Daily Fit Log provides a cohesive series of features which synchronize to create a fitness experience that includes tracking, self-assessment, goal setting, and personal fitness planning – teaching students the necessary skills to promote health and wellness for a lifetime of daily physical activity.


See DFL in action below!

WHAT DO SCHOOLS GET FOR FREE?

  • Lifetime access to DFL’s cloud-based software for the entire school district
  • Unlimited student and teacher account creation
  • Training
  • Tech support
  • Hosting 
  • Customized Implementation Plan
  • Complete Assessment Guide
  • Most importantly - a school filled with healthy students!

Look what teachers are saying about us!

What We Need

Every $100 contributed = FREE access to our cloud-based software, tech support, training, and hosting for an entire school.

In 2014 we saw tremendous growth on the DFL platform by reaching 500 registered schools and more than doubling our user base to 100,000+ students. 

With 100,000 public schools and 50 million students in the United States, we have only scratched the surface in providing schools access to our platform. With a price of FREE and our grassroots approach to marketing, we look to outperform growth from 2014 and reach 250,000 students by the end of 2015. 

In order to reach our goal, we estimate that we need $50,000 (20 cents per student or $100 per school) – this will pay for access to our cloud-based software, (including tech support, training and hosting), increased operating and engineering costs to reach and maintain 250,000 students, and fulfillment of IndieGogo perks. 

If you want to practice some math, here is how the numbers breakdown: 

  • Avg. U.S. public school has 500 students (100 million students/100k schools)
  • To onboard and maintain 250,000 students, we need $50,000
  • Each student costs DFL roughly 20 cents ($50,000/250,000 students)
  • With avg. school enrollment of 500 students, $100 supports one school
Long-Term Goals:
  • $75,000 raised allows DFL to exhibit at the Shape America National Convention for Health & Physical Education in Seattle, WA (March 2015). 
  • $150,000 allows us to complete development and release a mobile app for iOS & Android!

What You Get

When you (yes that's you in gray) contribute $100 or more, you will make a huge impact on an entire school by providing them FREE access to our life-changing technology!  


After you contribute, a member of the DFL team will reach out to show you a list of schools available to sponsor (you can be an anonymous sponsor if you'd like). After a school is chosen, your name will be placed side by side with your sponsored school on the DFL Partners page. A personally signed letter from DFL's president & co-founder, Timothy Palek, will be sent to your school, acknowledging your contribution that has enabled the school to use DFL for FREE! 

Awesome Perks!

In addition to sponsoring a school, we have some other cool perks to offer!

By contributing $30, you will receive an awesome limited-edition DFL T-shirt and rubber bracelet. You can wear them both to show support of Daily Fit Log's fight against childhood obesity!


Ways You Can Help

  • Connect with us. Follow Daily Fit Log on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up to date on DFL's efforts in fighting childhood obesity in the United States.
  • Spread the word about #DailyFitLog on Facebook and Twitter by sharing our message with your friends! 
  • Email family & friends the link to our campaign - http://igg.me/at/DailyFitLog

story:
We are....

Yahweh’s Faithfulness. A team of 5 young men and women who love the Lord and are seeking to bring heaven to earth. We are apart of Bethel Campus Fellowship (BCF), a campus ministry that God is using radically transform the college experience on campuses worldwide.

Our goal is to raise $5000 to send students to BCF's Annual National Conference, a conference that has touched and changed every single one of our lives. 


The National Conference will be held from Feb 13-15th, 2015 in Greensboro, North Carolina. The purpose of this event is to equip student to become reliable ministers of the gospel and train them to run effective campus ministries while maintaining excellent academic performance. The theme for the conference this year is "Go," Go and make disciples of all nations.

This year we are expecting 1500 students from as many as 35 colleges, high schools,and several church youth groups from across the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom.

Bethel Campus Fellowship is well known for its God-given ability to transform ordinary students into world changers. Students who attended past conferences have impacted their campuses in many ways and are still doing so.

What We Need 

To meet the budget for the conference, members of BCF have volunteered to raise $1000.00 each. Each of us has volunteered to help this cause and understand that we work even better as a team. Your donation will be used to:

  • Sponsor students who desire to attend this conference but do not have the means
  • It will help us to secure hotel accommodation, transportation from our various campuses, and meals for the three days. 

Your donation is tax deductible. 

We pray that God will lead you to support our goal with a one time donation of $10, $25, $50, $100, $150, $250, $500, or $1000.

God bless you as you support us!

-Zion's MoneyShakers

What  Students Are Saying About BCF...

"BCF gave me a place where I could encounter God's love thorugh His people; people who lived out the word of God and encouraged me in my pursuit of real love."

- Sophia N

“If it were not for BCF, I more than likely would not be here today. The conference last year wrecked me and I’ll never be the same.”  

- Temi O.

“God used BCF to lead me to Him. It is in this ministry that I first caught a glimpse of what it meant to be on fire for God. It remains the ministry that gives me the desire to delve deeper spiritually in order to maintain an engaging, loving, experiential relationship with the Lord.”

- Victoria P.

“BCF means everything to me. It has truly allowed me to understand what it means to walk with Christ through fellowship with other young believers. My walk has been forever changed because of it.”

- Jamal N.

“BCF was the catalyst for me to experience a relationship with God and His people in a  new and awesome way. BCF showed me Christ in a way no one else has before.”

-Janicia M.

“BCF has been a catalyst for spiritual growth in my life. God has used so many different people in the ministry to build my faith, broaden my understanding of God, challenge me to continue learning,and so much more. Being a part of BCF has showed me time and time again, that God is real and that He changes lives for the better.”

- Idara I

“BCF showed me what true friendship looked like."

- Lu A

story:
Syracuse Basketball Fans

Nearly 2,000 elementary school students go to school within a mile or two of the Carrier Dome.  We pass by those schools and the students' homes on game days.  Many of their parents work hard to provide basic necessities.  Food, rent, utilities, clothes.   Most low income children have no age-appropriate books in the home.    

Last season, a few Syracuse fans asked other Syracuse fans to help buy books for these students.  We raised enough money to provide 10 books to every 1st grader at the school closest to the Dome  before summer break.  We are ready to do it again. 

For about $25, we can buy 10 high-quality, age appropriate books for a first grade student near the Dome.  Providing books to elementary school children before summer break is one of the most high-impact and cost-effective ways to improve academic outcomes for kids.

What We Need & What You Get

You can help kids near the Dome maintain their reading skills over the summer break and keep up with their peers:

  • $2,500 gets 10 books to every 1st grade student at Dr. King Elementary, along with a drawstring bag to carry the books home for summer.  
  • Every $25 thereafter gets 10 books for an additional student.   We will add classrooms, grades, or schools as appropriate.  
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will buy as many books as we can for each first grade student at Dr. King Elementary. 
There are a few perks available to thank you for you for  donations:
  • $25 donations receive a super-cute thank you card from one of the kids.  
  • $50 donations receive a drawstring bag with our project logo.

           

The Impact 

  • 10 books provided before summer break has been shown to result in a 35-40% improvement on reading tests relative to students that did not receive books. 
  • Students that do not have age-appropriate books to read over the summer can fall two full grade levels behind their peers by 6th grade.
Check out our infographic: 

Spread the Word

Let other Syracuse fans know about the campaign.  We need your help to spread the word.

  • Email your friends and family and ask them to support the campaign.
  • Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.  
  • Follow the campaign on Facebook.

story:
UPDATE! December 13th, 2014 - Have opened Reddit AMA in support of this campaign, go ahead, ask me anything!

For Every Door That Closes, Another Opens?

Well, I didn't win a nü Icon scholarship like I had hoped. But, I did get an amazing amount of positive feedback about my scholarship contest entry and a great boost of positive energy from just having followed through on something I really wanted to do.

Something else I've always wanted to do is run a successful crowd-source campaign and since there is still a chance that crowd-sourcing can save the day I decided to put my money where my mouth is.

The great news is that the nu Icon program is currently available at a contest sale price of $5997.

I'd also really like to see Laura Hollick's notes on my entry, but the only way to do that is by paying for the tuition! For tonight I would need only the first month's payment of $597 and then the whole $5997 by December 17th.

What do you think?

Follow my story on Diary of Chainman at http://www.chainman.me

Feel free to email me at dylon@grumbledude.com and remember that sharing is more important than donating!

Thank you in advance,

Dylon

P.S. Perks from previous works now available!

BRAND NEW PERK!

I put this collage (illustrating my life and entrepreneurial career) together at the very last moment. It took about 3 hours altogether. I didn't know what I was going to do before I started and then all of a sudden the ideas just started coming to me.

The thing I learned most from creating this reflection of myself is not only am I one handsome devil, but I also have a great story to go with each picture.

For a donation of $5 I will write and publish a short story based on one of the pictures that make up the Diary of a Chainman collage. In order to finish on time my limit was about 100 photos, so I'm limiting this perk to the 101 stories.

Each story will be posted publicly on Diary of a Chainman as I have time to write it and like a tasty burger is first come, first serve.

story:
Please note that attendance is strictly limited. Do not wait to get your ticket.

[Update] CrowdSource is our Platinum sponsor! How awesome is that.

[Update] Please see our latest sponsors, Elasticity and University of Missouri at St. Louis.

[Update] Want one of our beta workshops in your city? Contact us at workshops@sideraworks.com . There are very few slots left, but it's possible we're already working with someone in your city and can connect you into that effort.

The Workshop:

Talk Savvy: Mastering Smart Communication & Collaboration for a Digital World

Today’s professionals are at the crossroads of pivotal change in the business world. The culture of the web and technology has fundamentally changed the way we communicate, both personally and professionally. We have the opportunity -- and the responsibility -- to spark change, to embrace and understand this new digital world, and to learn to become expert communicators and collaborators, because that is the skillset for the future professional.

In short: we need to be more than just tech savvy. We need to be Talk Savvy.


Who's It For?:

Professionals who want to master online communication and collaboration as a skill, no matter the tool or platform.

This dynamic workshop will give you a solid foundation for communicating, interacting, and participating as a sophisticated digital citizen, both individually or as part of a large organization.

What Will I Learn?:

We’ll talk about everything from our roles as change agents in our companies to mastering that tricky balance between our personal and professional selves online.

You’ll also learn:

  • The profile and characteristics of today’s most successful professionals

  • Why social isn’t about the latest technology, but about human nature

  • The critical importance of building internal community wherever you work

  • The single skill that will set today’s professionals apart

  • How emotional intelligence drives smart online communication


Where & When


June 26, 2014 @ 5:00pm CST
At Lab1500 Entrepreneurial Center
1500 Washington Ave., Suite 100 St. Louis, MO 63103 (click for map)


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't attend, or you want to help in further ways? 

  • Help get the word out and make some noise!.
  • Share this link on social media. Use #SideraSTL as hashtag on Twitter
  • Share with your colleagues and your workplace. Particularly HR, Marketing, Customer Service, Sales, and Executives.
  • Contact people who you think might make a great sponsor for the event or the VIP after-party.
  • Let the sponsors know how much you appreciate their help in making this happen, it wouldn't be possible without them. Give them a chance to win your business.

The Details 

We are capping this event at 50 people *total*. You will not want to wait to get your ticket.

This is not a money-making venture for us (see FAQ at bottom), so any funds raised over the minimum will be put towards some very cool ideas we have sitting in our back pockets. We'd love to bring in some of our favorite musicians to these events for example, unique swag, special guests, etc. You know us, whatever it is it won't be your standard fare.

As one of our home cities, we're particularly excited to see everyone.


Thank you in advance for your support!  

- Matt & Amber


"Matt and Amber are one step ahead of the rest of the pack. They are taking​ 'social thinking' to the next logical step for an enterprise. I sincerely believe their holistic approach can translate into competitive advantage." ~ Mark Schaefer, Rutgers University Faculty, Author of Return On Influence
"If you want to get below the buzzwords of social business you Better Call SideraWorks! Matt and Amber get it and can help your organization transform its business model with social at the core where it should be." ~Saul Kaplan, Chief Catalyst & Founder, Business Innovation Factory
"So many people talk at me. Fewer make me think. And it's the rare occasion that I'm challenged and enchanted. My friends at SideraWorks are rare ones. That's why I'm honored they're in my small circle of trusted advisors." ~Louis Richardson, Social Business & Smarter Workforce, IBM
"You know that saying, "Those who can't do, teach?" It's completely wrong, of course. In truth: People who know their material cold are both teachers and do-ers. That's Matt and Amber.  I've hired them many times to present to our audience of marketers. And I always come away with a renewed appreciation for how they can explain complex issues simply and succinctly, and how they empower their audience, not overwhelm them.  That's not a small thing, and it speaks to the depth and breadth of their knowledge as well as their energy for an often misunderstood (and mis-used) category." ~Ann Handley, Chief Content Officer, MarketingProfs
"If I wanted to recommend a team to help my clients create a true social business these are the guys I would call" ~Paul Higgins, Emergent Futures

Platinum Sponsor: CrowdSource

CrowdSource is the industry leader in a multi-billion dollar market, providing clients with on-demand access to a skilled and scalable workforce. We manage crowd-based talent to deliver content, moderation and transcription solutions to enterprise clients worldwide. Brands who partner with CrowdSource include Target, Bed Bath & Beyond, Staples, Nielsen, Major League Baseball, Amazon and Yahoo!



Event Venue Sponsor: Lab1500

An amazing venue and we can't thank them enough. Go check out some of the images, get impressed, and give them your business!


Gold Sponsor & VIP Event Venue: Elasticity 

Elasticity is a leading national digital marketing and public relations agency that works with brands including Charter Communications, H&R Block, CafePress, Capital One, Best Buy, SunEdison, and entrepreneurial startup ecosystems. In addition, they are just a great group of people who went out of their way to help bring this event together.

Gold Sponsor: UMSL

Check out the new Programs and Certifications in Digital and Social Media Marketing at the University of Missouri – St. Louis. We're thrilled to have them board as a sponsor!


Adamantium Sponsor: TBD, This could be you!



FAQ:


Why Is This So Inexpensive?: Great question. As we develop new workshop material we need two things. 1) A great audience so that we can feel out the best/worst parts of the workshop and tweak as necessary 2) Practice delivering the workshops before we release them into our formal portfolio. To that end you get a great bargain, we get to practice and put our workshops to test in the real world, and get access to a much broader audience of friendly folks than we'd get to meet in our full-price workshops. We realize not everyone can afford to pay $15k for our workshops, and this is one way we can make the same workshop accessible to anyone.

What/Where Is The VIP Event?: The VIP Event will be immediately following the workshop and held at Elasticity (see Update for details). It's less than 1/2 mile away so an easy walk from the workshop venue. We already have some great options on the table so it's going to be a blast. We'll update as we go along. One thing that never changes is that we limit the VIP attendees to 20-30 people max. We want a bit of intimacy and to get to know everyone, that's difficult to do if you get many more people than that together. You will most certainly get your moneys worth with a VIP ticket.

Who Is SideraWorks?: SideraWorks is a management consultancy focused on helping organizations transform themselves for the next generation. We have a very tight focus on collaboration and education, specifically to tackle the disruption and impact that social media has brought about. It was founded by Matt Ridings & Amber Naslund. Between the two of them they've spoken in front of hundreds of thousands people in audiences around the world, have a best-selling business book on social business, have founded, run, and advised multiple successful ventures over the years and consulted to major brands such as Levi's, Cisco, IBM, British Airways, CDW, and many, many more. Their client workshops are renowned for their interactivity, fun, and depth of engagement and learning. Periodically those workshops are available to the public either through partnerships with conferences or when testing new material.

story: With more rookies on the teams than veterans, both Mechanical Paradox (7182) and Green Machine Reloaded (4318) surpassed expectations and moved handily through Qualifiers to States to The World FIRST Tech Competition being held in St. Louis, MO April 22-26. In order to compete, all team members, mentors, coaches, and equipment need to make the trip to MO. Funds we raise will be applied to transportation to, and within, St. Louis, accommodations, additional equipment for the robots, and, of course, sustenance for the hardworking teens and adults competing. Your contribution will give these two excellent teams the opportunity of a lifetime! Thank you so very much.

story:
Overview

Abuse has no boundaries, no borders. It's everywhere and can touch anyone's life. We're here to do everything we can to prevent it from touching one more life. In conjunction with the Canadian Centre for Abuse Awareness and the Center for Abuse Awareness in the USA, AbuseHurts International has formed as an umbrella agency that will assist abuse-related organizations around the world. The focus for this particular campaign is BULLYING. 

The Fall of 2015 will see the launch of a world-wide anti-bullying awareness campaign and AbuseHurts International will be managing the worldwide distribution of the designated proceeds. This involves careful planning and execution. That's where you come in. Please help AbuseHurts International complete the preparations needed in time for this history-making initiative. Together, it can be done!

What We Need & Why  

For this campaign, we need to raise a minimum of $100,000. The money will be going toward completing the infrastructure we are currently putting in place in time to help facilitate the launch of a world-wide anti-bullying awareness campaign in Fall 2015. Celebrities in the entertainment industry have banded together to contribute toward an anti-bullying song and full-length documentary film. All designated proceeds raised from the project will be going to anti-bullying charities around the world.  As a distributor of the proceeds, AbuseHurts International requires an infrastructure that would fulfill the planning and coordination with abuse-related agencies around the world and participating celebrities, via human and IT resources. AbuseHurts International will also be offering these agencies assistance with specific marketing and fundraising tools and assets, plus helpful resources (eg - AbuseHurts Help Guide for Parents).

What You Get

To show our thanks for your support in this campaign, we are offering the following perks:
  • Social Media shout outs to supporters.
  • Name permanently listed on a webpage dedicated to the making of the world-wide anti-bullying campaign
  • Acknowledgement  in a special edition commemorative issue of the AbuseHurts.Com eZine.
  • Commemorative eBook containing photos and stories from this international anti-bullying campaign.
  • Special, limited edition printed versions of the commemorative souvenir booklet.
  • Special one-off perks will be added during the campaign

The Impact

Abuse affects everyone; relation-ally, financially, mentally, physically, emotionally. How? By assisting us in this campaign, you are helping to improve the health and well-being of families, communities, cities, regions - even countries - around the world!


  • We will be assisting established abuse-related agencies around the world. By managing this world-wide anti-bullying campaign, AbuseHurts International can help not just one agency but dozens - hopefully hundreds - of agencies with finances and other resources! By creating a central system of facilitating designated proceeds and resources, we can provide agencies the kind of assistance they would never be able to achieve on their own. 
  • To start, we've enlisted the help of top international experts in the field of bullying.  and have already identified more than  200 agencies around the world that could potentially benefit from this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't help financially. We can still use our help in other ways:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this vital campaign. Share it with your friends, Forward! Tweet and retweet! Post and repost! Email it! There are great sharing tools on Indiegogo but feel free to be creative! If you're as passionate about this cause as we are, you will find a way to make it known. 

    Thanks in advance for your participation.

Together, it can be done!

story:
The perks are located on the right hand side of this page.
Click on your preferred Perk in order to access the store. 

Perk 1: $5 Donation
Perk 2: $15 Book Pre-Order
Perk 3: $25 Book and CD
Perk 4: $50 Book, CD and Personalize Birthday Recording
Perk 5: $275 Book, CD, Birthday Recording, and 30 minute B-Day Performance 
Perk 6: $400 Book and Performance Assembly at Preschool or Elementary School

Children learn best when the are engaged. And they are engaged best when the medium is interactive.

This interactive book is about three friends that are walking through a park when they hear a strange and unusual sound. It's a spaceship and it crashes behind a tree. A space alien named Zar appears from the wreckage and asks for the three friends to help fix the ship. While pressing buttons the three friends learn a bit of the space alien language and they make a new friend.

When Santiago and I were creating this book we spent a lot of time testing it in preschool classrooms and library story times so we could understand how best to create interactions between the kids, teachers and book. The result is this fun, interesting and engaging story. Read it to a 2 - 6 year old in your life and see how you interact with the book, and each other.

We need help with production costs. We are asking for book pre-orders so we can reach $1000 to get us started on printing the books.Thank you.

story:
I have travelled several times in the past year to Rwanda.  This has been a dream for me, and I have completely fallen in love with such a beautiful country and even more beautiful people.  Rwandans continue to recover following the horrific genocide that happened only 21 years ago.  There is not one person I have met who is not carrying around the scars of profound trauma, some visible, others invisible.  And yet there is also a strong sense of healing, joy, and HEART that struck me as an incredible testament to the strength of what is within each human being.  Though I initially travelled to Rwanda with a small grass-roots healthcare organization based out of Olympia, I knew immediately that I wanted to make some connections with the hope of one day having the Peace Education Program available in Rwanda, as it currently is in many other countries around the world.

I am preparing to make my 3rd trip to Rwanda in the next few weeks, and I am excited to say that there will be a Peace Education Program starting there in the very near future!  I am working with an organization called RICAD Rwanda, http://ricadrwanda.webs.com/, and its founder Diane Mushiyimana, who I met last year.  I will be taking the set of PEP DVDs with me to give to Diane as well as other materials.  Diane just gave me an estimate of somewhere between 100 and 500 people who will potentially be a part of this initial class!  The Peace Education Program is a very unique and innovative project of the Prem Rawat Foundation. www.tprf.org, that helps participants to discover and utilize the innate resources within themselves to find a sense of peace and dignity that is inherent I every human being.  These resources include self awareness, inner strength, choice, and clarity.  The Peace Education Program has been very well received in a wide variety of adult education and social service settings around the world.

Just like every other organization I have met in Rwanda that is working to lift people out of extreme poverty and bring dignity to their lives, RICAD operates on a SHOESTRING budget and needs help to be able to purchase the A/V equipment and print PEP workbooks and articles for this many people.  For this reason I wanted to ask if anyone would be interested in helping to sponsor this effort, it would be most welcomed!

story:
Jennifer Wolfe and Nicaragua

Jennifer Wolfe is an amazing teacher at Emerson Junior High in Davis, California. She has nurtured and taught hundreds of our children. And she is passionate about furthering the education of Nicaraguan kids, too.  A group of Jennifer’s former students and their parents are raising funds to send Jennifer back to Nicaragua in summer of 2013 to help construct another school -- she will lay bricks, mix cement and build that school!

The funds raised help pay for the school including the rebar, wiring, plumbing, bricks and so on as well as Jennifer’s housing and travel.  Please help by donating $5 or $10 or $500!  Many small donations make the goal light!  If you want to give Jennifer an end of the school year gift, please donate to her dream of helping to build another school.  If you cannot contribute money, that's ok!  We hope to send Jennifer with duffle bags full of new or gently used school backpacks, new pencils, children's Spanish reading books, and gently used laptops.  You can also help at our car washes in Davis on June 1 and June 29 to raise more funds.

What is Seeds of Learning or "SOL"?

Watch the video at http://www.seedsoflearning.org/index.php and you will understand Jennifer’s love of this non-profit. Seeds of Learning or "SOL" is a small but mighty non-profit whose sole mission is to further education in Nicaragua. Since its inception in 1991, SOL has constructed or remodeled 152 classrooms in 55 communities in Nicaragua. After a school is built, SOL matches the school in Nicaragua with a sister school in the United States. Jennifer’s class is the sister school with a very small rural elementary school that Jennifer helped build. You can see the video at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ekbVBx24GM from another Davis work group doing similar work from 2009. Jennifer’s students continue to write to the students in Nicaragua. The strong bonds between our communities will be life long because of Jennifer and others like her.

What We Need!

For Jennifer to go to Nicaragua to help build another school, we want to raise: $2900 for the program and $600 for her plane flight for a total of $3,500. As the writer of this Indiegogo campaign, I am now supposed to tell you about any unique perks I can offer you if you participate. But all I can offer is the wonderful feeling that you are contributing to the education of kids for years to come. You are contributing to sending a teacher to help instruct students and excite them about learning! If you cannot go with Jennifer on this journey, please help fund her passion in your name. SOL is a non-profit so your donation is tax deductible. If we do not raise the full $3,500, all the funds we do raise will go toward sending Jennifer to Nicaragua in 2013. We will supplement those funds with as many car washes and bake sales as necessary until we get her back to SOL!

The Impact

Your contribution can be $5, $25, $100 or $500. Or it can be a gently used child's backpack, some children's reading books in Spanish or a gently used laptop. Whatever your contribution, know you are making a big difference. The kids in Nicaragua often walk hours to get to school and back home each day. They have few opportunities without an education. Through SOL, Jennifer can help children for years to come learn, thrive and be the best they can be. Like the sun or SOL, kids in Nicaragua can shine thanks to your support. Email me at jenny@outdoorkids.com if you want me to pick up your donations or drop them off at Jennifer’s classroom at Emerson.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute with a financial donation, that's ok!

• Can you donate items for Jennifer to take with her? She will take new or gently used backpacks; used laptops; new school supplies especially pencils and notebooks; or children's Spanish reading books.

• Post this notice on your Facebook account or email friends and family members to let them know about SOL and Jennifer’s goal.

• Help at our car washes! The dates are June 1 and 29th

• Wish her luck. Your thoughts and support are priceless!

story:
Welcome to Sam and Jim’s last minute blitz crowdfunding campaign page!

Let’s get right to the point. We are looking to raise $1,500 to purchase three plane tickets for Sam, Jim, and Doug (Jim’s aid) to fly to Washington D.C. on February 21st. (That’s in 11 days!)  

Why do we need to go to D.C.? Great question!

It is imperative that we make this trip to Washington D.C. to represent Oregon in the largest patient lobbying day in cannabis reform history. The good news is we have both received scholarships to attend the Americans for Safe Access’ (ASA) National Medical Cannabis Unity Conference so our hotel and conference fees have been covered.  

On top of that, Jim has not only been asked to speak in a workshop titled “Bringing Medical Cannabis Politics into the Mainstream”, but will also be accepting ASA’s Patient Advocate award!

As many of you may already know, we have known each other since 2009. Jim started mentoring me shortly after I started the University of Oregon Students for Sensible Drug Policy chapter. In 2010, Jim hired me to be the Young Adult/College Outreach Coordinator for the Measure 74 campaign.

Last year I teamed up with Jim to run a campaign to defeat former US Attorney, Dwight Holton, who was so adamantly anti-medical cannabis it resulted in his losing by 26 percentage points.

Currently we are working on a variety of campaigns to reform outdated cannabis laws in the state legislature, such as adding PTSD as a qualifying condition to our current medical cannabis program and a establishing a state regulated supply system for patients.

It is important that Oregonian’s are represented at this important national conference because we will be sharing our experiences and bringing back valuable information and insights from experts from across the country. There will be workshops on topics such as International Medical Cannabis Policy, Strategic Messaging and Spokesperson Training, Veterans, Fundraising for Grassroots Campaigns, and many more!

But seriously, what do you get if you donate, say 10, 25, 50, or 100 of your hard earned dollars to this campaign?

PERKS!!

$10 - Our Graditude

  • We will give you a MASSIVE bear hug next time we see you!

$25 - A Thank you Call

  • We will personally call to thank you for your contribution. Nothing is more satisfying than hearing the voices of our supporters!

$50 - Hand delivered letter to your representative

  • Want to tell your legislator that you support medical cannabis reforms, but can't make it to D.C.? Write them a letter and we will personally deliver it to their office in D.C.!

$100 - Social Media Consult

  • Do you have a Facebook or Twitter account you want help with? Donate a quick hundo and Sam will give you a FULL HOUR of his time to help you with anything social media!  (Includes Crowdfunding 101 advice if desired)

$250 - Strategic Campaign Consult

  • Thinking about launching your own social justice campaign, but don't know where to start? No worries, Sam can help! This contribution gets you two with Sam and an actual strategic game plan outlining how to move forward!

$500 - The Savior

  • On top of receive everything all of the perks above, you get the satisfaction of knowing that you supported 1/3rd of the funding we need to make this trip a reality.

story:
Tahoe Tough Mudder in Memory of Dan Goldman

The Lake Tahoe "Tough Mudder" is being held on July 13th/14th, and the SF office of Heidrick & Struggles has assembled a coed team to take on the challenge. For those of you who don't know, the "Tough Mudder" is a 10 mile obstacle course during which participants crawl through the mud, jump over fire, and swim through underwater foxholes.

We are doing this as part tribute/part fundraiser. On February 4, 2013, Jules and Ella Goldman lost their father, Dan Goldman, to pancreatic cancer. Dan was a wonderful father who dearly loved his daughters and his amazing wife, Krista Callaghan Goldman, but was taken from this world far too early and before he had the opportunity to watch his girls grow up.

Dan, a brilliant man with an unparalleled vocabulary (and a lethal Scrabble player) had an endless thirst for knowledge. We know that Dan wanted to provide his daughters with any and every opportunity to learn and experience life, and that their education was of the utmost importance to him.

Dan’s spirit and memory will live on in his friends and family, but his commitment to providing his daughters with access to the best education is at risk unless those who care for them offer assistance. Please help us ensure that Dan’s commitment to his daughters is met by contributing to an education fund for the girls. No amount is too small and every single donation will make a difference.

What We Need & What You Get

Let us break it down for you folks:

  • We are trying to raise $5,000 for the Jules and Ella Goldman Education Fund.
  • Donors will get a window into the insanity of the event and the fierceness of the H&S team via photos and videos.
  • All funds raised will go directly to the girls' education fund, even if we don't hit our $5K goal, but we'd really like to make a meaningful contribution that will have a lasting impact on the Goldman family.  Help us make it count!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a contribution or would like to know of other ways to support the effort:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or whatever social network you're fancying these days.  It's easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Let us know if you'd like to come cheer us on during the event and we'll send you the details.

Thanks in advance for your support.  We are grateful to be able to honor Dan's memory in this way and to make a small contribution to the bright future of his daughters.  Now let's get TOUGH!!!
