story:
Undetected Brain Concussions - Save Your Child Now

WHY SO MANY CHILDREN ARE AT RISK AND WHAT YOU MUST KNOW TO PROTECT YOUR FAMILY

From the moment your child was born, you’ve given more love than you knew you had to give. You cradled your baby’s head, gently shampooed the soft spots, placed cushions around the crib, child-proofed your home, and installed a safety seat in your car.

You did everything you could to keep your baby safe, and today your child runs, climbs, jumps, swims, cycles, skates and explores the world with a fearless hunger for adventure, experiencing fun, laughter and the occasional bump on the head.

It’s normal for kids to bump their heads - on kitchen cabinets, getting into cars, getting a can off a shelf, falling off a bike or skateboard, sliding down a railing or missing a catch at the park.

It’s normal for girls to get elbowed in soccer or collide on the basketball court.

It’s normal for boys to have their brains jostled on the football field by 1600 pounds of force hitting head-on.

It’s normal for boys and girls to hit their heads when they slip in the tub, fall on the ice, tumble down a hill, trip on a shoelace or swim laps in the pool.

Kids hit their heads all the time – it’s just a normal part of childhood.

But just because it’s normal, doesn't make it healthy.



The scary truth is every time your child’s head gets hit or jostled, s/he’s at risk for a concussion – a serious brain injury that can have a devastating impact on every part of his/her life.

While we’d like to believe it could never happen to our own kids, the fact is concussions are much more common than we once believed.

Research shows concussions have become a significant problem for millions of children worldwide. The Center for Disease Control says sports-related concussions are at epidemic levels and we’re seeing a widespread incidence of concussions occurring in playgrounds, classrooms, and even at home.

The latest research findings reveal 70% of children have had at least one concussion, and they estimate the real number is closer to 90% - that’s 3 million children in the United States alone!

It’s also estimated that 40% of those children have never been diagnosed as having concussions. So these children are running around untreated and at serious risk for permanent brain damage, a dysfunctional life and an early death.

We are committed to making sure this never happens to your child.

We are the Brains Worldwide Foundation and we’re driven to bring you the education, support, research and technology you need to keep your children safe from the hidden dangers of brain concussion. We’re making that happen across 3 critical areas of service.

BRAINS WORLDWIDE FOUNDATION EDUCATION

The brain is the control center of everything that keeps your child alive. Every breath, every heartbeat, every moment of laughter, learning and growth depends on your child having a healthy brain. You don’t need us to tell you that. But here are some critical facts about your child’s brain you may NOT know…

==> Before the age of 14, children’s brains are at significantly higher risk for sustaining a concussion than at any other time of their lives.

==> If they do get a concussion, children between the ages of 5 and 18 run the highest risk of developing a condition called Post Concussion Syndrome leading to chronic headaches, dizziness and a host of other symptoms that could go on indefinitely and dramatically impact their lives.

==> Research shows girls have 2 to 3 times more concussions than boys when they are playing the same sports and girls’ concussions are typically more severe and take longer to heal.

==> While all playground and sporting activities carry a risk of injury, the top 2 children’s sports for concussions are football for boys and soccer for girls.

==> We try to keep our children safe from concussions by having them they wear helmets, but research shows helmets reduce only some of the force of a hit to the head. In fact, while we once believed the only way to get a concussion is through a direct blow to the head, we now know this is a myth.

==> All it takes for your child to get a concussion is to be subjected to enough force so the brain gets jostled inside the skull, and that can happen by the air bag engaging in a car or being violently tossed around on a carnival ride.

==> All the research tells us the odds are really strong that your child will get a concussion. The problem is how are you supposed to know if your child’s brain gets injured – especially if you weren’t there to see it happen?

==> Standard advice is to watch your child for headaches, dizziness, loss of consciousness or vomiting but these symptoms don’t always appear. Research has shown there are many hidden symptoms of concussions and far too often, these symptoms get ignored or attributed to something else.

Here are just some of the symptoms that get overlooked or misinterpreted:

==> Fatigue

==> Lack of focus

==> A sudden drop in grades

==> Irritability

==> Concentration problems

==> Aggression

==> Lack of balance

==> Sensitivity to light

==> Sensitivity to sound

==> Changes in sense of taste

==> Changes in sense of smell

==> Insomnia

==> Mood Swings

The fact is all these symptoms are commonly diagnosed as something other than a concussion, causing your child to be labeled with Social and Behavioral Problems, Learning Disorders, Psychological Disorders, or to be diagnosed with Allergies, Stress, Hormonal Changes, and the most common of all, ADHD (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder). Let’s take ADHD as an example –

We know that in 2011, the CDC reported 11% of children aged 4 – 17 had been diagnosed with ADHD (that’s 6. 4 million children).

The question is, how many of those children are really suffering from undiagnosed concussions?

And if that’s the case, how can we assess these children before it’s too late and they are left with long-term brain dysfunction or worse?

Part of the problem is how assessments are made. If your child’s head gets hit in a supervised activity, assessments are typically done through the use of SUBJECTIVE measures. Your child will be asked a series of questions and observed for obvious symptoms like loss of consciousness or dizziness.

The problem is concussions can impact 5 major areas of the brain, causing a host of symptoms that may not be immediately noticeable.

The bigger problem is subjective assessments do not accurately measure the health of these 5 areas of the brain.


Nevertheless, subjective testing is the accepted standard, so if your child passes a subjective test, no referral is made to a doctor. Then, when hidden symptoms start to appear, no one makes the connection between the symptoms and the original brain injury. And since so many concussions happen outside of an adult’s watchful eye, you may not even know there was an original injury.

There is far too much at stake to risk your child’s life to subjective testing. Particularly since savvy student athletes have learned to cheat on those tests in order to keep on playing.

Your child needs to be assessed for the hidden symptoms of concussion through an OBJECTIVE measure of 5 distinct areas of the brain. If that assessment is done accurately, you will know if your child’s brain has been injured and whether it’s necessary to get your child to a doctor.

If your doctor diagnoses a concussion, then your child needs to be continuously monitored with OBJECTIVE measures to determine when it is safe to return to play.

No matter how much your child appears to be fine, please, don’t settle for subjective assessments that put your child’s life at risk.

At Brains Worldwide Foundation, we believe the greatest protection your child can have against undetected concussions is ongoing, up-to-date education, access to convenient and affordable objective testing and a solid partnership between you and your pediatrician.

We’re committed to bringing you the education and support you need so you know how to identify, assess and report your child’s symptoms to your doctor. And that’s only the beginning of how we’re working to help you keep your child safe.

THE BRAINS WORLDWIDE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP FUND



The second way we’re helping parents keep their children safe is through the establishment of a college scholarship fund for children who can’t play sports due to a brain concussion.

There is an ever-increasing problem occurring worldwide where, despite physicians’ orders, children return to play before it’s safe.

This puts children at tremendous risk because once a child has been concussed, any additional concussions significantly increase the risk for severely limited brain function, permanent degenerative brain damage, an ever-increasing cascade of thinking and behavioral problems and a life-threatening condition called Secondary Impact Syndrome.

With so much at risk, why would a child return to play against doctor’s orders?

Because the competitive edge is all about being tough, playing through the pain and being a team player.

The social pressure to play is far stronger than a doctor’s treatment plan. After all, it’s just not cool to be a quitter. So kids learn to hide their symptoms, to cheat subjective test questions and to convince their parents, coaches and trainers that they’re totally fine.

We understand a child’s drive to play is fueled by self-esteem, social recognition and the competitive drive to win. We also know for many child athletes, their urge to get back on the playing field is about survival. For these children, the only way they are able to have a hope for the future, is to receive a sporting scholarship to a good college, and that can’t happen if they’re not scouted on the field. The stakes for these kids are really high, so they do whatever it takes to stay in the game – even if it means risking their lives.

That’s why we’re building the Brains Worldwide Scholarship Fund to provide financial assistance for child athletes who have been banned from play due to concussion.

Our hope is that providing this support, we will help parents protect their children from undue risks without losing their chance for a successful and fulfilling future.

BRAINS WORLDWIDE ONGOING RESEARCH


The third and most crucial mandate of the Brains Worldwide Foundation is ongoing research on concussion assessment, reporting and monitoring technology .

All children get tossed around and bump their heads, but not all of them end up with concussions. So how are you supposed to know when your child needs medical help – especially if you didn’t see the incident?

How can you get documented proof that your child is experiencing any or all of the hidden symptoms of concussion so you know whether you need to contact your doctor?

And most importantly, how do you know when the symptoms are severe enough that you need to take your child straight to the emergency room?

Finally, if your child is diagnosed with a concussion, how are you supposed to monitor the healing process objectively so you can protect your child from returning to the playing field before it’s safe?

We’ve been researching this problem for more than 10 years, seeking powerful and affordable technologies to give parents the tools they need to protect their children.

We’re excited to announce this technology now exists, giving moms and dads the power to objectively assess injury to the 5 critical areas of the brain that are affected by concussions with a simple, portable unit that is specifically designed for home-use.

This innovative technology is called the Objective Brain Concussion Assessment and Monitoring System™ (OBCAMS).


OBCAMS brings powerful, cloud-based assessment, reporting and monitoring technology straight to your home so you have 24/7 access to test all areas of your child’s brain for maximum health by objectively assessing the 5 major areas of the brain that cause the hidden symptoms of concussion.

The higher your child's score across these 5 areas, the more serious the brain injury and the more urgent it is that you take your child to see a doctor to rule out a concussion.

What’s it like to use OBCAMS?

For you, it’s simply a matter of watching a quick video and then inviting your child to play a quick game.

For your child, it is like playing a video game with 5 different levels of play. Each level will engage your child in a different game, with fun activities that measure your child’s ability to focus, reaction time, vision tracking, memory and balance.

This is OBCAMS –


As you can see, unlike medical devices, OBCAMS doesn’t require probes or sensors to be attached to your child’s head. Simply hand the tablet to your child and in less than 10 minutes you’ll know whether your child’s brain is functioning within the range of a healthy brain.

The process is easy to use and anyone can make it work. Simply touch the screen, follow the prompts and invite your child to take the controls.

While your child is watching the screen, the cloud-based software will measure the 5 major areas of your child’s brain with objective accuracy that can’t be manipulated by your child.

When you’re done, simply touch the screen to complete the test and if your child is in danger, you will be alerted to go immediately to your closest hospital for emergency care.

If your child’s results are outside the range of healthy, you’ll be alerted to take the report to your pediatrician to determine the best course of treatment for your child.

 

Should your pediatrician recommend that your child stay off the playing field for a period of time, OBCAMS will help you monitor your child’s progress and give you objective data to bring to your doctor for follow-up care.

If your child’s brain measures healthy in all 5 areas of the brain, your report will be emailed to you so you have it for comparison in the future.

Kids love to take the OBCAMS tests and parents and doctors are telling us they’re excited about the OBCAMS technology--- but does it really work?

PROOF

We tested a group of 2000 students and veterans using OBCAMS and here’s what we found:

Of the 2000 people we tested, 401 showed significant symptoms of brain concussions. We then sent those people to their doctors, who, in turn, confirmed our findings – each of the 401 who had shown significant symptoms with OBCAMS, were diagnosed with brain concussions by their doctors. That's 100% accuracy.


Now here’s the really scary part of the findings:

Of the 401 people who were found to have brain concussions, 38% had been previously cleared by the medical community. In other words, these people had been told they did not have concussions!

If we hadn’t used OBCAMS to test those people, 152 children and veterans would have been at serious risk for extended brain damage.

How many more children are out there with undetected concussions?

OBCAMS technology is being manufactured by Brains Worldwide, Inc., and will be available to the general public for retail purchase in 2016. However the Brains Worldwide Foundation may be able to get this technology to you in advance before the general public through our mandate for research.

We are collaborating with Brains Worldwide, Inc. to give 150 families a substantial discount to purchase the new OBCAMS technology so they can use it to objectively test their children’s brain health at home.

If your family is selected for this program, you will participate in a pilot study where we will document your use of the OBCAMS technology for 1 year, noting any questions you might have along the way.

Your feedback will provide the information we need to better serve families in the future through our 24 Hour Hotline service and ongoing education to help parents discuss test findings with their pediatricians.

In thanks for your participation in this study, we will cover 50% of the fee for your device, technology and support, and the OBCAMS system will be yours to keep forever.

The pilot study will begin on March 1, 2016, and you can apply to be one of the 150 families included by selecting the Pilot Study Perk on this page.



The simple truth of childhood is that no matter how much we love our children and try to keep them safe, our kids will run and play and inevitably bump their heads.

While we may not be able to fully protect our kids from getting concussions, at Brains Worldwide Foundation we are committed to bringing you the education, support, research and technology you need so you can keep your family safe from the hidden danger of concussions.

Our experts are working hard to give you the help you need, but we need your help so we can help you.

Please help us help your family, and the millions of children who are at risk worldwide.

Your donation of just $1 will help us educate families worldwide about the hidden danger of brain concussions and how to keep children safe.

Your donation of $5 or more will help us support parents with our 24/7 Hotline and support injured student-athletes with the Brains Worldwide Athletic Scholarship Fund.

Participate in the Brains Worldwide Foundation Home-Assessment Pilot Study If you have one or more children ages 8 – 18, we invite you to be one of 150 families to get first access to the only objective assessment technology ever designed for home use. Watch the video above or scroll down this page to read about this life-saving technology.

If you’re among the first 150 families to apply for participation in the OBCAMS Pilot Study, and if you meet the eligibility requirements, we’ll cover 1/2 of your OBCAMS fee, provide ongoing support and, in gratitude for your participation, you’ll get lifetime discounts on future testing technology and educational tools as they become available.

You’ve worked so hard to give your children the love and protection they deserve. But you just can’t do it all yourself. Please help us help you and parents like you around the globe.

Give what you can today – so every mom gets to kiss her child goodnight with a little less fear, a little more joy and a lot more love every single day.


WHO we are:

Brains Worldwide Foundation, NFP* is a 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to eliminating misdiagnosed and undiagnosed concussions.

HOW we can help you: 

The Brains Worldwide Foundation provides education on the hidden dangers of brain concussions, 24/7 Hotline support for questions regarding concussions, college scholarships for child athletes who are permanently restricted from access to sporting scholarships due to brain concussions, and ongoing research on objective assessment technologies that identify brain injuries.

WHAT you can do to help: Donate funds and/or participate in research…

Your donation of just $1 will help us educate families worldwide about the hidden danger of brain concussions and how to keep children safe.

Your donation of $5 or more will help us support parents with our 24/7 Hotline, and support injured student-athletes with the Brains Worldwide Athletic Scholarship Fund.

Participate in the Brains Worldwide Foundation Pilot Study If you have one or more children ages 8 – 18, we invite you to be one of 150 families to get first access to the Objective Brain Concussion Assessment and Monitoring System™ - the first effective technology ever designed for parents to test their children for brain injuries at home. Watch the video above or scroll down this page to read about this portable, life-saving technology that has been proven 100% effective at detecting injuries to the 5 areas of the brain that produce the hidden symptoms of concussions.

*Brains Worldwide Foundation, NFP is the new name of LifeQuality USA, NFP (founded in 2010). In 2015, we changed our name to better reflect our mission to make sure people worldwide have the education, support, research and technology they need so they never suffer the results of an undetected, undiagnosed or under-treated brain concussion.
story_txt:
Undetected Brain Concussions - Save Your Child Now





 

WHY SO MANY CHILDREN ARE AT RISK AND WHAT YOU MUST KNOW TO PROTECT YOUR FAMILY

 


    From the moment your child was born, you’ve given more love than you knew you had to give. You cradled your baby’s head, gently shampooed the soft spots,
    placed cushions around the crib, child-proofed your home, and installed a safety seat in your car.


    You did everything you could to keep your baby safe, and today your child runs, climbs, jumps, swims, cycles, skates and explores the world with a fearless
    hunger for adventure, experiencing fun, laughter and the occasional bump on the head.


It’s normal for kids to bump their heads
    - on kitchen cabinets, getting into cars, getting a can off a shelf, falling off a bike or skateboard, sliding down a railing or missing a catch at the
    park.


It’s normal for girls
    to get elbowed in soccer or collide on the basketball court.


It’s normal for boys
    to have their brains jostled on the football field by 1600 pounds of force hitting head-on.


It’s normal for boys and girls
    to hit their heads when they slip in the tub, fall on the ice, tumble down a hill, trip on a shoelace or swim laps in the pool.


Kids hit their heads all the time – it’s just a normal part of childhood.


 


But just because it’s normal, doesn't make it healthy.


    The scary truth is every time your child’s head gets hit or jostled, s/he’s at risk for a concussion – a serious brain injury that can
    have a devastating impact on every part of his/her life.


    While we’d like to believe it could never happen to our own kids, the fact is concussions are much more common than we once believed.


    Research shows concussions have become a significant problem for millions of children worldwide. The Center for Disease Control says
    
        sports-related concussions are at epidemic levels and we’re seeing a widespread incidence of concussions occurring in playgrounds, classrooms, and even
        at home.
    


    The latest research findings reveal 70% of children have had at least one concussion, and they estimate the real number is closer to 90% -
    that’s 3 million children in the United States alone!


    It’s also estimated that 40% of those children have never been diagnosed as having concussions. So these children are running
    around untreated and at serious risk for permanent brain damage, a dysfunctional life and an early death.


    We are committed to making sure this never happens to your child.


We are the Brains Worldwide Foundation and we’re driven to bring you the education, support,    research and technology you need to keep your children safe from the hidden dangers of brain concussion. We’re making that happen across 3
    critical areas of service.
BRAINS WORLDWIDE FOUNDATION EDUCATION

 


    The brain is the control center of everything that keeps your child alive. Every breath, every heartbeat, every moment of laughter, learning and growth
    depends on your child having a healthy brain. You don’t need us to tell you that. But here are some critical facts about your child’s brain you may NOT
    know…


==> 
    Before the age of 14, children’s brains are at significantly higher risk for sustaining a concussion than at any other time of their lives.


==> 
    If they do get a concussion, children between the ages of 5 and 18 run the highest risk of developing a condition called Post Concussion Syndrome
    leading to chronic headaches, dizziness and a host of other symptoms that could go on indefinitely and dramatically impact their lives.


==> 
    Research shows girls have 2 to 3 times more concussions than boys when they are playing the same sports and girls’ concussions are typically more severe
    and take longer to heal.


==> 
    While all playground and sporting activities carry a risk of injury, the top 2 children’s sports for concussions are football for boys and soccer for
    girls.


==> 
    We try to keep our children safe from concussions by having them they wear helmets, but research shows helmets reduce only some of the force of a
    hit to the head. In fact, while we once believed the only way to get a concussion is through a direct blow to the head, we now know this is a myth.


==> 
    All it takes for your child to get a concussion is to be subjected to enough force so the brain gets jostled inside the skull, and that can happen by the
    air bag engaging in a car or being violently tossed around on a carnival ride.


==> 
    All the research tells us the odds are really strong that your child will get a concussion. The problem is how are you supposed to know if your child’s
    brain gets injured – especially if you weren’t there to see it happen?


==> 
    Standard advice is to watch your child for headaches, dizziness, loss of consciousness or vomiting but these symptoms don’t always appear. Research has
    shown there are many hidden symptoms of concussions and far too often, these symptoms get ignored or attributed to something else.


    Here are just some of the symptoms that get overlooked or misinterpreted:


==> 
    Fatigue


==> 
    Lack of focus


==> 
    A sudden drop in grades


==> 
    Irritability


==> 
    Concentration problems


==> 
    Aggression


==> 
    Lack of balance


==> 
    Sensitivity to light


==> 
    Sensitivity to sound


==> 
    Changes in sense of taste


==> 
    Changes in sense of smell


==> 
    Insomnia


==> 
    Mood Swings


    The fact is all these symptoms are commonly diagnosed as something other than a concussion, causing your child to be labeled with Social and Behavioral
    Problems, Learning Disorders, Psychological Disorders, or to be diagnosed with Allergies, Stress, Hormonal Changes, and the most common of all, ADHD
    (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder). Let’s take ADHD as an example –


    We know that in 2011, the CDC reported 11% of children aged 4 – 17 had been diagnosed with ADHD (that’s 6. 4 million children).


    The question is, how many of those children are really suffering from undiagnosed concussions? 


And if that’s the case,    how can we assess these children before it’s too late and they are left with long-term brain dysfunction or worse?


    Part of the problem is how assessments are made. If your child’s head gets hit in a supervised activity, assessments are typically done through the use of
    SUBJECTIVE measures. Your child will be asked a series of questions and observed for obvious symptoms like loss of consciousness or dizziness.


    The problem is concussions can impact 5 major areas of the brain, causing a host of symptoms that may not be immediately noticeable.


    The bigger problem is subjective assessments do not accurately measure the health of these 5 areas of the brain.



    Nevertheless, subjective testing is the accepted standard, so if your child passes a subjective test, no referral is made to a doctor. Then, when hidden
    symptoms start to appear, no one makes the connection between the symptoms and the original brain injury. And since so many concussions happen outside of
    an adult’s watchful eye, you may not even know there was an original injury.


There is far too much at stake to risk your child’s life to subjective testing.
    Particularly since savvy student athletes have learned to cheat on those tests in order to keep on playing.


    Your child needs to be assessed for the hidden symptoms of concussion through an OBJECTIVE measure of 5 distinct areas of the brain. If that assessment is
    done accurately, you will know if your child’s brain has been injured and whether it’s necessary to get your child to a doctor.


    If your doctor diagnoses a concussion, then your child needs to be continuously monitored with OBJECTIVE measures to determine when it is safe to return to
    play.


No matter how much your child appears to be fine, please, don’t settle for subjective assessments that put your child’s life at risk.


At Brains Worldwide Foundation, we believe the greatest protection your child can have against undetected concussions is ongoing,    up-to-date education, access to convenient and affordable objective testing and a solid partnership between you and your pediatrician.


    We’re committed to bringing you the education and support you need so you know how to identify, assess and report your child’s symptoms to your doctor. And
    that’s only the beginning of how we’re working to help you keep your child safe.

THE BRAINS WORLDWIDE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP FUND


    The second way we’re helping parents keep their children safe is through the establishment of a college scholarship fund for children who can’t play sports
    due to a brain concussion.

There is an ever-increasing problem occurring worldwide where,
despite physicians’ orders, children return to play before it’s safe.

 


    This puts children at tremendous risk because once a child has been concussed, any additional concussions significantly increase the risk for severely
    limited brain function, permanent degenerative brain damage, an ever-increasing cascade of thinking and behavioral problems and a life-threatening
    condition called Secondary Impact Syndrome.


    With so much at risk, why would a child return to play against doctor’s orders?


    Because the competitive edge is all about being tough, playing through the pain and being a team player.


    The social pressure to play is far stronger than a doctor’s treatment plan. After all, it’s just not cool to be a quitter. So kids learn to hide their
    symptoms, to cheat subjective test questions and to convince their parents, coaches and trainers that they’re totally fine.


    We understand a child’s drive to play is fueled by self-esteem, social recognition and the competitive drive to win. We also know for many child athletes,
    their urge to get back on the playing field is about survival. For these children, the only way they are able to have a hope for the future, is to receive
    a sporting scholarship to a good college, and that can’t happen if they’re not scouted on the field. The stakes for these kids are really high, so they do
    whatever it takes to stay in the game – even if it means risking their lives.


    That’s why we’re building the Brains Worldwide Scholarship Fund to provide financial assistance for child athletes who have been
    banned from play due to concussion.


    Our hope is that providing this support, we will help parents protect their children from undue risks without losing their chance for a successful and
    fulfilling future.

BRAINS WORLDWIDE ONGOING RESEARCH


    The third and most crucial mandate of the Brains Worldwide Foundation is ongoing research
 on
concussion assessment, reporting and monitoring technology
    .

    All children get tossed around and bump their heads, but not all of them end up with concussions. So how are you supposed to know when your child needs
    medical help – especially if you didn’t see the incident?


    How can you get documented proof that your child is experiencing any or all of the hidden symptoms of concussion so you know whether you need to contact
    your doctor?


    And most importantly, how do you know when the symptoms are severe enough that you need to take your child straight to the emergency room?


    Finally, if your child is diagnosed with a concussion, how are you supposed to monitor the healing process objectively so you can protect your child from
    returning to the playing field before it’s safe?


    We’ve been researching this problem for more than 10 years, seeking powerful and affordable technologies to give parents the tools they need to protect
    their children.


    We’re excited to announce this technology now exists, giving moms and dads the power to objectively assess injury to the 5 critical areas of the brain that
    are affected by concussions with a simple, portable unit that is specifically designed for home-use.


    This innovative technology is called the Objective Brain Concussion Assessment and Monitoring System™ (OBCAMS).




        OBCAMS brings powerful, cloud-based assessment, reporting and monitoring technology straight to your home so you have 24/7 access to test all areas of
        your child’s brain for maximum health by objectively assessing the 5 major areas of the brain that cause the hidden symptoms of concussion.
    


    The higher your child's score across these 5 areas, the more serious the brain injury and the more urgent it is that you take your child to see a doctor to
    rule out a concussion.

What’s it like to use OBCAMS?

    For you, it’s simply a matter of watching a quick video and then inviting your child to play a quick game.


    For your child, it is like playing a video game with 5 different levels of play. Each level will engage your child in a different game, with fun activities
    that measure your child’s ability to focus, reaction time, vision tracking, memory and balance.


    This is OBCAMS –


    As you can see, unlike medical devices, OBCAMS doesn’t require probes or sensors to be attached to your child’s head. Simply hand the tablet to your child
    and in less than 10 minutes you’ll know whether your child’s brain is functioning within the range of a healthy brain.


The process is easy to use and anyone can make it work. Simply touch the screen, follow the prompts and    invite your child to take the controls.


While your child is watching the screen, the cloud-based software will measure the 5 major areas of your child’s brain with objective accuracy that    can’t be manipulated by your child.


    When you’re done, simply touch the screen to complete the test and if your child is in danger, you will be alerted to go immediately to your closest
    hospital for emergency care.


    If your child’s results are outside the range of healthy, you’ll be alerted to take the report to your pediatrician to determine the best course of
    treatment for your child. 

Should your pediatrician recommend that your child stay off the playing field for a period of time, OBCAMS will help you monitor your child’s progress and
    give you objective data to bring to your doctor for follow-up care.


    If your child’s brain measures healthy in all 5 areas of the brain, your report will be emailed to you so you have it for comparison in the future.


    Kids love to take the OBCAMS tests and parents and doctors are telling us they’re excited about the OBCAMS technology--- but does it really work?

PROOF

    We tested a group of 2000 students and veterans using OBCAMS and here’s what we found:


    Of the 2000 people we tested, 401 showed significant symptoms of brain concussions. We then sent those people to their doctors, who, in turn, confirmed our
findings – each of the 401 who had shown significant symptoms with OBCAMS, were diagnosed with brain concussions by their doctors. That's    100% accuracy.


    Now here’s the really scary part of the findings:


    Of the 401 people who were found to have brain concussions, 38% had been previously cleared by the medical community. In other words, these people had been
    told they did not have concussions!


    If we hadn’t used OBCAMS to test those people, 152 children and veterans would have been at serious risk for extended brain damage.

How many more children are out there with undetected concussions?

    OBCAMS technology is being manufactured by Brains Worldwide, Inc., and will be available to the general public for retail purchase in 2016.
    However the Brains Worldwide Foundation may be able to get this technology to you in advance before the general public through our mandate for
    research.



        We are collaborating with Brains Worldwide, Inc. to give 150 families a substantial discount to purchase the new OBCAMS technology so they can use it
        to objectively test their children’s brain health at home.
    


    If your family is selected for this program, you will participate in a pilot study where we will document your use of the OBCAMS technology for 1 year,
    noting any questions you might have along the way.


    Your feedback will provide the information we need to better serve families in the future through our 24 Hour Hotline service and ongoing
    education to help parents discuss test findings with their pediatricians.


In thanks for your participation in this study,    we will cover 50% of the fee for your device, technology and support, and the OBCAMS system will be yours to keep forever.


The pilot study will begin on March 1, 2016, and you can    apply to be one of the 150 families included by selecting the Pilot Study Perk on this page.



    The simple truth of childhood is that no matter how much we love our children and try to keep them safe, our kids will run and play and inevitably bump
    their heads.


    While we may not be able to fully protect our kids from getting concussions, at Brains Worldwide Foundation we are committed to bringing you the
    education, support, research and technology you need so you can keep your family safe from the hidden danger of concussions.


    Our experts are working hard to give you the help you need, but we need your help so we can help you.

Please help us help your family, and the millions of children who are at risk worldwide.

Your donation of just
$1 
    will help us educate families worldwide about the hidden danger of brain concussions and how to keep children safe.


Your donation of $5 or more
will help us support parents with our 24/7 Hotline and support injured student-athletes with the    Brains Worldwide Athletic Scholarship Fund.


Participate in the Brains Worldwide Foundation Home-Assessment Pilot Study 
    If you have one or more children ages 8 – 18, we invite you to be one of 150 families to get first access to the only objective assessment technology ever
    designed for home use. Watch the video above or scroll down this page to read about this life-saving technology.


    If you’re among the first 150 families to apply for participation in the OBCAMS Pilot Study, and if you meet the eligibility requirements,
    
        we’ll cover 1/2 of your OBCAMS fee, provide ongoing support and, in gratitude for your participation, you’ll get lifetime discounts on future testing
        technology and educational tools as they become available.
    


    You’ve worked so hard to give your children the love and protection they deserve. But you just can’t do it all yourself. Please help us help you and
    parents like you around the globe.


        Give what you can today – so every mom gets to kiss her child goodnight with a little less fear, a little more joy and a lot more love every single
        day.

In 2015, we changed our name to better reflect our mission to make sure people worldwide have the education, support, research and technology they need so they never suffer the results of an undetected, undiagnosed or under-treated brain concussion.

story:
Empower Single-Mom Grad Student

to become a Mental Health Counselor

Ever since I was a child I thought that entering the field of counseling would be immensely useful work, and deeply rewarding in a personal-spiritual sense as well. Spiritual I say, because there is nothing more rewarding than having a deep and authentic encounter with another human being; it rewards by refining my own essence, and from the satisfaction of knowing that it helps to lighten the load of another…  In fact I believe that promotion of the empathic art of counseling throughout human society in general has the capacity to generate profound social change; a paradigm shift, if you will, such as was understood by Gene Rodenberrry when he created a futuristic society complete with an empathic race of Betazoids, some of whom provided counseling to Star Fleet.

Why did I not do this when I was younger? I guess I felt immortal, and that I had all the time in the world. I followed the muse of music in those days, and it was soul enriching to live the artist’s path. At one point I wound up in Kathmandu, Nepal – and stayed for 11 years. There I lived an eight year intercultural marriage with a native Buddhist of Yolmo Tamang ethnicity. I studied Buddhism, went on many pilgrimages, and learned from the gentle ways of my extended Buddhist family. Many times, the wish filled my heart for giving back from the soul riches I received. Sadly, due to the strange twisting’s of karma, in the form of an illness, I had to leave Nepal, and so ended my marriage.

There are so many suffering people in this world. We suffer from many things, including lack of food, finances, security, shelter, social oppression, violence, abuse, communication issues, anxiety and depression. A counselor’s role is to help people find empowering self-awareness toward achieving their goals, and resolving their difficulties. This type of empowerment is a self-development that gives continuing strength for the journey of life.

All people of all walks of life, colors, nations, cultures, religions, class or socio-economic status experience suffering. The therapeutic process helps people become self-aware, and to lead authentic lives. And, as we become aware of how we have been affected by power, privilege, or oppression, we become compassionate social activists.

For those of you with knowledge of psychology, I am attracted mostly to Solution Focused Therapy, a practical, and person-centered, positive psychology approach that respects clients for already having experience, and knowledge, they can build on for solutions; they may just need help in the process, along with some unconditional positive regard. Other approaches I like are Relational-Cultural Theory, Narrative, and Cognitive Behavioral Theory. My approach is fuelled by my personal spirituality, informed by Mooji, Buddha, Yoga, and Gaia, though not in any particular order, and devoid of any dogma.

My life as well has had its share of suffering.

Help me to realize my dream?

As a mother, as a Buddhist, as counselor.

I need to do a certain university course in October, and that is why I am asking for help now…

I am enrolled in Capella University’s online program in Mental Health Counseling. I must attend a Colloquium course in Florida, for a week in October, and I am $4,000 short of what I need for that (tuition, flights, and hotel costs). I have already delayed this course once, because it is not covered by financial aid (student loans), and I haven’t got the money. The course is required, and there is a chance that I will be dropped from the University program if I try to delay it again. I can’t buy tickets or register for the course unless I get some help. 

I embarked on this life path a few years ago, and have completed 8 courses so far, (32 credits), with all A’s and one B, for an average grade of 3.875. I still have 64 credits to go, and I am doubling up my course load now that my son is in preschool.

I have no other sources of support currently than my student loans, and I am only eligible for the bare minimum, not enough for our survival. I am lucky that a friend gave my son and I a place to live in Berlin, Germany, where a good preschool is only 25 Euros a month. I am looking for work, having just arrived, and not speaking German. I am counting on finding some real philanthropists, who can be the warm, caring family I need to support me through this launch into a new, and very worthwhile career.

When I graduate, or before, I wish to return to the United States to work for a community mental health agency. I firmly believe that if governments put as much money into healing society, as they do for wars, that the human species would evolve far beyond belief in violence, and become all that we have ever dreamed. This is my effort towards that; I pray that I will achieve this goal. With your help I can.

Be Well, Hugs,

Willow Broaddus

I am lucky that a friend gave my son and I a place to live in Berlin, Germany, where a good preschool is only 25 Euros a month. I am looking for work, having just arrived, and not speaking German. I am counting on finding some real philanthropists, who can be the warm, caring family I need to support me through this launch into a new, and very worthwhile career.
When I graduate, or before, I wish to return to the United States to work for a community mental health agency. I firmly believe that if governments put as much money into healing society, as they do for wars, that the human species would evolve far beyond belief in violence, and become all that we have ever dreamed. This is my effort towards that; I pray that I will achieve this goal. With your help I can.
Be Well, Hugs,
Willow Broaddus

story:
Once upon a time in the magical land of Hillcrest dwelled the fair lady Christina Perry and her charming cat companion, George.  They were quite the entertaining pair...  throwing fabulous parties, entertaining the masses at local hangouts, uploading adorable/hilarious pictures, and generally making life better.  They were both beloved by all who knew them.

Until one dark day when a shadow crept over her magical castle...

While fair lady Perry was out SLAVING over a hot coffee machine in attempts to satify the masses, a horrible monster savagely forced it's way into her home.  It tore from room to room leaving destruction in it's wake... Charming George did his best to scare off the beast with his fellow feline warriors Mimi and Scooby, but alas... it was too late.  For the evil creature had stolen fair Christina's beloved laptop!!  Had all faith in humanity been lost?!?!

NO

There is still hope for humanity.  We, the people, can make this right!  With a simple donation, you too can help turn this into something good.  All we ask is to donate what you can, if you can.  All proceeds (aside from the fee indiegogo charges) will go to fair Christina a few days before her birthday this September so she can replace her beloved laptop. 

Imagine what a wonderful surprise that would be!!!!

Speaking of surprise...

CHRISTINA DOES NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS

And we would like to keep it that way until the fundraiser is over.  So please do not tell her (or George.  He tells her everything.)
 
Thank you for reading this.  And if you can donate, THANK YOU FOR BEING AWESOME!!!

story:
Children With Autism Learn to Ski!

Spruce Point on the Slopes, a program of Spurwink, helps children on the autism spectrum learn to ski.  Started two years ago, the program is available at Sugarloaf Mountain in Carrabassett Valley. 

Like all children, kids with autism should have the opportunity to participate in outdoor winter activities, learn a new sport, and be involved with other kids. Children with autism, however, have challenges that require a person trained in understanding autism to assist them…..Spruce Point on the Slopes provides this!

Trained volunteers provide 1:1 support for children with autism enrolled in the mountain ski school groups. Spruce Point volunteers have expertise in the field of autism, and have careers such as special education teacher, clinician, recreation therapist, speech and language professional, and direct care provider.

Benjamin Kahrl, father of six-year Lily, remembers the look on his daughter’s face when she skied for the first time: “She absolutely loved it. For our family, Spruce Point on the Slopes meant being able to take a vacation together. In the past, we had to plan separate activities that were appropriate for each child. Now, we can do these things together.”

Why should you support this effort?

The prevalence of autism continues to rise, with 1 in 88 children now being diagnosed. Children on the autism spectrum and their families are often so involved in educational services, meetings, and special therapies that there is little time or energy leftover for fun. Spruce Point on the Slopes allows children on the spectrum to engage in this fun winter sport in classes with other children. Your donation will fully cover the cost of lessons, equipment rental, lift tickets, and 1:1 trained support for these children. This package will be offered to families totally FREE! 

FMI:  https://www.facebook.com/#!/SprucePointOnTheSlopesSugarloafandMtAbram

story:
LifeChurch Makati has a huge potential in reaching people who do not know Christ. It is our passion, as shared with LifeChurch.tv, to do anything short of sin to reach people who do not know Christ. And to reach people no one is reaching, we have to do things no one is doing. 

Since we launched 3 years ago, we hovered at 50 people every week. While we're grateful to have seen people come to Christ in the past 3 years, we know something's missing. That we can do more for Jesus.

We know that we are currently meeting at a location almost non-existent to people within the area, thus becoming a hindrance for our people in inviting their friends. 

We know that LifeKids is a problem as we do not have a fitting facility available in our current location making it a hindrance in serving young families.

Where we are at right now is safe, comfortable and doesn't require faith. But we have to start living through one of our core values:

WE ARE FAITH-FILLED, BIG THINKING, ALL OR NOTHING RISK TAKERS.
We'll never insult God with small thinking and safe living.

Therefore, on February 9, we're going to move back to Glorietta Mall, particularly at the Holiday Inn function rooms, where people, families and friends converge on weekends. We will launch the goal of having 250 people attending 2 Experiences. 

This move requires faith. This move requires help from people who care for people who are far from God.

Will you consider partnering with us in relaunching LifeChurch Makati?

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who are Globe Poets?

Globe Poets is a youth-led poetry collective from London based in Globe Academy Secondary School, founded four years ago by students Zareen Roy Macauley, Tasnima Ahmed and Aneesha Hussain.

We have seen how poetry has got young people of all ages in our school talking about politics and social justice in a way that they never have done before.

We meet weekly to discuss and write poetry about the issues that affect young people today - including our struggles with exam pressures at school, mental health, insecure housing and police discrimination.

We are inspired by national and international political movements around the world - from Black Lives Matter to Sisters Uncut - who are led by artists and activists who have demanded change in a language that young people can understand.

Why do we want to go to Brave New Voices?

Last year, we were the first ever youth team from London to go to Brave New Voices when it took place in Washington DC.

Many of the young people who went did not even have a passport before the trip, and it was truly life-changing to see their confidence in themselves and their ideas grow as a result of having an international platform to have their voice heard.

We think it is even more vital that we go this year given the political climate. Donald Trump is trying to divide us with his politics of fear, and we believe we must connect with young people from around the world to remind each other that hope is possible.

Why are we crowd-funding?

Globe Poets is based at Globe Academy Secondary School in Elephant and Castle. Whilst our school is full of talented, inspiring young people, we are also in one of the most deprived boroughs in the city. The majority of our students receive Free School Meals, meaning their total household income is under £16,000 a year.

We wanted to make sure that the opportunity to go to America was open to every single student in the school, regardless of background, and the only way we could do this was to make the trip entirely funded by donations.

How will your money be spent?

For every pound that you donate, it will be match-funded like-for-like by the Principal of our school. It costs £2000 per poet to take them for the duration of the trip. This cost includes:

  • Return flights to San Francisco
  • Festival entrance fee
  • Food and accommodation for the duration of the trip
  • Travel insurance and visas
  • Support staff mentoring and coaching for the team

How can you help?

There are many things you can do to help!

  • Take advantage of some of our really exciting rewards
  • Tweet about us @GlobePoets
  • Share the link on Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat
  • Read, write, organise...!

story:
I am a mother and business women in a small Saskatchewan town. A member of our church has a daughter who has been living and working with a mission in Moldova for nearly 2 years now and has helped us learn of the great need in this forgotten part of Europe. We have formed a group of six people to travel to Moldova from Aug. 4 to Aug. 18, 2012 to take part in an outreach program.

Without putting too fine a point on it, the country is in bad shape. Moldova is known as the poorest country in Europe. Extreme poverty exists in the villages and towns—annual income can be as low as $250. Unemployment is around 80% and many people rely on the produce from their land as their only source of income. Moldova has many social problems due to parents leaving the country to find work. Human trafficking and alcoholism are rampant.

Here's an example of why we are passionate about going to this country to help... A member of the mission in Moldova was in a village and discovered a home that had only two occupants: a six year old and a 4 month old baby. The children had lice and had not eaten in at least 4 days. Most of us can't imagine such poverty!

Trust is a big issue in this country. Following many years of corruption, people are very reluctant to trust. As foreigners, we are able to build bridges between the group that is working to bring aid and the people who need it. We will be engaging in children's programs and bringing supplies to the elderly.

We have raised most of our support for our flights and costs while there, so your donation will not go toward our costs. We will use the money we raise here to bring supplies with us from Canada for the children. Just a few dollars will enable us to bring things like crayons and inflatable balls to give to the kids. $100 will purchase badly needed food supplies for the elderly. $1,000 will build a playground—they actually don't have these!

There has been a change and I will be joining my group in the trekking adventure. Originally I had planned to do a cycling adventure while the rest of my group went trekking. The video at the top shows a trekking group from 2011.

For your donation of $10 we will send you a photo of our team and a personal greeting. If you make a donation of $100, I will also send you a digital copy of Prairies North: the magazine of Saskatchewan (this is my business). If you make a donation of $1,000 or more, we will include all of the above and send you a video of us in Moldova.

If we raise more than our goal of $1,000, the money will be used for programs to rescue young women and children from the human trafficking industry or for operating a day centre for children. So, don't stop at $1,000! We are contributing this money directly to the group in Moldova so every penny will be used to help them.

If you can't contribute, that's OK. We want to let people know about Moldova and the great need in this country, so share our campaign. You can also send people here: http://www.md.om.org/ for more information. Prayers for our group are most welcome.

Thank you so much for reading through. Hope to connect with you from Moldova!

story:
Short Summary

Our intention and goal is to make Samui Montessori a special place where parents, teachers and staff work together to provide a safe, harmonious and enriching environment for children to learn and grow.
The school’s philosophy is founded on the educational principles developed by Maria Montessori. The Montessori method is based on a deep respect for children’s spontaneous desire to learn and celebrates each child’s inherent talents and unique personality. Learning environments are created to foster functional independence and develop a lifelong love of learning.

Our school is starting very small, expecting only 25 children in the first year. We are a family-run school and funding has been out-of-pocket and through loans entirely. Classes started in September, 2012 and we are slowly building our classes and getting our name into the community.

Our teachers are AMI trained and come from overseas. Our assistants are parent volunteers and local Thai staff, interested in the Montessori philosophy of education and excited to help us start the school.

What We Need

We are raising funds for a few main needs that the school has:

1. Scholarship fund for local children to  attend the school at a reduced rate

2. Playground equipment: a slide, swing set and climbing area that will be accessible to students and the rest of the community.
3. Repairs to the school in preparation for the monsoon season: rain guards and a cover for our outdoor portion of the classroom.
4. More Montessori materials for the growing classes and help to set up our garden planters. We would like to send our Thai staff to do AMI training here in Thailand as well!
5. We plan to expand within the next two years, to buy land and build a Montessori school village for toddlers through high school. Any help towards this goal would be incredible!

The Impact

Montessori education is education for Peace. By helping children to learn at their own speed in an environment that is tailored 100% to them, they are led onto the path of healthy, happy development. We teach children to be functionally independent, courteous and polite citizens of the world. We teach conflict resolution and the environment fosters a strong bond between the mixed ages. Children learn with enthusiasm and are much better prepared to become productive, kind members of society. Montessori-educated children often learn to read and write faster than traditional education, have a better grasp of mathematics and geography through the hands-on materials that are used in Montessori classes.
 
1. Your contribution will make it possible for low-income children to attend the school. 2. It will also help to create a much-needed community space for parents and children to meet and play outside of school hours.
3. We can lower tuition if we receive outside help for the school, giving more people the opportunity to join.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends about our project.

Donations of books, wooden toys, puzzles, art and craft supplies and stationary paper are greatly appreciated as well.

For local residents, your time to help us with our garden would be great. Also, we are open to ideas for community gatherings, play dates and other functions that we can hold at Samui Montessori.

Donations can be sent directly to the school. Contact Mira for more details.

+66 8 444 01702 mirashai@me.com

www.samuimontessori.com

www.facebook.com/samuimontessori

story:
Our Playful Mission

Playful Roots is a non-denominational, spiritual ministry created by 2 moms bringing the wisdom of yoga, tai- chi, Native American, tribal African, and energy activations to families of all backgrounds. Personal transformation is the path to societal transformation. The Children's Sanctuary Project is located in the magical mountains of Crestone,Colorado. Rev. Tiya Keyze and Cecile Lanao are the creators of Playful Roots and are committed to healing themselves and  the planet back into LOVE.

Children's Sanctuary Project in Crestone,Colorado.

The ministry offers tools allowing children and families to move through life with ease and grace. As a 501c(3) Charitable nonprofit, non-denominational ministry, our vision to offer yoga programs, counseling, spiritual services, and wellness based workshops, to those who need it most, everyone!  

Your funds help to keep The Temple of Consciousness as a space to empower  children through classes that will lead them to the guru within.  All classes help to foster creativity and expansiveness in self. The 5 human values are at the core of our teachings.

Love

Truth (Love in speech)

Right conduct (Love in action)

Peace (Love in thought)

Non-violence (Love in understanding)

The magnitude of what we can achieve here is unparalleled.  With Love, you attract your higher self.  If we can all attract our higher selves, the shift into unity is here. The information era has pushed us to evolve in the understanding that we are not a society of many cultures but a tribe of one. We are not associated with any one religion; instead we practice the human code of tolerance and compassion for all systems of peaceful beliefs. As an organization we are created of many different backgrounds, but it’s the yoga at our core, that strengthens the faith in ourselves and in-turn allows us to plant the seed of self-love in others. . When you allow the mind to be calm, you are able to make lighter, more conscious decisions for yourself and those around you.

Yoga is more than a downward dog or a headstand; it’s the ability to take the confidence and peace gained in the physical practice to all aspects of ones life.    The child in each of us wants to be free and live with the peace and ease that is deserved.  Yoga is the union with this divine love. Spreading this light to all is the mission of our ministry.  Your fund will help us to sustain our programs for families.Our community is  based on self mastery and sustainablitlity.  We teach, mentor and give back through programs based on a simple four part philosophy that allows this complicated world to be turned on it’s head...

breathing, giving, loving, and connecting.

breathe consciously.  It is the easiest way to control the body and mind.

love yourself first. It will make every relationship you have stronger.

give with an open heart to everyone around you.  It is the footprint you leave on earth.

connect peacefully with each other. It is through a life of conscious breathe, self love, and gracious giving that we will truly connect to all energies & beings.

The temple was created to give children and parents a space to learn, hear and play with energy.  The energy here supports the growth of mind, body, andspirit. You will find a unique blend of yoga, sound healing, breath work and aromatherapy, all supporting the growth of our children. Our classes are great for prompting focus, managing stress, emotions, and self-confidence. 

Our community is always looking for ways to live and teach sustainability.  It takes about $50,000 per year to run our non profit family yoga center.  We will be needing to fill up on gas and food for the winter months.  In addition, Your donation will be invaluable in helping to keep our current programs running. 

 

Programs

Kids Themed Yoga Journeys
Tai chi
African Dance
Tribal Drumming
Family Labyrinth Walks
Aromatherapy classes
Partners Yoga
Family Camp Outs
Toddler Yoga Story Time
Connecting Children and spirit guides/Animals 
Building Projects
Parents Yoga Night
Creative Crafts
Plays, Games and Yoga Obstacle Courses
Sacred parenting workshops
New Mom/Dad support/ Help with meals, child care and relaxation 
Family Energy Work
Aromatherapy
Breath Activations
Goddess Days
Brotherhood Outdoor Retreats
Yoga
Hoop
Dance
Meditations
Chat Groups
Empowerment Workshops
Conscious Breath Classes
Integrative Energy Balancing
Hiking Excursions
Compassion Hearts volunteer program taking care of those in need
Drum Circles  and ceremonies honoring the moon
Monthly Workshops geared towards awakening, healing and creating

 

Playful Roots Yoga Ministry is affiliated with The Alliance of Divine Love, a self-awareness program of study to interested and aware individuals. The materials for this consciousness awakening program are contained in the handbooks of Spiritual Development. This course introduces the student to the many levels of awareness that can be tapped into to create a personal image aligned with Higher Self, thus easing the tension and stress of life in today’s chaotic society and creating a platform for Divine Service. Your donation will help to keep this program donation based.  

Playful Roots Yoga Monistry was created by Tiya Keyze and Cecile Lanao with the goal of spreading more love and awareness in their world.  

 

Rev Tiya Keyze
Co founder Playful Roots Yoga Ministry

Tiya has always imagined a future where all children can grow up knowing the power of ease, grace, and love of who they are.  teaching children impeccability with  words and power of energy exchange is at the cire of her work. if we open our hearts to the conscious breath connection, yoga and meditation as a daily practice, we will create a better world, better schools & most important, a healthier generation of children. Tiya remains in service as an Ordained Non-Denominational Minister, Children’s and Family Yoga Instructor, Conscious Breath Specialist, and  Reiki Master/Integrative Energy Activator. Tiya has two wonderful sons, Carmine (7) and Gabriel (6). They are her inspiration and motivation to create a world with more balance and more love for one another. “Their generation needs us to change our perception and fix the systems that are failing.”

 ………..

Cecile Lanao 
Co founder Playful Roots Yoga Ministry

 

Cecile has always encouraged others to create their optimum reality and live from the heart.  She is a 200 hour certified Sivananda Yoga Instructor, Prenatal & Conscious Birthing Yoga Teacher, and Doula. She has been practicing many styles of yoga (Kundalini, Power Flow, and Bikram) for over 7 years. All of her classes are designed to be inspiring, connecting and playful. Her Prenatal, Mommy- Baby and Family Yoga classes help to create a more peaceful and loving approach to parenting.  Cecile feels contemplation, meditation, and awareness can help us all tap into the infinite amount of peace and joy available.  She feels committed to living a life of compassion while teaching the greatest degree of love through classes  that spread awareness and self mastery. Logan Hart 4 and Brody Skye 3 are the inspiration for her creation in the children's Sanctuary Project.  "I wanted to create a world  for them where they could play and feel their perfection of self."

Our Playful Mission
Playful Roots is a non-denominational, spiritual ministry created by 2 moms bringing the wisdom of yoga, tai- chi, Native American, tribal African, and energy activations to families of all backgrounds. Personal transformation is the path to societal transformation. The Children's Sanctuary Project is located in the magical mountains of Crestone,Colorado. Rev. Tiya Keyze and Cecile Lanao are the creators of Playful Roots and are committed to healing themselves and  the planet back into LOVE.

Children's Sanctuary Project in Crestone,Colorado.
The ministry offers tools allowing children and families to move through life with ease and grace. As a 501c(3) Charitable nonprofit, non-denominational ministry, our vision to offer yoga programs, counseling, spiritual services, and wellness based workshops, to those who need it most, everyone!  Your funds help to keep The Temple of Consciousness as a space to empower  children through classes that will lead them to the guru within.  All classes help to foster creativity and expansiveness in self. The 5 human values are at the core of our teachings.
Love
Truth (Love in speech)
Right conduct (Love in action)
Peace (Love in thought)
Non-violence (Love in understanding)
The magnitude of what we can achieve here is unparalleled.  With Love, you attract your higher self.  If we can all attract our higher selves, the shift into unity is here. The information era has pushed us to evolve in the understanding that we are not a society of many cultures but a tribe of one. story:
Sean and Marie-Eve are moving

Sean has helped all of us move at least once. Sure he has eaten his fair share of pizza and beer but I think he deserves a little more.

 Since he actually hired movers...

He has told me on numerous occasions that he would NEVER hire movers, "as long as I have someone to help me with the couch, fridge and stove... I can do the rest myself..." Oh Sean....

For all his help... let's throw some money at the guilt

The way I see it:

  • we can't really help (other than paint, clean ...)
  • a little goes a long way
  • he has always helped us move and I think this would be a nice thing to do
  • and I am totally willing to give up $10-$20 to not have to carry a dresser, boxes of books, bags of clothes...

I understand times may be a little tough...

Anything will be appreciated including your kind words and moral support.

Shhhh the funds will be a surprize!

All proceeds will be given to Sean and Marie-Eve the weekend of April 13th, (perhaps we can all get together?).

Thanks,

Lorraine

And please share with anyone who this may be of interest to.

story:
WHAT IS SAALY

The global budget crisis led to cutbacks in school art programs all over the world. In 2011, Zanbeel Art launched a program called "South Asian Art Literacy for Youth" (SAALY). SAALY is an educational outreach program that strives to build bridges between the U.S and South Asia via art classes and art exchanges in low income schools.

 

SAALY'S FIRST PROJECT

Geared to tackle this problem head on, SAALY made its debut in October 2011 with its pilot at The Watts Elementary School in South Los Angeles.

An underprivileged school district, many students at this elementary school never had the opportunity to take art classes previously and knew virtually nothing about the South Asian region. Zanbeel Art handpicked accomplished artists to teach weekly art classes to the 5th grade on topics including portraits, sculpture, calligraphy, photography, endangered species, and herb planting.

The artists/teachers utilized creative tools such as visual projections, maps, and various art materials to help the students build essential critical thinking skills and an ability to see the world from a new perspective. Teachers worked closely with students to help transform negative thoughts and assumptions they may have about South Asia into a deeper understanding, empathy, and mutual respect for the region and its people. 

The purpose of the classes was to trigger a nine-week intellectual transformation of the students by expanding their understanding of the idea of culture and encouraging them to become citizens of the world. Activities were focused on developing skills needed to live and work effectively in culturally and politically diverse societies.

Each class closely followed Los Angeles public school guidelines in areas such as Social Studies and Geography, and incorporated K-12 education standards which will be in affect in 2013. All classes were designed by teacher and education expert Cheryl Maletta Trujillo of California State University, Dominguez Hills.

CONTINUING SAALY PROJECTS

SAALY 2011 was so successful that The Watts Elementary School has invited Zanbeel Art back to implement SAALY 2012. Although the core of the program will remain the same, this years classes will incorporate a creative exchange with students in Pakistan that belong to a similar age group and low socioeconomic status.

ABOUT ZANBEEL ART

Zanbeel Art is a South Asian cultural resource for Visual Art, Literature, Film and Music. Zanbeel Art's vision is to provide exposure to established and emerging South Asian artists, and to enrich and inspire students in low socio economic regions in the US and South Asia via art related educational outreach programs.

story:
Hello My Sisters and Brothers, my name is Mischele, I am the High Priestess for THE COUNCIL OF GALACTIC FEDERATIONS on earth which oversees all tasks and duties performed by Galactic Federations, Associations and Affiliations. The Council of Galactic Federations mission is to gather all existing Galactic Federations for the purpose of tearing down the old ways, beliefs and foundations of the old world and organizing then implementing new foundations, structures, democracies and societies built, truly, for the people and by the people. This is the beginning of earth’s birthing pains and her rebirth that will follow. I am calling for the unification of the original tribe members of earth, all galactic federations, associations, affiliations, members and star seeds; to help me prepare the inhabitants of earth and begin the process of building our new world. I am calling for help in assisting me in negotiations with government, spiritual and political leaders and the people of earth, by healing, activating their dormant DNA and revealing the truths of human existence.  Our goal is to build and produce a poverty and pollution free world that provides FREE esoteric education for all species throughout the super universes to freely and safely evolve on planet earth.

I am constantly working and pursuing ways to successfully find common ground between humans, other forms of life and worlds so we can all learn, grow, evolve and co-exist together on earth. The Council of Galactic Federations is always striving towards integrating earth and its galactic ancestors in the cosmos as one super planet for all beings throughout the super universes to enjoy live and create their own “heaven”. Our job is to help humans evolve and shift with Gia mother Earth whom is changing with or without you so why not jump on the express train to creating your own “heaven on earth”.

When you work for the greater good of all involved, the universal god source energies all work for you to make sure you needs and wants are met as needed and help you reach success on all levels. 

High Priestess, Mischelle, Shellie L Robinson

Council for the Galactic Federations

A Council of the Spiritual Hiherarchy, Astro and Human Light Beings Working for the Greater Good of the Super Universes as a Whole.

story:
Welcomeeee!

I'm Vladimir, friends call me Vlado. I'm 22 years old and I coming from Pula, Croatia. Every great dream begins with a dreamer. I'm a dreamer. I have to dream and reach for the stars. You are never too old to set another goal or another dream. For me, that dream is to become a PILOT. All of us need to help each other. I know that a dream doesn't become reality through magic. It takes sweat, determination and hard work. I'am a hard worker and I will not stop on my dreams until I succed. 
Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return. - Leonardo Da Vinci
At the picture below is my biggest support and motivator, fiancee Josipa. Because of me, she stared loving a aviation much as I.

How did it all begin?

At 2014, I moved to college at Pula. At spring 2015, I start to work at Pula Airport as a baggage handler. The passion for planes came unexpectedly. That was the point in my life when I understood that the planes and all about them is what i want to do in life. In the winter came the project at the university that I attend. It was about creating a marketing plan for Pula Airport. I sign up for that project with my fiancee and afer result we were the third. Now, because that project I become a ramp agent at Pula Airport. That is very excellent job to prepare for the next dream I have. I learned a lot about  planes, theirs weight and balance and other things. I need to thank colleagues Teuta and Cindy for help me with a cartoon and ideas. They belives I will reach the dream and become pilot. That was how it all begin, but the question is how will it all end? 

The Flight Simulator 

When passion for aviation came to me, I stared with Flight Simulator. I learned a lot about aviation, charts, planes, air traffic control, weather...After 2 years of solo flight, I stared to flight online with other people at IVAO network. I meet a lot of new friends there and learned what I was didn't know. At this time, I flight for Croatia Airlines Virtual at Bombardier Dash-8 q400. This is a virtual dream that I want to turn into reality. 

    


Look into the future!

The next thing what I need for realization of my dream is to sign the pilot school. All the money I recived will be entirely for that purpose. Nowadays, that is very expensive, but I trust with desire and a help from other peoples everything is possible. I will never stop to dream about that and I will trying in all ways to reach the dream of becoming a pilot. 
There is the prices where the money will goes for a Pilot Licence:
Medical examination: 100€
Flight theory: 600€
Flight training: 3,500€
Night flight theory: 950€
Night flight training: 2,000€
At the pictures below is also my biggest motivators, idols and friends Marino and Igor. In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can. We need to b

elieve that life is worth living and your our belief will help create the fact. We

 can't get there alone. People have to help you. 

Help me to reach those stars and become a PILOT.


                  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have some idea, or you know the other way how can I become a pilot post it in a comment. For every help I will be thankful. Best regards, Vladimir Fašaić.
