story:
Short Summary

Haskin Elementary School in Center, Colorado has an extremely high at-risk student population and has long struggled to raise reading achievement.  With a 90% poverty rate as determined by federal free and reduced lunch participation and a 50% English Language Learner population, we have long struggled to bring our reading performance up to state average.

In 2010, upon receiving a federal Turnaround Improvement Grant, all Haskin staff members were trained in the Lindamood-Bell reading intervention processes.  After one year of full implementation, Haskin 3rd grade reading proficiency increased from 28% proficient in 2010 to 41% proficient in 2011.  

After 2 years of implementation our reading proficiency increased to 76% in 2012, greater that the state of Colorado average proficiency of the very first time.  

With the end of our Turnaround grant we have struggled to secure the funds needed to provide this intervention to EVERY child who needs it.  

In 2013 our 3rd grade reading proficiency remained high at 62% proficient, and in 2014 it was at 67%.  However, during each of these years we had to treat fewer and fewer children because of a lack of after school services dollars.

Though Turnaround Improvement Grant dollars have gone away, we still have many staff members who are trained in this intervention process and would be willing to continue their work, if only they can be compensated. 

Our goal is to provide EVERY child who needs this intervention with 80 hours of services after school  We currently serve 45 children.  We need to serve 75.  In this year's budget we are $12,000 short of our goal to serve all 75 children so any contribution you make will help us to provide these services for EVERY child who needs them.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our Lindamood-Bell after school intervention process costs $25 per hour to provide  treatment for up to 5 children in a group.  

A contribution of $25 will pay for 5 children to experience one full hour of intervention.

A contribution of $75 will pay for 5 children to experience a week's worth of intervention (3 one hour sessions).

A contribution of $2,000 will pay for 5 children to have all 80 hours of intervention. 

$12,000 will guarantee a total of 30 extra children receive 80 hours of intervention! 

The Impact

At over 90% free and reduced lunch, the Center School District is among the highest poverty school systems in the state of Colorado. In addition to this, there are some school districts that have single residences worth more than the total taxable value of property in the Center School District (only $25 million).  

This lack of property value makes it nearly impossible for us to increase funding through our local mill levy.  Your monetary contribution will ensure we provide this proven treatment to EVERY child who needs it at Haskin Elementary School!

Other Ways You Can Help

Learn more about the Lindamood-Bell intervention process and share this information with your local school or district about how impactful the intervention can be in helping students with severe reading challenges rise to grade level performance and above!

You can view more information about the Haskin Elementary Turnaround success sparked by its partnership with Lindammod-Bell at the following links:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eY1Z2PS6HJk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1TEd9q2mv3U
story_txt:
Short Summary
Haskin Elementary School in Center, Colorado has an extremely high at-risk student population and has long struggled to raise reading achievement.  With a 90% poverty rate as determined by federal free and reduced lunch participation and a 50% English Language Learner population, we have long struggled to bring our reading performance up to state average.
In 2010, upon receiving a federal Turnaround Improvement Grant, all Haskin staff members were trained in the Lindamood-Bell reading intervention processes.  After one year of full implementation, Haskin 3rd grade reading proficiency increased from 28% proficient in 2010 to 41% proficient in 2011.  
After 2 years of implementation our reading proficiency increased to 76% in 2012, greater that the state of Colorado average proficiency of the very first time.  
With the end of our Turnaround grant we have struggled to secure the funds needed to provide this intervention to EVERY child who needs it.  
In 2013 our 3rd grade reading proficiency remained high at 62% proficient, and in 2014 it was at 67%.  However, during each of these years we had to treat fewer and fewer children because of a lack of after school services dollars.
Though Turnaround Improvement Grant dollars have gone away, we still have many staff members who are trained in this intervention process and would be willing to continue their work, if only they can be compensated. 
Our goal is to provide EVERY child who needs this intervention with 80 hours of services after school  We currently serve 45 children.  We need to serve 75.  In this year's budget we are $12,000 short of our goal to serve all 75 children so any contribution you make will help us to provide these services for EVERY child who needs them.  

What We Need & What You Get
Our Lindamood-Bell after school intervention process costs $25 per hour to provide  treatment for up to 5 children in a group.  
A contribution of $25 will pay for 5 children to experience one full hour of intervention.
A contribution of $75 will pay for 5 children to experience a week's worth of intervention (3 one hour sessions).
A contribution of $2,000 will pay for 5 children to have all 80 hours of intervention. 
$12,000 will guarantee a total of 30 extra children receive 80 hours of intervention! 



The Impact
At over 90% free and reduced lunch, the Center School District is among the highest poverty school systems in the state of Colorado. In addition to this, there are some school districts that have single residences worth more than the total taxable value of property in the Center School District (only $25 million).  
This lack of property value makes it nearly impossible for us to increase funding through our local mill levy.  Your monetary contribution will ensure we provide this proven treatment to EVERY child who needs it at Haskin Elementary School!



Other Ways You Can Help
Learn more about the Lindamood-Bell intervention process and share this information with your local school or district about how impactful the intervention can be in helping students with severe reading challenges rise to grade level performance and above!
You can view more information about the Haskin Elementary Turnaround success sparked by its partnership with Lindammod-Bell at the following links:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eY1Z2PS6HJk
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1TEd9q2mv3U

story:
Shine a Light on Ability … not Disability!

My name is Tiphany Adams and I'm a star on Sundance Channel's critically acclaimed docu-series Push Girls. Thirteen years ago I was a passenger in a car that was hit by a drunk driver. As a result I have a spinal cord injury. I use a wheelchair and most people would say I have a "disability." Not me. I focus on my ability and today I am a reality television personality, actress, model and speaker. 

I developed the TIPHANY ADAMS ABILITY AWARENESS PROJECT to visit students in schools all over the country and help young people learn to shine a light on ABILITY – not disability. We start with my wheelchair and springboard from it to talk about how disability can happen to anyone, what life is like with a disability, and the amazing things that people with disabilities achieve. From there the discussion always grows to talking about how ALL people are both DIFFERENT and SPECIAL with their own UNIQUE ABILITIES. 

My Story

October 15, 2000 was a day that changed my life forever. I was 17 years old and a senior in high school. Like most teenagers I was just trying to figure out life. That day I was involved in a car crash caused by a drunk driver. All were pronounced dead at the scene, including myself. The accident caused the tragic loss of three bright, promising, young lives. I survived and spent the next three weeks in a coma, fighting for my life. 

When I awoke I knew I was alive for a reason. I acquired a spinal cord injury that I now live with every day. That day was a day of great loss, but for me it was also a catalyst to do something important in the world.

The Tiphany Adams Ability Awareness Project

My school presentations are designed to be as REAL as possible for the students. I work in an age-appropriate way to engage with them and talk about the impact of the accident and the drinking that caused it. 

I break down the myths of disability by showing kids how I can move in and out of my wheelchair, how I drive a fun vehicle (I bring either a Mustang or Silverado with hand controls) and how I have wheelchairs that allow me to stand up and stand out!


No matter the age group we find there are always KEY QUESTIONS and ISSUES that naturally arise out of the discussions. I have a background in child development and psychology (college prior to Push Girls), and I use those skills to talk with students from preschool to college about what is on their mind. 

In addition to ability awareness, we talk about SERIOUS topics including real life disability questions (kids need to know life goes on and can be fun and fulfilling when you acquire or are born with a disability), the impact of drugs and alcohol, and addiction.

We also talk about FUN stuff like what it’s REALLY like to be on reality television, plus film and fashion, red carpets, TV interviews, hair and makeup, and much much more.


What is MOST IMPORTANT is that we always spend time talking about SELF-ACCEPTANCE. Learning to CELEBRATE who we are as individuals as we grow up and FOLLOW OUR DREAMS.


Help Me Share the Ability Message at 10 Schools in the United States this Fall!

Many schools do not have the funds to bring me to visit their students for a day - this fundraising project will raise funds so I can visit 10 schools in the United States this fall!

$1,000 pays most of the costs associated with ONE FULL-DAY SCHOOL VISIT. This fee covers the costs of our presentation and materials (videos and giveaways). It also covers the travel expenses for me and one of my team members when the visit is within 3 hours drive distance of Los Angeles, CA. Outside of that region additional travel expenses may apply. 

We spend a full school day at each school and provide a general assembly as well as classroom visits. We also meet specifically with classes and student groups that focus on Film and TV, Fashion Design, LGBT, Gay/Straight Alliances, and Disabilities.

For every $1,000 raised we will select a school to visit! 

Interested schools please visit my website at www.tiphanyadams.com for details on how to receive a Tiphany Adams Ability Awareness Project school visit!

Any funds raised above our goal will be used to send us to more schools! Schools outside of our three hour drive radius are also eligible for a visit when they can underwrite the travel costs for me and one member of my team. See my website for details!


You Can All Help!

If you can't donate that's OK! Instead, help me spread the word about the TIPHANY ADAMS ABILITY AWARENESS PROJECT! Tell your friends, your family, your school.

Like me on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Officialtiphanyadams

Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/tiphanyadams
And Instagram:http://instagram.com/tiphanyadams

Invite schools to present the Tiphany Adams Ability Awareness Project! Details available at http://www.tiphanyadams.com/speaking-and-events/book-tiphany/.

Use these Hashtags: #tiphanyadamsabilityawarenessproject, #taaap, #abilitynotdisability

story:
Short Summary

I have lived an eventful life marked by extreme challenge. I offer my experiences as an artist/advocate/survivor to share the lessons I have learnt…

I once was a performer. At age 21 I travelled to Japan where I completed four contracts over two years as a cabaret dancer living and working in a completely alien culture. Upon my return to Australia and in preparation to launch a pop career in China, I was hit by a car whilst crossing a busy section of a highway in Melbourne, Australia. I sustained a severe head injury and spent 4 weeks in a coma. 

I had to learn everything all over again: walking, talking, running, BEING.

I returned to my home town after intensive rehabilitation and spent 10 years regaining my sense of self and purpose. I began to work in Disability Arts, a niche created for me! In 2009 I produced high quality circus workshops for children with and without disabilities to run during an international youth arts festival.

The week before the program launched I was diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma. Cancer.

This was another blow to my ambitions but it didn't stop me. No, it didn't!

I have lived my life with tenacity and a fortitude I wish to encourage others to find in themselves. My experiences have been coloured by varied and deep adventures. They have called upon a depth of character that has been gradual yet deliberate. I have not been satisfied to sit back and allow life to happen to me. 

I have confidence that my life experience is more than enough to qualify me as someone who can share knowledge for the betterment of those listening. My keynote address will cover the breadth of my learning and realisations over these past 15 years. The ultimate aim is to combine both performance and speech in order to present a finished product to inspire hope. In this I can provide tools and strategies for overcoming perceived obstacles in life. 

I would like to pay a script editor who will assist me to write a keynote presentation where I can share what I have gained through my life. 

Once my keynote is completed I will be ready to team it with a theatrical interpretation I am currently working upon in order to share it in a variety of settings. I wish to educate, inspire and mobilize both fellow trauma survivors, their families and the professionals that work closely with them. I have already had confirmations from rehabilitation centres.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am seeking $1250 in order to pay my script editor for the awesomeness he embodies. (the $250 additional is to cover Indiegogo fees) 

    Mr Paul Ransom is a widely published writer, editor and award winning film director and, quite simply, he knows his shiz. Through his expertise I will be able to present an impactful speech that will have the capacity to positively change the lives of those who hear it.

    The first 10 donations of $50 or over will receive a free ticket to the showing of my work later this year at La Mama Theatre, Carlton, Melbourne, Australia.

    If you support me with a $300 pledge I will speak for free at an organisation of your choice. This needs to be either in Adelaide or Melbourne.

    Whatever money is raised will be used for editing services. Less money = less assistance, that is all!

The Impact

  • Developing a professional keynote address that shall form the basis of my public speaking career. It is this I am seeking to fund. I foresee it leading to my financial independence as well as helping many others to overcome their difficulties.

    My keynote shall encapsulate the breadth of my learning and realisations over these past 14 years and more. It is to be preceded by performance of the theatre piece I am in the process of developing that has been funded by the City Of Port Phillip up to now. Art is a gateway to healing. Using theatre to open a subject that many find confronting can introduce the subject gently.

    My public speaking project is focussed upon the trajectory of my life with the lessons and gifts I have gained. Presently working with Xanthe Beesley, a movement therapist and accomplished theatre director in Melbourne, I am developing characterisation of stories which have led me to where I stand today.
    The ultimate aim is to combine both performance and speech in order to present a finished product to inspire hope. In this I can provide tools and strategies for overcoming perceived obstacles in life.

    The finished product will be a combination of the theatre, my keynote and a range of exercises delivered in a workshop format to groups of people be they in a business or community sphere. I intend to target a range of service providers and support services working directly with survivors of trauma.

    A quick look at my CV shows that I have worked in a number of different capacities but all with a similar aim. That is with the intention of enabling others to experience the transformative nature of art. This has always been my passion and has led me to immerse myself in a variety of roles working with a number of key arts and disability organisations in Adelaide and Melbourne.

    Some highlights that show dedication and commitment to my career goals include: Embryonic Zombie Butterfly a portable live performance art work characterising my trauma and recovery, Associate Director, Other Film Festival (Arts Access Vic) I produced the ‘Sex, Love and Intimacy’ Forum, Rag Theatre (all abilities theatre company) I was a volunteer and participant, Artists in Schools Program, I produced a continuation of the ‘Roll Up Roll Up’ program at Mitcham Primary School, ‘Roll Up Roll Up’ Circus Skills Workshops were delivered at Come Out ’09 International Youth Arts Festival workshops -  circus skills development workshops for integrated classes of primary school children with and without disabilities.

    Another way I can demonstrate my commitment to my professional practice is to use the example of being diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma at the commencement of the ‘Roll Up Roll Up’ program. I remained dedicated to the project, attending a majority of the workshops whilst beginning my chemotherapy.



Other Ways You Can Help


Please feel free to contact me if you are interested in having me speak for your event.

Please do me a HUGE favour and share this campaign on your Facebook page!

story:
There are few places as creative and endless as Detroit, Michigan.

Geographically immense, it is often synonymous with a legacy of economic collapse, failing infrastructure, vacancy and bankruptcy.  Anybody who has lived there, or even visited, knows there's more to the story.  Detroit is home to a brand of innovation and grit that exists nowhere else.  It is a global hub for creative approaches to urbanization and economic development. It is an unparelleled ecosystem, filled to the brim with people that have been shifting its identity their whole lives, from the ground up. 

We want young people from all over the country to spend some time here.

Motor City Exchange is a ten week paid summer fellowship for undergraduates at 2 and 4 year colleges and universities across the country.  The fellowship was launched last fall by three Detroit natives from the East Side, who left Michigan for college and can't wait to come back.  Motor City Exchange seeks to do the following, this summer:

  • Build capacity at existing non-profits and social enterprises in the city of Detroit through an intensive, paid 10-week summer internship program
  • Sustain a weekly roundtable that brings fellows together with Detroit's change-makers -- advocates, activists and entrepreneurs building critical initiatives to transform the Motor City.
  • Serve as a hub for research and engagement on the city's development through weekly programming and events, impact reports and insights, and community conversations.

What We're Doing This Summer

This summer we're launching MCX full throttle, starting with a class of 5-6 interns from Brown University and the University of Michigan.  They will be interning at some amazing organizations full time to complete capacity building summer internships.  During the summer, fellows will complete a transformative curriculum around Detroit's history and future, impact measurement, and community revitalization.

We have already raised nearly $15,000 to support intern stipends for the summer of 2014.  Your gift will help cover the cost of bus passes for all of our summer fellows, in addition to raising money to help build out the program post-summer. 

The Impact

By the end of August, interns will have completed short-term, high-impact projects at their respective organizations while absorbing lifelong professional and social networks in the city of Detroit.  More importantly, they will design blueprints for Detroit's development that will be presented to civic leaders, community organizations, and other Detroit changemakers.  

We have a phenomenal slate of host sites and great projects lined up for our interns, who will arrive in Detroit the first week of June.  Check out more details at www.motorcityexchange.org!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out about what we're doing!
  • *Like us on Facebook!* https://www.facebook.com/motorcityexchange?ref=br_tf

story:
Our goal is not only the restoration of an important landmark in railroading history, but to make available the education for future generations.

We are the Lackawanna Cutoff Historical Committee, an established 501(c)(3) nonprofit group dedicated to restoring the Greendell station in Green Township, New Jersey. Opened in 1911 along a new route that even today is an engineering marvel, the station had an agent until the 1930's and remained a flag stop through the Erie-Lackawanna merger in 1960.  The last freight delivery was in 1979. Since then it has fallen into disrepair at the hands of mother nature and frequent vandalism. 

Our end goal? Preserve this gem of our past and convert the interior into a museum dedicated to the Lackawanna Railroad and other local history. 

What We Need

  • Early this year we set the wheels in motion by pitching our idea to the local town committee. 
  • We have secured various quotes for the replacement of the roof, clearing of the grounds, and have received an environmental review of the property. 
  • Your donations will help us insure the property so that we can begin work on removing vegetation that currently threatens the structure. The increased visibility will also thwart would-be vandals. 

Challenges We Face

This project will be a long and expensive affair. Just a few years ago many federal grants existed that could have subsidized our work, but today they are all but dried up. In addition New Jersey Transit aims to restore service to this part of the Cutoff. Instead of the structure being used as a station, NJTransit plans to use it as a small maintenance area. Preserving Greendell Station now is our best option for allowing future generations to enjoy and learn from its' unique history. 

More Information

Please "like" our Facebook page and enjoy more pictures of the station and surroundings. If you are interested in volunteering, feel free to contact us through our FB page. Thank you in advance for all of your support!

Early this year we set the wheels in motion by pitching our idea to the local town committee. 
We have secured various quotes for the replacement of the roof, clearing of the grounds, and have received an environmental review of the property. 
Your donations will help us insure the property so that we can begin work on removing vegetation that currently threatens the structure. The increased visibility will also thwart would-be vandals. 


    Challenges We Face This project will be a long and expensive affair. Just a few years ago many federal grants existed that could have subsidized our work, but today they are all but dried up. In addition New Jersey Transit aims to restore service to this part of the Cutoff. Instead of the structure being used as a station, NJTransit plans to use it as a small maintenance area. Preserving Greendell Station now is our best option for allowing future generations to enjoy and learn from its' unique history. 
    

More Information
Please "like" our Facebook page and enjoy more pictures of the station and surroundings. If you are interested in volunteering, feel free to contact us through our FB page. Thank you in advance for all of your support!

story:
Natural Birth is My Passion

I love birth and babies and families. I love serving women in all walks of life. I love contributing to a healthy start for families. I am excited for my future as a Certified Professional Midwife serving in Southwest Missouri, but that future seems far off as I try to fathom the expenses. I am grateful for the hand up I've been given in the past by my midwife, preceptor, and friend, Debbie Smithey. She has been so gracious and I love working with her and learning from her. As I try to fund my way through the certification process and attend educational retreats and conferences, though, I find my family's thin budget running dry. 


The Midwives Alliance of North America (MANA) has an annual conference. This year it's as near as St. Louis, MO! It's a 3 day conference in October with speakers from around the world, sharing experiences and encouraging growth in every facet of midwifery. I've been so excited about the whole process of watching this conference unfold. I will learn so much and have a once in a lifetime experience there, if only I can MAKE it. This is where you come in. Will you contribute even a small donation to me so I can attend? Don't buy me Christmas, anniversary, or birthday gifts. Please contribute to my cause. Instead of sending me a card, send me the money you would have spent on that card.  I will be purchasing my registration via credit card, apply for the scholarship offered by MANA, and hope for the best. Even if I get the scholarship, though, I'll need to pay for other expenses.

Update: I did not get the scholarship to pay for the conference fee. :( The need was high this year and I did not make the cut. So I'll keep campaigning and contributing my own money to get me there.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of the cost of this conference.

$350 Midwives Association of North America (MANA) conference student price for the whole 3 days, including breakfast and lunch

$300 hotel fees for MANA conference. I'll be sharing a room with other attendees for at least 2 nights, possibly 3. The parking fee is outrageous. But staying there means less gas money driving to and from a different hotel or friend's house and less time wasted driving in St Louis traffic. 

Update: I have a place to stay! I'll need to budget more gas money, but this still saves me a ton!

$150 Gas money for the trip. This is an estimate and I do plan to carpool, if possible.

$50 Dinner money for 3 nights

Total=$550

If I earn more than my goal, I'll contribute the remainder to my certification process to NARM, the certifying body for the Certified Professional Midwife credential.

If I don't earn at least $300, I'll use all the money for my certification.

And you get perks!

For every $15 you donate, I'll send you a picture of me in action, either with a client (who could say no to sweet babies?!) or spending time at the conference.

If you're so dedicated to me that you send $100, in addition to several photos, I'll show my appreciation with a box of fine chocolates!

The Impact

Guys, I'm really excited about this conference. I'm passionate about my path in life. Right now, money is super tight. I'll be making contributions to my own future, but I do need some help. My husband already works full-time with overtime and is starting his own business. I devote a full day each week to prenatal appointments plus attending 2-4 births a month (each lasting an average of 20 hours) with the associated postpartum visits. I live my life on call and have 3 children ages 2, 4, and 6. I have wonderful family and friends who support and help me and my family when I need to be away. Then I come home to spend quality time with my girls again. Once I'm a midwife myself, life will still be crazy, but I can be a little more in control of my own scheduling and will be making a living with it as well!

I'm determined on my path and want to serve more families, with the right skills. I also want to pay forward the kindnesses I've seen in my life. I plan to offer scholarships for needy families who qualify as well as bartering part of the fee of my services for those who need that option. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand if you don't have any spare money to add to my campaign. I'm right there with you! But that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and share my campaign. I'm expecting most contributors will be family and close friends. But any others will be amazing!
    • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
www.sibelkula.com

Hello.My name is Sibel Kula.I would like to take a few minutes of your time to listen to me.By watching this video you may help me and millions of other patients like myself who are waiting for recovering.I'd like to thank you in advance.

I was a student at the Physical Education Department of the DokuzEylül University Manisa Sports Academy.My neck was broken, which resulted in a complete paralysis below my chest level, as a result of an accident on 1 May 1989 caused by an unlicensed driver.Unfortunately due to economic difficulties I stayed in bed for 8 years.But I have never detached from life in this period.I’ve held on to life more strongly.I’ve never lost my faith that I will recover.I’ve painted, singed and wrote poems without using my hands.I’ve turned a tiny room to a large world.Mr. BurhanÖzfatura, former mayor of İzmir Metropolitan Municipality, who has heard my struggle in life,has started a campaign, in which all my paintings were sold, in addition to the assistance of philanthropists. The money collected was used for my treatment in Royal Bucks Hospital in England.I recovered after the treatment I’ve received in this hospital and I became able to use a wheelchair in Turkey.

This was a start for me. I was never going to give up and therefore I continued to research all possible treatments in Turkey and abroad. In my research I’ve met with Prof DrHalukDeda. He has performed the first stem cell transplantation in Turkey in Private Akay Hospital. After the stem cell transplantation changes in my body started to happen. Sensations started to increase and I've started to parts in my arms, my body strength started to increase, my balance in sitting came back and I've become able to crawl after my arms strengthened. This meant the stem cell transplantation was working and helping me.

while this waiting period in a close friend's recommendation on my own means , I went to Lüleburgaz the Medikent hospital doctor Gülsah Ozturk under the supervision of ozone therapy , neural therapy , reflexology, radiation therapy, and physical therapy applications involving treatment process. I began to move my toes and back again in my sensory recovery occurred .

It is my right to life.It is my right to life but it also means that many people's right to life was taken away from them.This is unfair.I want to continue my treatment, recover, walk and that this treatment provides promising results for other patients who are waiting for a cure.I am sure I will prevail.Because I never gave up.I kindly ask from you.Put yourself in my place and think.If it was you who struggled for 25 years and your life was taken away from you because of money, what would you think?

Therefore I kindly ask from you.I am sure that there are many others like me that you know. I receive many e-mails and telephone calls telling me not to give up and that I am their hope and I should never give up.

I want to take my chance and go to my treatment and get better.I kindly ask you to support me.If we can achieve this together, many people including me will get a better life.


Thank you for listening me.I send you my love and regards.Stay well and happy

*********

Merhaba. Ben Sibel Kula. Şimdi sizlerden birkaç dakikanızı ayırıp beni dinlemenizi rica ediyorum. Bu videoyu izleyerek hem benim, hem de benim gibi umutla bekleyen milyonlarca hastanın iyileşmesine yardımcı olabilirsiniz. Hepinize şimdiden çok teşekkür ediyorum.

Ben Dokuz Eylül üniversitesi, Manisa Spor Akademisi, Beden Eğitimi Bölümü öğrencisiydim. 1 Mayıs 1989 tarihinde okuluma giderken ehliyetsiz bir şoförün sebep olduğu kaza sonucu boynum kırıldı ve göğüsten aşağı felç oldum. Maddi imkanım olamadığı için ne yazık ki 8 yıl yatalak yaşamak zorunda kaldım. Ama bu 8 yıl içinde hayattan asla kopmadım. Hayata daha sıkı bağlandım. Yaşam gücümü hiçbir zaman için kaybetmedim ve iyileşeceğime çok inandım. Tutmayan ellerimle resimler yaptım, şiirler yazdım, şarkılar yaptım. Küçücük bir odayı kocaman bir dünyaya çevirdim. Benim bu yaşam mücadelemi ve çabalarımı duyan İzmir Eski Büyük Şehir Belediye başkanı Sayın Burhan Özfatura bir kampanya başlattı ve bu kampanyada yaptığım bütün resimler satıldı, pek çok yardımsever bana yardım etti ve toplanan parayla İngiltere'de Royal Bucks Hospital'a gönderildim. Bu hastanede gördüğüm tedavi ile birlikte yatalak olmaktan kurtuldum ve Türkiye'ye tekerlekli sandalye kullanır durumda geri döndüm.

bu benim için yeni bir başlangıçtı. asla vazgeçmeyecektim. bu yüzden yurtiçinde ve yurt dışında bütün tedavileri araştırmaya devam ettim. ve bir süre sonra sayın profesör doktor haluk deda ile tanıştım. ve kendisi türkiyede ilk olarak özel akay hastanesinde ilk kök hücre naklimi yaptı. kök hücre naklimle birlikte vücudumda güzel gelişmeler olmaya başladı. duyu hizlerim arttı, kollarımda duymayan yerleri hissetmeye başladım, vücudum kuvvetlendi, oturma dengem sağlandı ve kollarımın kuvvetlenmesiyle birlikte emekleme pozisyonuna geçebildim. yani kök hücre çalışmaya başlamıştı. ve faydalı olmaya başlamıştı.

doktorumuz ameliyatı yapmadan önce şunu söylemişti: şu anda altyapıyı hazırlıyorum, destek tedavileri ile birlikte sizleri yürüteceğim. evet, bizleri yürütecekti ancak kök hücre tedavisi bir anda ülkemizde durduruldu. ve ne yazıkki tedavim yarım kaldı. Türkiyede kök hücre tedavisi olmayınca vazgeçmeyeceğim için tekrar dünyadaki kök hücre merkezleriyle yazışmaya başladım. çünkü kök hücrenin işe yaradığını görmüştüm. ve bu benim için umuttu. 6 ülke ile görüştüm, Amerika, İsrail, iran, almanya, Ukrayna ve çin. hepsiyle yazıştım, hepsine raporlarımı gönderdim, bana en iyi sonucu verebilecek doktorlar olarak, çindeki doktorların söylemleri çok iyi geldi. ve hatta oraya gidip iyileşen bir hasta ile görüştüm. ve bundan emin olduğum için oraya gitmeye karar verdim, ve bütün raporlarımı, belgelerimi herşeyi doktorlara gönderdim. doktorlar uzun bir incelemeden sonra 4021 kişi içinden, 121 kişi seçilen grupta beni de tedaviye kabul ettiler. maddi imkanım yeterli olmadığı için, ben cumhurbaşkanımıza, başbakanımıza ve sağlık bakanlığına yazı yazdım ve tedaviye gitmek istediğimi belirttim. sağolsun cumhurbaşkanımız benim bu isteğimi sağlık bakanlığına ilettiler ve sağlık bakanlığı tedavime gönderme sözü verdi. ama öncelikle izmirde bir hastaneden heyetten rapor almak gerektiğini bildirildi. ben de bu doğrultuda izmir tepeceğik eğitim ve araştırma hastanesine yönlendirildim. Burada iki hafta üst üste hastaneye giderek pek çok kontrolden geçtim. Heyet raporumda pek çok doktor imza atarken sadece bir doktor, bir beyin cerrahı böyle bir tedavinin olmadığını, yurtiçinde yurtdışında böyle bir tedavi olmadığını, kök hücre naklini kabul etmediğini belirterek imzamı atmadı ve ben onun yüzünden şu anda bekleme durumundayım.


Bu benim yaşam hakkım. Bu benim yaşam hakkım olmakla birlikte pek çok insan için yaşam hakkının elinden alınması demek. Ve bu haksızlık. Ben şu anda tedavime gitmeyi, iyileşmeyi, yürümeyi ve benimle birlikte umutla bekleyen diğer hastalar içinde bu tedavinin çok umut verici sonuçlar elde etmesini istiyorum. Ben bunu başaracağıma eminim. Çünkü yıllarca hiç vazgeçmedim.

Sadece kendinizi benim yerime koyup bir düşünün. Sizler 25 yıl bu çabayı verseydiniz ve sadece para yüzünden hayatınız elinizden alınmaya çalışılsaydı ne hissederdiniz?

O yüzden sizlerden rica ediyorum. Eminim ki pek çoğunuzun yakını da benim durumumda ve bana o kadar çok mail ve telefon geliyor ki "Sakın vazgeçme, sen bizim umudumuzsun" diyen.

Ben şu anda bu tedavime gitmeyi, iyileşmeyi ve bu şansımı değerlendirmeyi istiyorum. Ve hepinizden bana destek olmanızı rica ediyorum. Çünkü bunu birlikte başarırsak benimle birlikte pek çok insanın hayatı da kurtulacak.


Unutmayın, hepiniz birer engelli adayısınız. Yarınların ne getireceğini hiç kimse bilemiyor. Eğer benim bunu başarma şansım elimden alınırsa hepimiz bu şekilde kaderimize terk edilicez. Ve ben bunun asla olmasını istemiyorum. Lütfen hepimizin iyileşmesi için birbirimize kenetlenelim ve bunu hep birlikte başaralım olur mu?

Beni dinlediğiniz için hepinize çok teşekkür ediyorum. Sizlere sevgi ve saygılarımı gönderiyorum. Hoşça kalın, mutlu kalın.

Ve hepinizden bana destek olmanızı rica ediyorum. Çünkü bunu birlikte başarırsak benimle birlikte pek çok insanın hayatı da kurtulacak.Unutmayın, hepiniz birer engelli adayısınız. Yarınların ne getireceğini hiç kimse bilemiyor. Eğer benim bunu başarma şansım elimden alınırsa hepimiz bu şekilde kaderimize terk edilicez. Ve ben bunun asla olmasını istemiyorum. Lütfen hepimizin iyileşmesi için birbirimize kenetlenelim ve bunu hep birlikte başaralım olur mu?Beni dinlediğiniz için hepinize çok teşekkür ediyorum. Sizlere sevgi ve saygılarımı gönderiyorum. Hoşça kalın, mutlu kalın.

story:
Not every Charlotte is born a Princess...but this one is royally dedicated to becoming an actress.

Hello there, and thank you so much for visiting my page.

My name is Charlotte Sisson, I'm a 24 year old actress originally from the North East. This year I have had the honor of being accepted into ALRA (Academy of Live and Record Arts) onto their MA course in Professional Acting. I honestly could not be happier as going to drama school has been my dream since I was 17 years old. I am so thankful to have such an amazing opportunity.

Having a drama school credit on my CV will not only improve my chances of gaining an agent, it will also add to my employability and credibility as an actor once I've graduated. Going to ALRA will help me excel in my chosen career by training for 35 hours a week in a variety of classes and subjects. I promise to you I will give every class, exercise and showcase my complete and utter dedication and nothing but my best. You will find no one that is more committed or enthusiastic about learning and developing their skills and craft as I am.

Training at ALRA could be a career changing opportunity for me, but it's going to be extremely expensive. Although I am going to be working part time to fully support myself and pay for all rent, food, travel and utility expenses, my fee's alone are £15,100 for the 15 month course...This is where you can help me!

Any money that you donate I will use solely to contribute towards my drama school fee's. Whether it's £1, £100, to £1000, any donation or advice about fund raising is so greatly appreciated from me and family. 

Please share my page to anyone who you think could help me achieve my dream.

External links...
Spotlight
www.spotlight.com/interactive/cv/5818-6755-1850
Showreel
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQKz2AJXJ9g&lis...

Thank you for reading.

story:
***Note: All contributions are tax deductible

---------------- LAST UPDATE ----------------------------------------------

Hey there! 

Meet Cheti's first ever Program Coordinator, Carol Matunga! 

Carol is a recent graduate from St. Augustine University in Tanzania with a BA in Education. He loves children and being around classrooms, and also carries a strong background in management, HR, and anti-corruption.

We feel Carol makes a great new addition to our team and we can’t wait to have him get to work with our programs!

 

 

Thank you to everyone who made this new role possible! Our students, schools and programs will greatly benefit!

We're almost to the end of our campaign and our goal --- last few days! Please share, share, share! 

 

------------NEW UPDATE -----------------------------------------------

Hi everyone! Erica and I have been in Arusha for almost 1 week and it feels great to be back! 

Here’s a quick low-down on what we’ve done:

  • Ordered the thousands of books that will be delivered on Monday to hundreds of students, (both reading and text books).
  • Interviewed our top 3 candidates for program coordinator and made our selection…. More to come on this point!
  • Checked in on both of our schools, their construction progress and current challenges.
  • Spent time with all of our sponsored students and began developing a plan for next year’s sponsorship program.

We couldn’t be more thrilled to share this update with you from our “home town” of Arusha. Thank you to everyone for making this happen.

Check out the adorable video (at the top) from the CHETI School students who are so excited to have your support!

This is a picture of our amazing students at Jue School!

 

And a quick pic of Jessica with one of our favorite nursery students at CHETI School: 

More to come next week as we introduce our program coordinator! 

 

---------------------------------- UPDATE -------------------------------------------

We have completed Round 1 of interviews for our part-time Program Coordinator role & we are excited to meet them all in-person in 1 week!

That's right... we leave in 1 week and thanks to all of our amazing supporters, we are ALMOST at our goal!! This is amazing and we are so excited to get back to Tanzania, deliver thousands of books to hundreds of students, hire our a first team member, and start planning for a bigger, even more impactful 2013!

Thank you to all of those who have contributed thus far.... we are SO CLOSE!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Do you remember the first book you owned?  Or your first day of school?  If you are like us, it’s likely that you have had a book or two at your disposal since before you even knew how to read.  It wasn’t until our trip to Tanzania that we were able to put our fortune into perspective.

In 2010, we lived in Arusha, Tanzania and volunteered at CHETI School (a private school outside of Arusha).  Tanzania is a peaceful country in East Africa.  In Tanzania, 89% of people live below the poverty line and appx. 8% of the population is HIV positive.  As a result, education often takes a back seat to other things, as families either can’t afford to pay for it (even public education is costly) or because children are forced to stay home to care for other family members (often losing one or both parents to HIV).   

Soon after the first volunteer trip in 2010, Cheti, a 501c3 organization whose mission it is to strengthen the local economies in Tanzania, was founded.  Shortly after, a dynamic team of past CHETI volunteers came together, dedicating endless hours to making Cheti a success. Erica was still in Africa and quickly got involved on the ground.  First step - meet and sponsor Marietta Charles!

 

Now, Cheti is empowering local citizens by sponsoring education, providing start up resources, and engaging the community. 

 

In two years, Cheti has already made an impact in the community.  With the help of many volunteers and generous donations, we have:

  • Established new facilities in Arusha – including purchasing the land, buying building material, and building 8 new classrooms
  • Sponsored 80 students within two school networks, ensuring them education through primary school (12 years old)
  • Administered 80 HIV tests to students
  • Purchased 2 school buses to ensure all students can make it to school, despite tenuous weather conditions
  • Provided over 450 meals to students
  • Impacted over 1000 people, including students, parents, teachers, and community members

As one CHETI School parent recently said   “Because my daughter has a sponsor, I was able to give my family a nice meal on Easter for the first time.”

Now, its time to take Cheti to the next level.  We have been a lean group so far and are focused on creating a sustainable organization for the future.  What does this mean?

  • We are expanding our reach by adding schools
  • We are building our local team
  • We are increasing the capacity of our current staff by implementing more scalable infrastructure 

Sounds like something you want to be a part of?  

We are heading back to Arusha this fall to work closely with our schools and to hire a local coordinator who can help manage our programs on the ground.  

What are we raising money for?

$3,500 towards a school bus for our partner school, Jue. Jue School is ranked #3 in the region and #16 in the country of Tanzania. We are helping them build new classrooms and a new orphanage so they can take in twice as many (100) orphans into their school! They need this bus desperately to transport the children from their homes to the new school. 

$4,500 will go to 2 flights to Tanzania, room/board for 2 weeks (1 for our President & Founder, and 1 for our Board Member and prior CHETI School volunteer).

$2,000 will go to hiring a local, part-time coordinator for the next year. We will be interviewing candidates during this trip that meet our job description requirements and can begin to help facilitate the management of our programs.

Every little bit helps, and if you can’t contribute please share this with people who may be interested in getting involved!

***************************************************

About Jessica:

Jessica is the Founder and President of Cheti, and has four years experience in advertising and marketing in New York City working with clients such as Intel and Smirnoff, and after her first volunteer trip to Tanzania in early 2010, has delved into the world of development. She is currently residing in Washington, DC and is the proud sponsor of Maspala. Jessica is also a StartingBloc Fellow and optimistic social entreprenuer. She is passionate about Cheti and looks forward to making the vision of the organizaiton a reality over the next couple of years (with your help!).

About Mary:

Mary is Cheti's Director of Programs and is an Austin resident with 2 years of digital marketing experience and is the proud sponsor of Caren. Mary is about to begin her Masters in Public Health a University of Texas. She spent six months volunteering in Arusha at CHETI School in 2010, and has not stopped working to improve it since she left! During Mary's recent trip back to Tanzania this summer, she met with our student's families to get feedback on our program and emphasize the importance of education, she also facilitated 80 HIV tests, collected updates on all of our sponsored students and development projects! Mary is already counting down until her next visit.  

About Erica:

Erica is the Director of Strategic Programs for Indiegogo.   She is also the proud sponsor of Marieta Charles at the Cheti School.  Erica has spent extensive time volunteering abroad and is a board member of Cheti.  She recently completed two terms as Treasurer of The House Theatre of Chicago, where she was instrumental in developing the company's On The House program, which was created to give Chicago's inner city youth the opportunity to regularly attend House productions.  She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Economics from The Wharton School of Business and a Master's of Science from Northwestern University's School of Education and Social Policy and she can’t wait to get back to Arusha to help build out more schools!

You can learn more about the organization here: www.sponsorcheti.org

story:
Well, this campaign is now over. We did not raise the whole amount but thanks to those who funded it is a start. I will be able to at least be able to make a down payment so this bought me a little more time to find more money somewhere. Thank you to all of those that looked at my campaign and those who shared my story and worry. It means a lot.

Short Summary

After years of juggling family, school, and work I was finally going to get my Bachelor of Arts in Music. Everything was going great, then tragedy struck when one day a policeman came to my house with a message from my sister, who couldn't reach my cell phone, me living in a dead zone. Our mother had just passed from a sudden heart attack. She meant so much to both my sister and me because she was a single mother from the time we were 6 months old. To me, she was my only parent and suddenly she was gone. This sudden loss really affected my focus in all aspects of my life which left me facing deadlines I could not meet. I turned in what I had for classes, but it was not enough and I failed two classes that I absolutely need for graduation. These two classes are only available in the fall. I am out of financial aid eligibility. My wife and I would have had the money to pay for these last six credit hours out of pocket, but because my mother did not have enough in savings or a life insurance policy, we had to pay for half of the funeral costs. Our half was $4000+ which we have paid already. With me working 30 hours a week at night as a cook and my wife working 35 hours during the school year as a teacher's aide, we make just enough money to scrape by on living expenses, which is fine, but there is no way we can afford to pay for my college too. I have been applying for second jobs also but have so far not been hired.

What We Need & What You Get

Breakin' it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need $1800 which breaks down like this:
    • $1300 for half time tuition and fees
    • $295 for Sibelius Academic Student Edition music notation software for a class
    • $200 misc. school supplies and indiegogo.com fees
  • Perks:
  • $1 and you get a high five, hanshake, or hug, your choice, not matter who you are! I don't even have to know you!
  • $5 will get you a hand written thank you note (that's right, I can write words too!)
  • $10 gets you the thank you note and a printed copy of sheet music of a melodic excerpt from one of my original compositions.
  • $25 you get the thank you note and the sheet music for an entire original composition.
  • $50 gets you all of the above plus a midi or mp3 of that composition as well as the right to email me at least weekly for an update on my progress without me getting frustrated with you or being snippy.
  • $100 will get you all of the other perks at lower prices plus a short song composed by me for you on any subject you designate in any style you want. Who doesn't need their own theme music? (must be 3 instruments or less and not be longer than 2 minutes in length, so don't ask for me to compose your requiem.)
  • $1800 I WILL COMPOSE YOUR REQUIEM, or anything else you like, no holds barred, nothing off limits, no out of bounds! I am yours!
  • All funds will go toward my education if my goal is not reached. If more than my goal is reached all of the excess money will pay for expenses for auditioning away from home such as travel, hotel, food, getting my clarinet serviced, etc.

The Impact

Meeting this funding will make it possible for me to achieve my goal and bring me one step closer to realizing my dream of supporting my family through my love of music. I want to show my 3 kids that it is possible to pursue your goals in life and actually achieve them no matter what is thrown in your way.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people can't afford to help fund this, but you can still help. Get the word out; let your friends, family, coworkers, anyone you know know about this effort. Email, facebook, twitter, whatever.

story:
Dear Family and Friends,

As some of you may know I have been recently selected as a StartingBloc Social Innovation Fellow for 2010. What is StartingBloc and why should you care? So glad you asked! StartingBloc is a non- profit organization that takes students and young professionals (aged 20-29) and provides them with the training, education, and networks necessary to turn any career into a socially responsible one.  Fellows learn about corporate social responsibility, social entrepreneurship, cross sector partnerships and sustainability from leading academics, corporate innovators, social entrepreneurs, activists and government officials. The curriculum provides a fresh look at global issues and enables fellows to innovatively affect change at all levels.  

 

Now you're probably saying to yourself, "LC say no more, You had me at "StartingBloc is…", so how do I help?!?!"  Well it's pretty simple, really: the tuition for this program is $1000 (way beyond my meager non-profit salary means)! Unlike many other organizations and programs that I've been a part of, StartingBloc does not offer scholarships... instead they challenge their fellows to be entrepreneurial and raise their tuition themselves. With you help, I think I can do just that. Consider supporting my StartingBloc adventure in one of a couple of different ways:


A) Make a donation towards my goal of raising $1200* to cover my institute fees, airfare (ok, make that bus fare), and a place to sleep other than in an cardboard box.

*Please please please consider making a donation, you don't know how much it would mean to me to know I have your vote of confidence that I have what it takes to help make our world a better place.


B) If you live in Boston, let's hangout!  The institute takes place May 24-28 so let's plan something! 

 

C) Send some words of encouragement! Pursuing a crazy dream of changing the world is not for the weak of heart. It always mean a lot to know I have great folks in my corner. 

 

D) All of the above :)

story:
Pollination Project Proposal:


Einstein once said: â€œIf the bee disappeared off the surface of the globe, man would have only four years to liveâ€.


A dramatic statement to be sure though evidence is building in its defence that sustainable agriculture is becoming less and less achievable in the absence of honey bees as pollinators. Simply stated from Dr. Peter Kevan at the university of Guelph, â€Because pollination is a vital step in the process by which plants make seeds and fruits, pollination is a critical and early step in food production. When there are problems with pollination, there are problems with food production and supply." Naturally it follows that you, as the consumer, will be paying more for your groceries.


Almost a third of what we eat can be attributed to pollinators- small insects and birds that transfer pollen from flower to flower while foraging for food. Domestic honey bees have been the most reliable source of pollination for modern agriculture.  However, since 2006 beekeepers in the Americas, Greece, Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain have been losing between 30 and 80 percent of their hives yearly without an understood reason, a phenomenon known as Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD).


As of yet there is no single cause that can be attributed to CCD, though it is speculated that poor hive management leading to high parasite loads and stressed bees are considered to be the main contributors. Continuing research has revealed that wild or feral honey bees are disappearing from the ecosystem and farmers often find themselves too busy to raise and manage their own domestic colonies. There needs to be an available and affordable alternative for farmers to ensure they have the necessary pollinators during the flowering season of their crop.


Prince Edward Island is Canadaâ€™s smallest province, located on the east coast of the country with a population of 140,000 people. The islandâ€™s primary resources are farming, fishing and tourism. The most abundant crops are potatoes, grains, oilseeds, wild blueberries, tree fruits and mixed vegetables.  Of these crops, wild blueberries, canola, tree fruits, squash, and many other berry crops require bees for pollination. Prince Edward Islandâ€™s borders are closed to importing colonies of bees from other provinces. This measure is to protect the existing colonies from parasites that are thought to contribute to CCD. Currently the diversity of the islandâ€™s agricultural system is limited by the number of honey bee colonies in the province.


We are creating a small scale pollination program on Prince Edward Island. With your help, we would like to develop a bank of bee colonies that will be rented to local farmers to fulfill the pollination requirements of their crops. We will also be using them as research colonies in cooperation with local ecologists to help contribute to the understanding of CCD and other ailments that are affecting honey bee colonies.


Our long term goal is to reach 1000 strong and well managed colonies. We have the education, the space and the cooperation of farmers. Now all we need is your help to get the project off the ground. We are looking for donations to turn this old wood barn into a honeybee management and research house. The funding will be used to buy our first few colonies and some supplies needed to convert the wood barn.


We hope you will view your donations as an investment in education and the preservation of food and food prices.


As the project grows we propose to donate funds to agricultural sustainability groups such as:


Seeds of Diversity  http://www.seeds.ca/en.php



We also propose to help fund Canadian graduate students in the fields of agriculture and ecology.  


We thank you for any interest you may have in this project and appreciate any donations you are willing to make.


Here is some relevant reading on CCD and pollinators in relation to market food prices

The Economist: Investigating colony collapse disorder


http://www.economist.com/node/9070846


The Guardian: Honeybee problem nearing a 'critical point'


http://www.guardian.co.uk/environment/2012/jan/13/honeybee-problem-critical-point


The Globe and Mail. B.C. apiarists stung by bee deaths


http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/technology/science/bc-apiarists-stung-by-bee-deaths/article1488995/

story:
Hello World

 

My name is Paul Gomez. I am the director of a new English language school in Novi Sad, Serbia. I am calling the school American Spirit...because...Americans are, from the beginning, told that we are free to follow our dreams. Sure, manifesting is more difficult that chasing, but we are empowered to go for it, and even embrace the difficulties.

My latest big idea is to open a school. To make things right, I need tables, chairs, and a big chalkboard. I don't want a white board. An old school slate number will suit my needs best. Resources in Novi Sad are rare and expensive, so I decided to come here for a little financial assistance.

Your contribution will enable me to install the furniture I need to make things classy and comfortable. The more I am able to raise, the better I will be able to outfit my school.

When people talk about the comprehensive and even extraordinary nature of the American education system, the idea of "being well funded" is often brought up. I think that's because resources are half the battle, so to speak. A teacher can possess language skills and the imagination needed to teach, but without a good space to teach in, and money to keep it up, that teacher is limited in their ability to convey the information.

I spent a year teaching on a freelance basis at various private language schools around the city, and now I'm ready to open my own place. I plan on exercising a little modern pedagogy and ideology regarding knowledge and the aquisition of information, just to keep things lively.

The idea is to help the citizens of Novi Sad learn English, and to teach them that they can also follow their dreams.

I am using the name American Spirit because it represents power, invididuality, resourcefulness, bravery, and a little fancy flashy business while charging into your destiny.

Donate what you can, and pass the word along.

Thanks, Paul

story:
Short Summary

Hello, we are Rodislav, Marina, Delia and Emily, and we are planing to create public website which will provide professional, open source and free coloring images for kids:

  • Rodislav is a senior software developer, he will take care of the main development.
  • Marina is a professional designer, she will take care of the main set of published images.
  • Delia (4 years old) and Emily (2 years old) will color, give titles and decide which images they like most.

The project is dedicated to children and moms and dads who are always looking for new, free, cool, straightforward, wonderful coloring images

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to pay for:

  • Hosting, promoting and creating a nice looking online community for kids, moms, dads, grandmas, grandpas and designers who are willing to have fun
  • Create free digital books, digital magazines, etc. in free file formats like svg, odf and (maybe..) one closed format: PDF
  • Filter all published content and remove scam and other .. bad stuff from it
  • If we'll not be able to get all the money, we will develop the project anyway, but at a lower speed, though with same enthusiasm and kindness

The Impact

"If you want your kids to be smart: tell them stories, if you want them to be smarter: tell them more stories".

  • We want to use those images to create stories, comic books, etc. which will be available for download for free directly from the website

  • All content will be published under Creative Commons license, so everyone around the world will be able to get decent graphic content for artistic self-development.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there are always some risks every time, but together we can make it safer

  • Protection from garbage, all images are going to be checked before publishing, all publishers will have accounts offered by demi color.
  • Of course the project can get out of money in time, so we we'll try to "attract" donations anyway.
  • First versions will use rich UI
  • But, in time, the website will use simple user interfaces, so it will be able to work even on old devices as well, even without javascript.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help this project in many ways (even if we'll not get the money) by:

  • Of course: Using it!
  • Provide feedback: what is working, what is not, how you think this will work better
  • Publish free, kids-friendly coloring images under Creative Commons license in three forms: shapes, shapes with transparent colors, shapes with full colors.
  • Share and promote in your circles!
  • If you are a public entity (Blogger, NGO, Company, etc.) publish links on your websites, create articles about: demi color (this is the name of the project)


Much more wonderful things to come. Stay tuned!

You're still here ? Cool, then you're probably asking yourself:

 - WHERE IS THE WEBSITE ?   

 - Well, comming soon ;)  we are preparing right now for a game jam, then we'll start working with the website itself

story:
Why help us?

The most significant and influential friendships we have had were either started or reinforced by going to great shows with even better people. Every smile and scar came from a set of walls with a good sound. Fort Smith's venues have closed their doors for several months now, with an untold number of memories left unlived. We aim to change that, and let life get back to living.

We need YOUR help to bring this dream back to reality!

Our main goal is to get everything we need to create the best possible place both to play and to watch great live music. Here is what we need and why:

  • All the world's a stage, but why not build one too?
  • LIGHTS! LASER BEAMS! PROJECTORS! TELEPORTER! (patent pending)
  • Custom venue merch with signature artwork so you can take us with you!
  • ​Power amps for more loud!
  • ​Snacks and sodas for your belly

The Impact

Here are some, but certainly not all, of the ideas we have for this new space:

  • New and exciting social space to make great new friends and hang with old friends all under one roof
  • Bringing new art and music to Fort Smith and the greater Northwest Arkansas region, as well as old favorites we all know and love
  • Creating a home for all of the things and people we love in the world, and having fun during the process

Risks & Challenges

This place will be a collective effort to enrich all of our lives, and can only be as great as we choose to make it.

  • With over two decades of combined experience on both sides of the stage, we know exactly what both bands and fans want from a venue and have every intention to exceed all expectations. This can be expensive, but with your help we can make this happen!
  • Our plan is to create a place where the crowd and bands can depart from their lives one night at a time to create something truly amazing for everyone involved

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have cash? That's fine! There are plenty of ways to help such as sharing and mentioning our cause to everyone you know!

Thank you all immensely for your help and consideration!

story:
Short Summary

*** UPDATE: TUESDAY, AUG. 11th. ***

WE DID IT! Thanks SO much to all of our family, friends, and acquaintances who've made this year's trip possible through your incredible kindness. We're so excited to bring 32 kids on an outdoors adventure this week, and couldn't have done it without the support from all of you. We are hugely grateful for your generosity! Stay tuned for updates with pictures from our trip, and much more.

AND CHECK THIS OUT: Filmmakers Mark & Katie Duplass, who've already provided great support for our programs, have also pledged to match funds in the remaining hours of our campaign for any contributions BEYOND our original $12,000 goal, to help bring SIX EXTRA KIDS along. That means any additional funds we raise will automatically be DOUBLED. If you haven't chipped in this year, please consider a contribution here in any amount... thanks to you and to the Duplass Family, we'll be able to bring along 6 extra kids for a new total of 38!

THANKS AGAIN to everyone who's participated. You've provided an experience for these kids that they will always remember.

***

Hello, Davy Rothbart and James Molenda here! We're the editors of FOUND Magazine, and each summer - with the generous help of friends like you - we put together a camping trip for inner-city kids called Washington II Washington. Thank you so much for checking out the short video above, and contributing what you can to help this summer's trip come to life!

Washington II Washington is an annual hiking adventure taking city kids from Washington, D.C., Southeast Michigan, and New Orleans on a week-long camping and hiking trip to explore some of the country's most beautiful wilderness areas. Along the way, these kids will see animals they didn't know existed, swim in fresh, crisp lake water, make their own S’mores as we all tell ghost stories around a campfire they've just learned to make, learn camping and wilderness skills, and explore the Great Outdoors!

Last year, the kids had a blast taking in the breathtaking views from atop Twin Islands Peak in western Virginia's George Washington National Forest. Some of the highlights included finding a hidden swimming hole deep in the forest and meeting new animal friends, both big (DEER!) and small (SKUNKS!) alike. This year, we'll journey to two of Michigan's pristine wilderness areas — the Waterloo Recreation Area and Warren Dunes State Park — where we'll swim in Lake Michigan, canoe the Huron River, hike the summit of Mt. Randall, camp outdoors, and keep our eyes peeled for even more hidden treasures!

The trip was inspired by our friendship with D.C. native Emmanuel Durant, Jr. After his tragic death on New Year's Eve, 2009, we teamed up with Emmanuel's family to create these annual trips as a way to introduce inner-city kids to the magic of nature and pay tribute to Emmanuel.

What We Need & What You Get

We have 32 wonderful, deserving kids who are excited to go camping and hiking this summer, but we would love to raise $12,000 by August 11th in order to make the trip happen. Our group is run entirely by volunteers, so please know that 100% of your donation goes toward covering the hard costs of bringing these kids on the trip — food, gas, transportation, camping gear, etc.

Honestly, the biggest reward you'll receive from contributing is the knowledge that you've helped some awesome kids get out into nature — many for the first time in their lives — and have some new, life-enriching experiences. That said, we'll also be sending out photos of the trip, handmade Thank You cards, and all kinds of other special prizes to those who offer support. Check out the full range of Perks listed to the right.  Have a special Perks request that we didn't include?  Don't hesitate to email us and ask!

The Impact

Our trips have no specific agenda — we seek only to introduce kids who have rarely left D.C., Detroit and New Orleans (or even their own neighborhoods) to the joys of nature and wilderness hiking and give them a chance to experience something brand-new and have an exciting adventure.  On past Washington II Washington hikes, we trip leaders have seen that look of accomplishment and inspiration that fills the kids' faces when we've reached the top of a mountain.  It's amazing! You can check out photo galleries of our 2011 and 2012 trips here to get a sense for just how special our Washington II Washington trips seem to be to these kids. (Some pictures from 2013 are included here on the Gallery page.) And here's a short, lovely video featuring a few highlights from last summer's trip:


Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing financially, there are other ways that you can help us make our 6th Annual Washington II Washington trip a reality:

* Email links to this IndieGoGo fundraising page and our Washington II Washington website to your family and friends. The URLs are below.

* Help us spread the word! Post links to this fundraising page and our Washington II Washington site on Facebook and Twitter. This makes an absolutely HUGE difference! The more people who learn about the trip, the better chance we have of raising the funds we need.

* Donate gear. We are always in need of tents, sleeping bags, flashlights, and other camping and hiking supplies. To arrange a contribution of this kind, email us at WashingtonToWashington@gmail.com.

 

So, please help us distribute these URLs and get the word out!

Washington II Washington IndieGoGo Fundraising Page shortlink:

http://tinyurl.com/6thW2W

Washington II Washington Official Site:

http://www.washingtontowashington.org/ 

Thank you so much for your support — it is hugely appreciated!

Much love & respect,

Davy, James, Emily, Maggie, Barry, Ryan, Brandon, Russell, Nat, Hillary, Dan, Hannah, Nina, Mia, Ellyn, Denice, Smurf, Avery, Danielle, Jason, Michael, Mark, Katie, and the entire Washington II Washington Team

Questions? Email us at WashingtonToWashington@gmail.com

The URLs are below.* Help us spread the word! Post links to this fundraising page and our Washington II Washington site on Facebook and Twitter. This makes an absolutely HUGE difference! The more people who learn about the trip, the better chance we have of raising the funds we need.* Donate gear. We are always in need of tents, sleeping bags, flashlights, and other camping and hiking supplies. To arrange a contribution of this kind, email us at WashingtonToWashington@gmail.com. So, please help us distribute these URLs and get the word out!Washington II Washington IndieGoGo Fundraising Page shortlink:http://tinyurl.com/6thW2WWashington II Washington Official Site:http://www.washingtontowashington.org/ Thank you so much for your support — it is hugely appreciated!Much love & respect,Davy, James, Emily, Maggie, Barry, Ryan, Brandon, Russell, Nat, Hillary, Dan, Hannah, Nina, Mia, Ellyn, Denice, Smurf, Avery, Danielle, Jason, Michael, Mark, Katie, and the entire Washington II Washington TeamQuestions? story:
We are a group of families, parents, friends and supporters of the Steiner-Waldorf School in Borgnano, Cormòns, in the province of Gorizia in north-east Italy. We are an educational and scholastic community based on the teachings of Rudolf Steiner and we have been active for 15 years. Throughout these years our teaching programme, which is implemented by the co-operative 'Educare Waldorf FVG' has maintained a good working relationship with the local council.

Our schooling community starts at nursery level and includes all elementary school classes. These are all recognised by the Ministry of Education. We also have the three classes of middle school , recognised as home schooling. At the moment our school caters for a total of 50 families amounting to 75 children between the ages of 3 and 14.

At the moment our school caters for 55 families with a total of 75 children aged between 3 and 14.


The school is based in Friuli Venezia Giulia, a region in the far north-east of Italy. Its premises are in the historic elementary school 'A.Manzoni' of Borgnano di Cormons in the province of Gorizia. It is a historical old village immersed in nature, with the Julian Alps visible in the distance and the Adriatic sea on its doorstep.

During these years we have always seen to the improvement of the available spaces as well as to the general maintenance of the buildings. The entire property on the school grounds is run by our co-operative which oversees all building works and therefore uses private funds to maintain and improve public spaces owned by the local council.


We are expanding our current spaces to create a new space suitable for the teaching of Eurythmy, but which would be large enough to be used for shows and conferences open to the general public. Our school has grown in number and all the spaces previously available have been occupied as classrooms. To teach Eurythmy, an artistic discipline fundamental for the healthy growth of our children, we have been having to use a room external to the school buildings. A room that has been kindly lent to us by the community of Borgnano.

Added to this expansion, this last academic year, we have had to modernize some safety features of the school buildings.

So far, as well as the practical help volunteered by our co-operative members, we have spent 45.000 euro which was raised by members, their families and friends.

_____________________________________________________________________________

We have now run out of resources

and have decided to ask for your help!

_____________________________________________________________________________

We about 60.000 USD  to complete our plans....

and hope to raise 


through this project on IndieGoGo.com

_____________________________________________________________________________

The old school buildings of Borgnano are an essential part of a historic village and its interplay between work, rest and nature. Our project does not just have the short term aim of building newer, safer spaces for the immediate future; it also aims to preserve this centuries old relationship. In other words our project aims to give new life to a well established reality, maintaining it for the general use and well being of future generations.


At the moment we have 3 building sites on the go:

  1. The completion of the Eurythmy/multifunctional room. We have been building this space since 2013. It is connected to the school and adjacent to the gym. At the moment it is at an advanced unfinished state inside but fully finished externally. For completion the space needs all internal fittings: flooring, electrics and heating.

    So far all the work has been done by members of the co-operative; once finished however it will remain the property of the local council and will be available for use not only by the school but by the local community.

  2. New secretarial office and classroom. At the moment the secretarial office is located on the first floor. This project aims to build a new office on the ground floor next to the eurythmy/multifunctional room. For the time being, only the foundations have been laid. Everything needs to be done both internally and externally.

    However by moving the office downstairs and removing an internal wall between the old office and a small box room, the space upstairs could then be transformed into a much needed new classroom.

  3. Extraordinary maintenance of the building. To the expansion works it has become necessary to do some extraordinary maintenance on the school building including changing some of the windows, replastering of external walls,  insulation, modernization and modifying of the heating system.  

    You can view the costs of the various stages are by clicking here

    _____________________________________________________________________________



    Considering the sizable large sum, we have decided to look for funds in 2 ways :

    1. An international campaign on this present site IndieGoGo.com, which aims to collect the 37.000.- USD  needed to complete a main part of the works .
    2. A second Italian campaign to raise the rest of the funds can be found by clicking HERE..

    _____________________________________________________________________________


    We invite you to follow our project on the dedicated page on our website

    www.educarewaldorf.it

    To receive our newsletter and for any questions on our project please write to us at :

    educarewaldorf.fvg@gmail.com

    _____________________________________________________________________________

    A heartfelt thank you to all

    of you who choose to support our project.


    _____________________________________________________________________________
