story:
See below for the english version 

AIDEZ-NOUS À SOUTENIR LES ARTISTES ÉMERGENTS!

LA SERRE – arts vivants lance une campagne de sociofinancement afin de lui permettre de mettre sur pied le projet Les Ateliers, un pôle de création, de production et de recherche dans l’enceinte du Monument-National situé en plein cœur du Quartier des spectacles.

QU’EST-CE QUE LA SERRE – ARTS VIVANTS?

LA SERRE — arts vivants est un incubateur qui améliore les conditions d’exercice des artistes émergents en arts vivants. Elle participe à la création d’œuvres fortes ainsi qu’à leur rayonnement. Parce qu’elle croit que l’art est essentiel pour lier l’homme à sa communauté, LA SERRE tisse un lien transparent entre les arts, la nature et la société et favorise la rencontre entre les différents champs disciplinaires. La SERRE se positionne comme activateur de collaborations entre différents partenaires nationaux et internationaux. Le mandat de LA SERRE — arts vivants se déploie sur deux grands volets : soutien aux projets d’artistes émergents et production d’évènements nationaux et internationaux.

LA SERRE — ARTS VIVANTS S’INSTALLE AU MONUMENT-NATIONAL!

© Martine Doyon

Suite à la généreuse offre de l’École nationale de théâtre du Canada, LA SERRE — arts vivants profitera d’une résidence dans l’immeuble historique de la rue St-Laurent. Cette occasion unique permettra à l’organisme de faire de ce lieu ses quartiers généraux et de bâtir une communauté de créateurs qui feront de ce bâtiment leur lieu de prédilection pour le travail et la création. Cette communauté sera le cœur de l’écosystème collaboratif que met actuellement en place LA SERRE — arts vivants.

LE PROJET LES ATELIERS DE LA SERRE 

Les fonds recueillis grâce à cette campagne de sociofinancement nous permettront de mettre en place le projet Les Ateliers. Ce projet porteur se traduit par la mise en place d’un espace d’accueil et de soutien pour une communauté d’artistes émergents. Les sous amassés serviront à acquérir le matériel nécessaire pour créer un environnement de travail, l’habiller, l’habiter, l’investir et en faire un lieu à la fois vivant et fonctionnel. Ils nous permettront d’élaborer physiquement cette structure qui se déploie dans trois espaces de l’immeuble centenaire.

LES ESPACES INVESTIS : 

LA BALUSTRADE – espace de travail  

La Balustrade sera un espace de travail accueillant l’ensemble de la communauté émergente des arts vivants. Dans cette espace, ils auront accès à des tables de travail, une imprimante, une connexion internet ainsi qu’à une machine à café. Le mobilier de cette espace sera amovible afin de pouvoir accueillir des conférences, des workshops et des tables rondes.

LE PIGEONNIER – espace de répétition  

Au-dessus de la Balustrade, le Pigeonnier sera utilisé à titre de salle de répétition. Uniquement les artistes ou groupes d’artistes soutenus par LA SERRE pourront réserver à leur guise ce studio afin de travailler sur leur création en cours ou sur certains aspects de leur démarche artistique. Il pourra également servir de salle de réunion ou de rencontre.

LA VERRIÈRE – atelier de confection

Et finalement, au plus haut du Monument-National, les artistes ou groupes d’artistes soutenus par LA SERRE auront accès à un petit atelier de fabrication qui leur permettra de tester certaines idées à petite échelle. Avec ses quelques outils et sa machine à coudre, ce lieu permettra de laisser libre cours à leur imagination.

* * * 

HELP US SUPPORT EMERGING ARTISTS!

LA SERRE – arts vivants launches its crowdfunding campaign which objective is the set up of its new project LES ATELIERS, a creation, production and research centre, within the Monument-National, located in the heart of Quartier des Spectacles. 

WHAT IS LA SERRE – ARTS VIVANTS?

LA SERRE — arts vivants is an incubator that seeks to improve the conditions for emerging artists in the live arts scene. It participates in the creation of strong works and their visibility. Because we believe that art is an essential link between man and his community, LA SERRE weaves a seamless link between art, nature and society and facilitates new encounters between different artistic disciplines. LA SERRE — arts vivants position itself as collaborator and agitator between different national and international partners. The mandate of LA SERRE — arts vivants follows two mains areas: production and support for emerging artists and national and international events.

LA SERRE – ARTS VIVANTS SETS ITSELF UP AT MONUMENT-NATIONAL!

© Martine Doyon

Following the generous offer from the National Theatre School of Canada, LA SERRE – ARTS VIVANTS will benefit from a residency in the St-Laurent street historical building.This unique opportunity will make it possible for the organization to turn these spaces into their headquarters. It will also help LA SERRE to build a community of creators who will use this place as their predilection spot for work and creation. This community will be the heart of this collaborative ecosystem which LA SERRE – arts vivants is in the process of establishing. 

LES ATELIERS PROJECT

Funds collected through this crowdfunding campaign will allow the set up of LES ATELIERS project. This promising project translates into the creation of a welcome and support center for an emerging artists community. Money gathered throughout the campaign will be used to acquire essential material in order to create a work environment, to decorate it, to inhabit it, to invest it and to make it as much a lively place as a functional space.

THE OCCUPIED SPACES:

LA BALUSTRADE – coworking space

La Balustrade will function as a coworking space available for the emerging performing arts community as a whole.  In this space,  artists will have access to work tables, a printer, a wifi connection as well as a coffee machine. Furniture in that space will be removable in order to host conferences, workshops and round table discussions. 

LE PIGEONNIER – rehearsal studio

Just above La Balustrade, Le Pigeonnier will become a rehearsal space. Accessible exclusively to artists supported by LA SERRE, they will be able to book this studio as they please in order to work on their actual piece or on specific aspects inherent to their artistic approach. This studio will also be used as a conference room. 

LA VERRIÈRE – materials workshop

And finally, at the highest floor of the Monument-National, artists or group of artists supported by LA SERRE will have access to a small workshop which will allow them to test their ideas at a small scale. With its few tools and its sewing machine, La Verrière will allow artists to let their imagination run free.

story:
WHAT IS THE BUFFALO BOOKBIKE?

The Buffalo BookBike, an affiliate of GObike Buffalo, is a bike full of books that will connect with the children of Buffalo during summertime. It is a vehicle to distribute free, quality books to children, as opposed to a lending library.  It will go where the children are in the summer months –parks and playgrounds! A casual and low pressure experience will replace the didactic atmosphere children tend to associate with school and libraries. They can also choose a book to keep and read whenever and wherever they would like.

  • The BookBike aims to keep kids reading throughout the summer months in an effort to avoid the “summer slide” in which children of a lower socioeconomic status can lose 3-4 months of reading growth.
  • Meeting families in the park for stories and activities, the Buffalo BookBike is predicated on the idea that reading is fun!  
  • The program will empower children of all ages to choose their own free book, selected by literacy professionals to encourage reading in summer months.
  • The BookBike will connect families to other programs that support summer reading in Buffalo.

The Buffalo BookBike will be custom-made right here in Buffalo by the talented guys from Nickel City Cycles (http://www.nickelcitycycles.com/) and in partnership with GO Bike Buffalo (http://gobikebuffalo.org/).

The money you donate will go to the building of the bike, with a little leftover for marketing, t-shirts for the volunteer riders, and website hosting.

Instead of looking out for the ice cream truck this summer, look for a bike full of books...The Buffalo BookBike!

story:
My name is Roman Hug and I am a Swiss citizen and living in Istanbul. Last year I started with Kick Boxing Training in a “First class” Sports center in Istanbul. I stated getting enthusiastic about this Sports which trains your coordination, discipline and physics.

After couple of months I started looking into Kick Boxing Clubs close to my office. I found one nearby in an area called Gültepe (a rather low-income area in Istanbul). I was wondering and called for a first training. The studio is everything else than luxurious but kept very clean and with a lot of personal effort. During the first training I realized that lots of young kids (girls and boys) are training there quite professionally. The owner, Yilmaz, won several titles in Turkey and uses most of his free time to pass his skills to the youth with discipline and full commitment. It is very important in those areas that there are possibilities of such Sport Studios and I was glad to see people like Mr. Yilmaz exist.

Since the budget is very limited the studio has been built in a rather practical way. The ring they constructed themselves, with one side using the wall instead of ropes. A new (or better said “real”) Boxing ring would make those kids extremely happy. Especially since there are several talented teenagers training there and they already won bunch of Gold medals during tournaments in Turkey.

I truly believe that those kids would deserve a better standard and would be extremely happy if they would see one day that they have a new and professional Training ring. 

After a successful funding we will publish pictures/video on the Sportclubs homepage.

story:
Chorium RUMbo a Europa

Los estudiantes integrantes de Chorium, el coro de cámara del antes, ahora y siempre, ¡Colegio! estamos encaminados a competir en Holanda este próximo mes de mayo.  Nos hemos estado preparando arduamente para la misma, ya que somos el único coro del continente americano en participar.  Los costos de participación, incluyendo viaje, estadía, alimento y uniformes, ascienden a más de $45,000.  ¡Cualquier ayuda es bienvenida!

¿Qué necesitamos? 

  • Nos faltan aproximadamente 10% de los costos (cerca de $5,000), que serán utilizados para los gastos de estadía y dieta.  Claro, la meta de esta campaña es $6,000 para poder sufragar los gastos adicionales de las distintas recompensas.

¿Qué recibe usted?

  • Por $1, anunciamos nuestro profundo agradecimiento aquí y en nuestra página de Facebook.
  • $5: + Acceso digital a grabaciones EXCLUSIVAS :D
  • $20: + un "poster" de Chorium firmado por todos nosotros
  • $50: + una camiseta negra o verde oscuro con el logo de Chorium
  • $100: + un CD de Chorium
  • $500: + "streaming" en vivo de un ensayo de Chorium y entrevistas para que pregunte lo que quiera.
  • $1000: + ¡Chorium llega a ti! Le llevamos un concierto a donde quiera en Puerto Rico.

Una pequeña historia con el mismo mensaje...

Nos dirigimos a ustedes en nombre de Chorium, el coro de conciertos del Recinto Universitario de Mayagüez.  Como organización estudiantil de vanguardia, pretendemos realizar proyectos innovadores con el fin de unificar a la población estudiantil a través de la música coral. Rescatando y difundiendo así el bagaje cultural de nuestro pueblo.

El Coro del entonces Colegio de Agricultura y Artes Mecánicas (CAAM) se fundó en 1959. Desde entonces se ha destacado en los distintos intercambios corales, conciertos y competencias en las que ha participado en Puerto Rico y distintos países del mundo. Con el propósito de continuar nuestra misión deseamos representar al Recinto Universitario de Mayagüez en un foro internacional en el que se demuestre la capacidad y talento de nuestros estudiantes. 

Con pleno conocimiento de su compromiso para con la juventud universitaria puertorriqueña, le solicitamos un donativo para lograr cumplir nuestra meta de representar a nuestro Recinto en la competencia coral que se llevara a cabo en Kerkrade, Holanda durante el mes de mayo del presente año. 

Su donativo será destinado a sufragar los gastos de transportación aérea, estadía, traslados e inscripción para la competencia coral. El coro está integrado por 33 estudiantes, y los gastos estimados ascienden a $1,200.00 por estudiante, para un total de $45,000 dólares. 

De tener alguna duda al respecto favor de comunicarse con este servidor, Presidente de la Junta Directiva de Chorium al teléfono 787-514-8512 y /o correo electrónico luis.dejesus22@upr.edu  

Agradezco de la atención a esta solicitud,

Atentamente,

Luis Omar De Jesús Martínez, Presidente

Junta Directiva Chorium

Recinto Universitario de Mayagüez


¿Cómo puedo ayudar más?

Si sencillamante estás muy pela'(o) y no te conviene ni regalar $1, ¡aún nos puedes ayudar!

  • ¡Sea alborotoso o alborotosa con esto a través de sus redes sociales!
  • "Like" Chorium UPRM y mucho, mucho, mucho "Share" :D
  • ¡Menciónele el proyecto a sus familiares!
story_txt:
Chorium RUMbo a Europa Los estudiantes integrantes de Chorium, el coro de cámara del antes, ahora y siempre, ¡Colegio! estamos encaminados a competir en Holanda este próximo mes de mayo.  Nos hemos estado preparando arduamente para la misma, ya que somos el único coro del continente americano en participar.  Los costos de participación, incluyendo viaje, estadía, alimento y uniformes, ascienden a más de $45,000.  ¡Cualquier ayuda es bienvenida!   ¿Qué necesitamos?  
Nos faltan aproximadamente 10% de los costos (cerca de $5,000), que serán utilizados para los gastos de estadía y dieta.  Claro, la meta de esta campaña es $6,000 para poder sufragar los gastos adicionales de las distintas recompensas.


¿Qué recibe usted?

Por $1, anunciamos nuestro profundo agradecimiento aquí y en nuestra página de Facebook.
$5: + Acceso digital a grabaciones EXCLUSIVAS :D
$20: + un "poster" de Chorium firmado por todos nosotros
$50: + una camiseta negra o verde oscuro con el logo de Chorium
$100: + un CD de Chorium

Recinto Universitario de Mayagüez

story:
HI !

My name is Diana Makaryan and I'm accepted to the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, to one of the most prestigious places to study the art of acting. A lot of Oscar, Emmy and Tony nomination actors passed through this place, like Grace Kelly, Kirk Douglas, Danny DeVito, Adrien Brody, Adam Scott, Anne Hathaway and Jessica Chastain. 

 

 

Since I have a quite strong academic background in the performing-arts, particularly in ballet, ballroom dancing, singing and performing, I believe that the American Academy of Dramatic Arts perfectly suits my profile and career prospects.

 

 Due to my financial situation I was not able to continue my studies abroad, since I am not in a position to finance myself. Therefore, I will be very greatful for people who are not indifferent to me and my problem. Knowledge gained on the studies at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts I plan to turn into the greatest tool of uncovering my talents and becoming the actress and the performer I have always dreamt of becoming and bringing more fame to my motherland.
​

 

As I embark upon a new stage of my life, I believe that a postgraduate study will provide a milestone in my career along with invaluable experiences that will allow me to become a successful, innovative professional and assist in accomplishing my goals.


 

 

The financial part is the only problem for me and for this reason I decided to apply to some scholarship organizations and to ask for your support. 
I strongly believe that if everyone donates at least a little bit,  it will be a huge chance for me to make my dream come true.
And my dream is to dedicate my life to the art of performing, which means to dedicate my life to you! :)


Tuition Fee 34,410 $

General Fee 750$

Book Fee 570$

Considering:

AADA Honor Scholarship 2,000 $

AADA Need Based Scholarship 6,000 $

Support:

Parents  7,730 $

Fabrika Project  10,000 $

Total:

10,000 $

 

 

 


 

Thank you for your attention and time. I hope for your help, because today if you contribute to me, it means that in future I will contribute to you, like for other hundred, thousand, million people.

story:
Who We Are

The Humane Society of Tennessee Valley (HSTV) was founded in 1885 by Peter Kern with a focus to prevent cruelty towards animals. In 1957, HSTV’s first shelter was built with that same goal in mind. They then built their first no-kill shelter in 2001, and since then, HSTV has found homes for more than 22,000 dogs and cats, with a goal to end euthanasia in shelters in East Tennessee by 2025.

 

The Humane Education for Youth (HEY) was created in January 2017, and it has already been integrated into multiple schools in the Knoxville area including New Hopewell Elementary, Hardin Valley Elementary, and Dogwood Elementary. Today HSTV advances their services in the Knoxville, TN area by working to improve children’s literacy rates and to teach them about humane behavior towards shelter animals. The program allows kids to be educated about the overpopulation of animals, animal safety, and the No-Kill motto.

 

HEY also provides students an outlet to get involved in the community by becoming a part of the reading team that allows kids to come to HSTV to read to the shelter animals. This helps the students through the improvement of literacy rates and also helps to socialize animals within the shelter that may be scared or nervous so that they are more approachable to people who come into the shelter for pets. The socialization of these animals will boost the chances of them being adopted in the future.  

 

What We Need?

This campaign is working to raise money for HSTV’s educational department.  This program has taken off much faster than expected, and the money earned will be to keep the program going by funding the introduction of the program to schools, field trips, and the spay and neuter of a student's cat or dog.  

 

The opportunity to introduce the “HEY” program to new Knox County schools will take a donation of $25. Donations in the area of $50 will give 25 students the materials such as crayons or paint for one shelter workshop. The workshop teaches children more about their furry friends. This will help them to get more hands-on experience with animals and create a fun, memorable experience for them.

 

A donation of $200 will fund a field trip for students, and this brings the entire classroom into the shelter to workshop and read to the animals. During the field trips, the children will participate in academic activities like painting rocks to put around Knoxville to support the shelter. The children also learn about animal health issues with fun games like sorting the shelter animals into Harry Potter houses based on their health issues or whether they are shy or not.

 

Perks

If you donate $10 we will give you a social media shout out on our Facebook page to show how you have helped this organization. A $50 donation will get you a thank you video from us on our social media page. Next, if you make a donation of $75 you will receive a handmade fleece blanket. Finally, $125 will sponsor one low-income student to have their pet spayed or neutered and annual vaccines.

How it Helps

Contributions to this program will enrich the educational department of HSTV. This in turn will allow the program to grow to its full potential by encouraging literary development and provide humane education for young children in Knoxville. The children will also continue providing the animals with human interaction, help animals be adopted, and decrease the number of animals living in shelters.

Other Ways to Help

Every penny counts in this process, but there are other ways to help as well. If you can’t donate monetarily, then you can help by sharing our campaign or share our Facebook page. You can also volunteer at HSTV, just check out HSTV’s website for more information.

story:
Rebooting learning in the cradle of civilisation.

Nature Play ALC and EUDEC Greece are collaborating! We need your support to raise a €2,000 Access Fund for a series of catalytic trainings in Agile Learning Facilitation, as well as a €1,000 Impact Fund for the startup phase of a Greek Union for Free Choice in Education. 

The goal is simple — to kick-start the Self-Directed and Democratic Education movement in Greece. Join us – Nature Play and EUDEC Greece – as we embark on the learning adventure of a lifetime.

In the land that birthed Western civilisation...

...the education system is in shambles. Self-Directed and Democratic Education is illegal, while the rigid state curriculum is compulsory. Even the Greek newspaper, Kathimerini, states: “It’s a completely outdated system that is totally divorced from society’s real needs.” But a collective of young families and educators is setting out to catalyse change through Nature Play – an innovative, non-formal education startup on the island of Evia, in Central Greece – and EUDEC Greece; a network for Self-Directed and Democratic Education initiatives across the nation.

Why are we doing this?

Motivated by love for our children, and for nature – and inspired by the exponential growth of Agile Learning Centres in the USA – Nature Play is seeking to cultivate a vibrant and colourful social movement behind this and many other inspiring approaches to Self-Directed and Democratic Education here on the stunning island of Evia in Central Greece. You’d be forgiven for not having heard of it. It’s an underdeveloped rural area and an undiscovered island paradise — all wrapped up in one — that’s only a 2 hour drive from Athens, a major European hub.

After our success in convening Europe’s first ever Agile Learning Facilitator training in 2017, we’re back to take our growing community to the next level. This campaign is your invitation to help us kickstart an emerging social movement by training a core group of committed and talented families and educators in Agile Learning Facilitation - an innovative approach to Self-Directed and Democratic Education which leverages the same agile management tools that power companies like Google and Netflix.

This time ‘round, Nature Play is collaborating with EUDEC Greece, the brand new regional chapter of the European Democratic Education Community (EUDEC) - a non-profit promoting democratic education across Europe.

Because something special is stirring in our hearts and minds, and of those that support us. But first things first...

What is Agile Learning?

Agile Learning Facilitation (ALF) is a holistic approach that restores the joy of learning; cultivating confidence, intrinsic motivation, dynamic skill sets, mental agility, self-awareness, and group skills. An Agile Learning Centre (ALC) doesn’t have a traditional curriculum. Instead, it teaches children and young people to navigate the world by cultivating core competencies in entrepreneurialism, digital literacy, resourcefulness, efficient collaboration, collective decision-making and self-directed initiative. We’re inspired by this innovative approach to Self-Directed Education, but also committed to staying firmly rooted in the lineage of Democratic Education from which ALF emerged (and the European Democratic Education Community of which EUDEC Greece is a part).

 

Why Agile Learning Facilitator trainings?

When it comes to teaching and learning, the medium is the message. In order to teach honesty, respect, authenticity, initiative, self-direction, follow-through, purpose, and shareable value, you must embody these traits. And so, we’ll be learning from those leading the way in the ALF field. People who have many years of hands-on experience working with kids and starting-up ALC’s from scratch in places like the US and Cairo. Think deep dives, Q&A’s, role-playing, behaviour modelling and so much more. It’s a bit like riding a bicycle — we will only learn by doing!

Hello I’m Marcus. I’m a co-founder of Nature Play ALC and the person responsible for fundraising at EUDEC Greece.

From a EUDEC Greece perspective, this campaign is our way of saying ‘hello world’ whilst raising an Access Fund and an Impact Fund to help us get our change-making vision off the ground. Our mission is simple: to tell a new story of Self-Directed and Democratic Education in Greece, hand in hand with the next generation!

Meanwhile—together with my wife, Emily—we set up Nature Play to help catalyse real change in education. But we’re starting small, putting one foot in front of the other.

As coordinators of this project, we like to think we’re intrinsically motivated since we have 4 and 1 year old boys to keep us focused! You can learn more about us — or even reach out to say hello— via our Facebook page, by exploring Marcus' Medium blog, or by following Emily on Instagram.

***Curious to learn more? Read this deep dive into #4 principles of Agile Learning on Evia Island.

Beyond our budding partnership, Nature Play and EUDEC Greece are developing meaningful relationships with overlapping communities of interest including EUDEC and the ALC network, which already span the globe!

  • Discover more about our lead ALF trainers, Sierra Allen and Nariman Moustafa, who bring years of hands-on experience at Wildwood ALC and Mesahat respectively, as well as intimate knowledge of the critical startup phase.
  • Be inspired by the pioneering work of fellow European pioneers Zoe Burgess and Expression Education in Portugal and Flow ALC and Giulia Ambroso in Italy.
  • Learn more about EUDEC's brand new regional chapter, EUDEC Greece and it’s change-making vision for Self-Directed and Democratic Education in Greece. Special thanks to Zoe Valerie and Evangelos Vlachakis for the key roles they’re playing in catalysing the movement here.
  • Dive into the depths of the Agile Learning Centre Network and the Alliance for Self-Directed Education.

What does Nature Play actually do?

  • We’re an Agile Learning Community who run weekend trainings, summer camps and nature exploration days, inspired by the assumptions, principles and toolkit of Agile Learning Facilitation. Discover more about this exponentially growing global network here.
  • We’re a non-formal education collective. Inspired by Wild + Free in the US, we’re committed to co-creating a transformative learning community of our own right here on Evia.
  • We need your support to help kick-start an emerging social movement by engaging a core group of committed and talented families and educators in an intensive training programme in Greece this summer.

This series of transformative trainings will empower Nature Play — as well as other education startups just like us in Athens and on islands like Crete and Paros — to make more regular offerings to learners of all ages, from weekly Nature Days to monthly ALF Weekends, pre-school groups to youth clubs!

The Trainings

It’s hard to overstate the importance of our annual ALF Summer training intensives, as well as our monthly ALF Weekends. They’re just hugely important!

Because #1, we get to learn how the model works from leading practitioners — specialists in Self-Directed and Democratic Education with years of hands-on experience working with kids and starting-up ALC’s from scratch in the US and Cairo. Think deep dives, Q&A’s, role-modelling and so much more. It’s like riding a bicycle — we will only learn by doing!

And because #2, these regular gatherings have become the platform from which experience is shared and trust is established by a network of pioneering Self-Directed and Democratic Education practitioners here in Greece. Trust and shared experience is the fabric of community, and thanks to these Weekends the embryonic form of a vibrant social movement is beginning to emerge!

Where does my money go?

Your pledges will directly support:

Twelve places on a mini-series of ALF Weekends in June and July. An ALF Weekend is an invaluable taste and see experience offering families and educators an immersive, playful experience of Agile Learning Facilitation. We hope they will serve as an incubator for an emerging network of Self-Directed and Democratic Education projects in Greece.

Six places on our annual ALF Summer Greece. An ALF Summer is the ALC network’s long-established training intensive. It offers an experiential + exponential learning curve in Self-Directed Education and Intentional Culture Creation (a kind of democratic process). These bursary places will specifically target pioneering individuals and families who’re ready to put this training into practice in their local places, but who are unable to participate, simply because of lack of money. 

Are you committed to financial transparency?

We hope the Pie Chart above is helpful! It shows the simple model we've developed over the last twelve months, by which the income generated from these trainings is distributed to our support network of people and projects both locally on North Evia (for example, to pay the farming collectives who supply us with fresh produce and our host venue, Stagones Nature Camp) and further afield (for example, to cover the travel expenses of our lead ALF's). Our aim is to develop an open source business model that is sustainable and scalable —built upon the long established and rigorously democratic principles of the social and solidarity economy —where risks and rewards are shared equitably by the entire stakeholder community. However, in the interests of financial transparency we feel it is important to state plainly that:

  1. Nature Play ALC is not currently generating any profit from these activities. Like so many others, we are instead making a significant investment in time, money and other resources to help grow the Self-Directed and Democratic Education movement here in Greece.
  2. Nature Play ALC does not stand to benefit financially from this Access Fund. Setting it up—and thereby making scholarship places available for Greek families and educators on low incomes—is in fact reducing the gross income generated from these trainings, for which demand has been consistently high since August 2017. 

What about this EUDEC Greece Start-up Fund?

Beyond Nature Play ALC’s all-important trainings, EUDEC Greece is starting up as a Democratic Education network campaigning for Free Choice and Democracy in Education on behalf of families and educators all over Greece.

Specifically, 1/3rd of the total amount raised will fund the startup phase of a Greek registered Union for Free Choice in Education, paying for all kinds of things including legal fees, graphic and web development and other business critical professional services. This Union is in essence a non-profit association that will facilitate the collective legal representation of families and educators who are ready and willing to unite around our inalienable human right to free choice in education. Moving beyond the scope of EUDEC Greece's legal identity as a regional chapter of the European Democratic Education Community—which is, in fact, a German registered NGO—we urgently need this Greek registered Union in order to establish a basis in Greek law for the protection of and advocacy for all families and educators who choose Self-Directed and Democratic Education options.

We’ve got dozens of families and individuals all over Greece who are already signed up to become founding members. But like so many good things which are ready to thrive here in Greece, money remains an obstacle. All we need now is a financial boost to get this campaign up and running. And that’s why we’re here asking you to join the adventure!

AKA What cool stuff and transformative experiences we can give you, in exchange for the hard cash you can give us!

  • (€5) A big "Thank You" from everyone at Nature Play ALC and your name on our website. 
  • (€15) Personalised postcard from ALF Summer Greece.
  • (€30) Enter a raffle to win a ticket to EUDEC 2018.
  • (€50) EUDEC Greece individual membership as “founding supporter.” NB. New members will be required to complete the EUDEC Greece membership form in order to fulfil this perk!
  • (€75) Participate! Ticket to an ALF Weekend.
  • (€75) Enable! Ticket to an ALF Weekend, donated in solidarity.
  • (€100) Skype with a Nature Play co-founder.
  • (€150) Participate! 2 x tickets to an ALF Weekend.
  • (€150) Enable! 2 x tickets to an ALF Weekend, donated in solidarity.
  • (€250) Skype with a Keynote of EUDEC 2018. Enjoy a 30 minute 1-2-1 Skype call with EUDEC 2018 keynote speaker and Expression Education founder Zoe Burgess! 
  • (€300) EUDEC Greece organisational membership and Nature Play “Founding Sponsor” status. NB. New members will be required to complete the EUDEC Greece membership form in order to fulfil this perk!
  • (€500) A unique weekend-long Transform Evia experience.
  • (€1200) Enable! Sponsor a full scholarship on our ALF Summer Greece training.

OK, I’m stoked! How do I get behind this campaign?

Visit our crowdfunder! And give what you can.

Every little helps. And pledging €30 is a whole 1% of our target!

Spread the word.

We need your advice and connections to help us build a social movement for Free Choice in Education. Become part of our story crowd today and join us in telling a new story in Greece — hand in hand with the next generation!

Share this campaign

Please share, share, share on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!

Still on the fence and want more of the nitty gritty?

What problems and solutions are we addressing here?

The stakes don’t get any higher than this, folks…

Education is in crisis.

It’s time to stand up our right to free choice in education!

Protocol 1, Article 2 of the European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms lays it down in black and white, enshrining Free Choice in Education as a fundamental right which we — as European citizens — should expect to enjoy. And yet Self-Directed and Democratic Education remains illegal in Greece and many other European states.

The key phrase here is “in conformity with their own religious and philosophical convictions.” This needs a little unpacking…so, here’s our pitch — or at least version 1.0!

  • We’re witnesses to an old story which no longer makes sense.
  • We’re experiencing our world changing before our eyes.
  • Today a social movement towards free choice in education is gathering momentum, and we feel compelled to blow as much wind into its sails as we possibly can!
  • Let’s be authentic and transparent — we understand that Self-Directed and Democratic Education is illegal in Greece. And, we know hundreds if not thousands of families who would love to see breakthrough in this critical part of our lives.
  • So let’s be strong and courageous. Let’s test and — we hope — change this legal context, for the benefit of ourselves and countless other families and educators all over Greece, both now and in future generations.
  • We’re confident we can win the backing of high profile European NGO’s to help us bring this campaign home.

And so it begins. We really can tell a new story here in Greece, hand in hand with the next generation. But it really does all start here, with this simple crowdfunding campaign — so please, get behind us today!

The ALC model is growing exponentially all over in the world.

Let’s position this embryonic Greek network as pioneers in this emerging field.

  • Our approach is to adapt ALF tools in the context of non-formal education, and frame ALC’s in Greece as social enterprises optimised for families and educators who’re seeking greater flexibility and choice, framing our activities as primarily extra-curricular.

  • We’re paying attention to the economic reality. Most of the families who share our conviction cannot afford International Private School tuition fees, even if there was a Self-Directed and Democratic Education school already established here in Greece.

  • One solution to these problems is to shift the legal responsibility, so that it is held squarely by the families themselves. Because if education startups like Nature Play are technically not-schools, we get to start with a blank canvas. No regulation, no curriculum, no compromise.

  • Meanwhile, our Union for Free Choice in Education will become a solidarity network to protect parents and educators, whilst advocating for a desperately needed legal breakthrough in times of economic, ecological and cultural crisis.

  • We’re acutely aware of Greece’s appeal to a global community of Worldschoolers, homeschoolers and unschoolers. So let’s make Greece the world’s #1 destination for Self-Directed Education tourism!

Who benefits from your generosity?

This is real, folks. Your pledge today is a gift of lifelong learning which could have a game-changing impact in one of three transformative ways.

  • Our scholars on our ALF Weekends and ALF Summer trainings. We’re seeding a network of Agile Learning Facilitators-in-the-making and ALC-inspired startups on Crete, on Paros, in Athens. Help us accelerate the Self-Directed and Democratic Education movement here in Greece!
  • Our Nature Play startup here on Evia Island. A pilot project which we hope can become an exemplar non-formal education startup, inspiring a wave of similar projects all over Greece. We’re building early traction on a daily basis, which is why we need every supporter, every share on social media, every pledge on this campaign we can get to help us grow and thrive.
  • A emerging network of families and educators all over Greece. Working in collaboration with EUDEC Greece we’re designing simple and scalable legal representation in Greek law that has an open membership, and is also open source. Help us to build a non-profit association to protect and advocate for families and educators without a voice.

What makes us the right people to pull this off?

We’re taking an iterative and integrative approach!

EUDEC Greece is a groundbreaking democratic education network uniting the Self-Directed and Democratic Education community here in Greece — inspired and encouraged by their hosting of the European Democratic Education Community’s annual conference on Crete in August 2018.

Meanwhile, Transform Evia is a stunningly ambitious bioregional scale design challenge which knits together Nature Play with a whole ecosystem of other innovative social enterprises based on Evia island. Despite our big picture being absolutely huge, we’re learning to stay grounded — putting one foot in front of the other and slowly walking our vision into reality.

 

Nice idea, but what about early traction. Do you have any?

Yes, actually we do! It’s early days, but we’re starting to make little waves here on Evia island and all over Greece.

  • We successfully raised £3,000 (£1,500 in crowdfunding plus £1,500 in match-funding) in June 2017 to fund six scholarship places on Europe’s first ever ALF Summer.
  • We successfully raised over £10,000 in November 2016 for our Origin Club campaign — a collaborative trade project which recently won approval for 3 years of European R&D funding to help build an exemplar Community Supported Agriculture scheme in our local bioregion.
  • This year’s EUDEC 2018 conference — happening on Crete from 1–7 August — will bring together a community of 400+ Self-Directed and Democratic Education pioneers and practitioners from all over Greece and right across Europe. We fully intend for it to be catalytic in terms of impact and legacy!

Ready to pledge?

Then choose your perk and help us plant the seeds for meaningful change.

Got questions?

Please don’t hesitate to reach out and say hello!

Find me on marcusjohnletts@gmail.com, via our Facebook page, by commenting anywhere on Marcus' Medium blog or by following Emily’s Instagram channel.
story_txt:
Rebooting learning in the cradle of civilisation.Nature Play ALC and EUDEC Greece are collaborating! We need your support to raise a €2,000 Access Fund for a series of catalytic trainings in Agile Learning Facilitation, as well as a €1,000 Impact Fund for the startup phase of a Greek Union for Free Choice in Education. The goal is simple — to kick-start the Self-Directed and Democratic Education movement in Greece. Join us – Nature Play and EUDEC Greece – as we embark on the learning adventure of a lifetime.In the land that birthed Western civilisation......the education system is in shambles. Self-Directed and Democratic Education is illegal, while the rigid state curriculum is compulsory. Even the Greek newspaper, Kathimerini, states: “It’s a completely outdated system that is totally divorced from society’s real needs.” But a collective of young families and educators is setting out to catalyse change through Nature Play – an innovative, non-formal education startup on the island of Evia, in Central Greece – and EUDEC Greece; a network for Self-Directed and Democratic Education initiatives across the nation.Why are we doing this?Motivated by love for our children, and for nature – and inspired by the exponential growth of Agile Learning Centres in the USA – Nature Play is seeking to cultivate a vibrant and colourful social movement behind this and many other inspiring approaches to Self-Directed and Democratic Education here on the stunning island of Evia in Central Greece. You’d be forgiven for not having heard of it. It’s an underdeveloped rural area and an undiscovered island paradise — all wrapped up in one — that’s only a 2 hour drive from Athens, a major European hub.After our success in convening Europe’s first ever Agile Learning Facilitator training in 2017, we’re back to take our growing community to the next level. This campaign is your invitation to help us kickstart an emerging social movement by training a core group of committed and talented families and educators in Agile Learning Facilitation - an innovative approach to Self-Directed and Democratic Education which leverages the same agile management tools that power companies like Google and Netflix.This time ‘round, Nature Play is collaborating with EUDEC Greece, the brand new regional chapter of the European Democratic Education Community (EUDEC) - a non-profit promoting democratic education across Europe.Because something special is stirring in our hearts and minds, and of those that support us. But first things first...What is Agile Learning?Agile Learning Facilitation (ALF) is a holistic approach that restores the joy of learning; cultivating confidence, intrinsic motivation, dynamic skill sets, mental agility, self-awareness, and group skills. An Agile Learning Centre (ALC) doesn’t have a traditional curriculum. Instead, it teaches children and young people to navigate the world by cultivating core competencies in entrepreneurialism, digital literacy, resourcefulness, efficient collaboration, collective decision-making and self-directed initiative. We’re inspired by this innovative approach to Self-Directed Education, but also committed to staying firmly rooted in the lineage of Democratic Education from which ALF emerged (and the European Democratic Education Community of which EUDEC Greece is a part).

 
Why Agile Learning Facilitator trainings?When it comes to teaching and learning, the medium is the message. In order to teach honesty, respect, authenticity, initiative, self-direction, follow-through, purpose, and shareable value, you must embody these traits. And so, we’ll be learning from those leading the way in the ALF field. People who have many years of hands-on experience working with kids and starting-up ALC’s from scratch in places like the US and Cairo. Think deep dives, Q&A’s, role-playing, behaviour modelling and so much more. It’s a bit like riding a bicycle — we will only learn by doing!Hello I’m Marcus. I’m a co-founder of Nature Play ALC and the person responsible for fundraising at EUDEC Greece.From a EUDEC Greece perspective, this campaign is our way of saying ‘hello world’ whilst raising an Access Fund and an Impact Fund to help us get our change-making vision off the ground. Our mission is simple: to tell a new story of Self-Directed and Democratic Education in Greece, hand in hand with the next generation!Meanwhile—together with my wife, Emily—we set up Nature Play to help catalyse real change in education. But we’re starting small, putting one foot in front of the other.As coordinators of this project, we like to think we’re intrinsically motivated since we have 4 and 1 year old boys to keep us focused! You can learn more about us — or even reach out to say hello— via our Facebook page, by exploring Marcus' Medium blog, or by following Emily on Instagram.***Curious to learn more? Read this deep dive into #4 principles of Agile Learning on Evia Island.Beyond our budding partnership, Nature Play and EUDEC Greece are developing meaningful relationships with overlapping communities of interest including EUDEC and the ALC network, which already span the globe!
Discover more about our lead ALF trainers, Sierra Allen and Nariman Moustafa, who bring years of hands-on experience at Wildwood ALC and Mesahat respectively, as well as intimate knowledge of the critical startup phase.
Be inspired by the pioneering work of fellow European pioneers Zoe Burgess and Expression Education in Portugal and Flow ALC and Giulia Ambroso in Italy.
Learn more about EUDEC's brand new regional chapter, EUDEC Greece and it’s change-making vision for Self-Directed and Democratic Education in Greece. Special thanks to Zoe Valerie and Evangelos Vlachakis for the key roles they’re playing in catalysing the movement here.
Dive into the depths of the Agile Learning Centre Network and the Alliance for Self-Directed Education.
What does Nature Play actually do?
We’re an Agile Learning Community who run weekend trainings, summer camps and nature exploration days, inspired by the assumptions, principles and toolkit of Agile Learning Facilitation. Discover more about this exponentially growing global network here.
We’re a non-formal education collective. Inspired by Wild + Free in the US, we’re committed to co-creating a transformative learning community of our own right here on Evia.
We need your support to help kick-start an emerging social movement by engaging a core group of committed and talented families and educators in an intensive training programme in Greece this summer.
This series of transformative trainings will empower Nature Play — as well as other education startups just like us in Athens and on islands like Crete and Paros — to make more regular offerings to learners of all ages, from weekly Nature Days to monthly ALF Weekends, pre-school groups to youth clubs!The TrainingsIt’s hard to overstate the importance of our annual ALF Summer training intensives, as well as our monthly ALF Weekends. They’re just hugely important!Because #1, we get to learn how the model works from leading practitioners — specialists in Self-Directed and Democratic Education with years of hands-on experience working with kids and starting-up ALC’s from scratch in the US and Cairo. Think deep dives, Q&A’s, role-modelling and so much more. It’s like riding a bicycle — we will only learn by doing!And because #2, these regular gatherings have become the platform from which experience is shared and trust is established by a network of pioneering Self-Directed and Democratic Education practitioners here in Greece. Trust and shared experience is the fabric of community, and thanks to these Weekends the embryonic form of a vibrant social movement is beginning to emerge!Where does my money go?Your pledges will directly support:Twelve places on a mini-series of ALF Weekends in June and July. An ALF Weekend is an invaluable taste and see experience offering families and educators an immersive, playful experience of Agile Learning Facilitation. We hope they will serve as an incubator for an emerging network of Self-Directed and Democratic Education projects in Greece.Six places on our annual ALF Summer Greece. An ALF Summer is the ALC network’s long-established training intensive. It offers an experiential + exponential learning curve in Self-Directed Education and Intentional Culture Creation (a kind of democratic process). These bursary places will specifically target pioneering individuals and families who’re ready to put this training into practice in their local places, but who are unable to participate, simply because of lack of money. Are you committed to financial transparency?We hope the Pie Chart above is helpful! It shows the simple model we've developed over the last twelve months, by which the income generated from these trainings is distributed to our support network of people and projects both locally on North Evia (for example, to pay the farming collectives who supply us with fresh produce and our host venue, Stagones Nature Camp) and further afield (for example, to cover the travel expenses of our lead ALF's). Our aim is to develop an open source business model that is sustainable and scalable —built upon the long established and rigorously democratic principles of the social and solidarity economy —where risks and rewards are shared equitably by the entire stakeholder community. However, in the interests of financial transparency we feel it is important to state plainly that:
Nature Play ALC is not currently generating any profit from these activities. Like so many others, we are instead making a significant investment in time, money and other resources to help grow the Self-Directed and Democratic Education movement here in Greece.
Nature Play ALC does not stand to benefit financially from this Access Fund. Setting it up—and thereby making scholarship places available for Greek families and educators on low incomes—is in fact reducing the gross income generated from these trainings, for which demand has been consistently high since August 2017. 
What about this EUDEC Greece Start-up Fund?Beyond Nature Play ALC’s all-important trainings, EUDEC Greece is starting up as a Democratic Education network campaigning for Free Choice and Democracy in Education on behalf of families and educators all over Greece.Specifically, 1/3rd of the total amount raised will fund the startup phase of a Greek registered Union for Free Choice in Education, paying for all kinds of things including legal fees, graphic and web development and other business critical professional services. This Union is in essence a non-profit association that will facilitate the collective legal representation of families and educators who are ready and willing to unite around our inalienable human right to free choice in education. Moving beyond the scope of EUDEC Greece's legal identity as a regional chapter of the European Democratic Education Community—which is, in fact, a German registered NGO—we urgently need this Greek registered Union in order to establish a basis in Greek law for the protection of and advocacy for all families and educators who choose Self-Directed and Democratic Education options.We’ve got dozens of families and individuals all over Greece who are already signed up to become founding members. But like so many good things which are ready to thrive here in Greece, money remains an obstacle. All we need now is a financial boost to get this campaign up and running. And that’s why we’re here asking you to join the adventure!AKA What cool stuff and transformative experiences we can give you, in exchange for the hard cash you can give us!
(€5) A big "Thank You" from everyone at Nature Play ALC and your name on our website. 
(€15) Personalised postcard from ALF Summer Greece.
(€30) Enter a raffle to win a ticket to EUDEC 2018.
(€50) EUDEC Greece individual membership as “founding supporter.” NB. New members will be required to complete the EUDEC Greece membership form in order to fulfil this perk!
(€75) Participate! Ticket to an ALF Weekend.
(€75) Enable! Ticket to an ALF Weekend, donated in solidarity.
(€100) Skype with a Nature Play co-founder.
(€150) Participate! 2 x tickets to an ALF Weekend.
(€150) Enable! 2 x tickets to an ALF Weekend, donated in solidarity.
(€250) Skype with a Keynote of EUDEC 2018. Enjoy a 30 minute 1-2-1 Skype call with EUDEC 2018 keynote speaker and Expression Education founder Zoe Burgess! 
(€300) EUDEC Greece organisational membership and Nature Play “Founding Sponsor” status. NB. New members will be required to complete the EUDEC Greece membership form in order to fulfil this perk!
(€500) A unique weekend-long Transform Evia experience.
(€1200) Enable! Sponsor a full scholarship on our ALF Summer Greece training.
OK, I’m stoked! How do I get behind this campaign?Visit our crowdfunder! And give what you can.Every little helps. And pledging €30 is a whole 1% of our target!Spread the word.We need your advice and connections to help us build a social movement for Free Choice in Education. Become part of our story crowd today and join us in telling a new story in Greece — hand in hand with the next generation!Share this campaignPlease share, share, share on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!Still on the fence and want more of the nitty gritty?What problems and solutions are we addressing here?The stakes don’t get any higher than this, folks…Education is in crisis.It’s time to stand up our right to free choice in education!Protocol 1, Article 2 of the European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms lays it down in black and white, enshrining Free Choice in Education as a fundamental right which we — as European citizens — should expect to enjoy. And yet Self-Directed and Democratic Education remains illegal in Greece and many other European states.The key phrase here is “in conformity with their own religious and philosophical convictions.” This needs a little unpacking…so, here’s our pitch — or at least version 1.0!
We’re witnesses to an old story which no longer makes sense.
We’re experiencing our world changing before our eyes.
Today a social movement towards free choice in education is gathering momentum, and we feel compelled to blow as much wind into its sails as we possibly can!
Let’s be authentic and transparent — we understand that Self-Directed and Democratic Education is illegal in Greece. And, we know hundreds if not thousands of families who would love to see breakthrough in this critical part of our lives.
So let’s be strong and courageous. Let’s test and — we hope — change this legal context, for the benefit of ourselves and countless other families and educators all over Greece, both now and in future generations.
We’re confident we can win the backing of high profile European NGO’s to help us bring this campaign home.
And so it begins. We really can tell a new story here in Greece, hand in hand with the next generation. But it really does all start here, with this simple crowdfunding campaign — so please, get behind us today!The ALC model is growing exponentially all over in the world.Let’s position this embryonic Greek network as pioneers in this emerging field.
Our approach is to adapt ALF tools in the context of non-formal education, and frame ALC’s in Greece as social enterprises optimised for families and educators who’re seeking greater flexibility and choice, framing our activities as primarily extra-curricular.

One solution to these problems is to shift the legal responsibility, so that it is held squarely by the families themselves. Because if education startups like Nature Play are technically not-schools, we get to start with a blank canvas. No regulation, no curriculum, no compromise.
Meanwhile, our Union for Free Choice in Education will become a solidarity network to protect parents and educators, whilst advocating for a desperately needed legal breakthrough in times of economic, ecological and cultural crisis.
We’re acutely aware of Greece’s appeal to a global community of Worldschoolers, homeschoolers and unschoolers. So let’s make Greece the world’s #1 destination for Self-Directed Education tourism!

Our Nature Play startup here on Evia Island. A pilot project which we hope can become an exemplar non-formal education startup, inspiring a wave of similar projects all over Greece. We’re building early traction on a daily basis, which is why we need every supporter, every share on social media, every pledge on this campaign we can get to help us grow and thrive.
A emerging network of families and educators all over Greece. Working in collaboration with EUDEC Greece we’re designing simple and scalable legal representation in Greek law that has an open membership, and is also open source. Help us to build a non-profit association to protect and advocate for families and educators without a voice.
What makes us the right people to pull this off?We’re taking an iterative and integrative approach!EUDEC Greece is a groundbreaking democratic education network uniting the Self-Directed and Democratic Education community here in Greece — inspired and encouraged by their hosting of the European Democratic Education Community’s annual conference on Crete in August 2018.Meanwhile, Transform Evia is a stunningly ambitious bioregional scale design challenge which knits together Nature Play with a whole ecosystem of other innovative social enterprises based on Evia island. Despite our big picture being absolutely huge, we’re learning to stay grounded — putting one foot in front of the other and slowly walking our vision into reality.

Yes, actually we do! It’s early days, but we’re starting to make little waves here on Evia island and all over Greece.

We successfully raised £3,000 (£1,500 in crowdfunding plus £1,500 in match-funding) in June 2017 to fund six scholarship places on Europe’s first ever ALF Summer.

We successfully raised over £10,000 in November 2016 for our Origin Club campaign — a collaborative trade project which recently won approval for 3 years of European R&D funding to help build an exemplar Community Supported Agriculture scheme in our local bioregion.
This year’s EUDEC 2018 conference — happening on Crete from 1–7 August — will bring together a community of 400+ Self-Directed and Democratic Education pioneers and practitioners from all over Greece and right across Europe. We fully intend for it to be catalytic in terms of impact and legacy!

story:
Disclaimer: We have had to change the campaign. If you made a donation prior to 9/17/12 you are being offered  a refund of your donation. We still need the money but I will not do anything under false pretenses and while they were not false when I started this campain, the situation has changed.

This is my story:

My name is Kristen Petroff and I own Abington Kids Creative Arts Studio in Abington, PA. I have a background in running small businesses and have spent most of my life as an independent bookkeeper running up to 30 companies a month. One day I realized that I cared more about my clients businesses than they did and decided to quit bookkeeping and open up a children’s arts studio.

I LOVE the Arts and bringing them to my community and their children is very important to me. I used to dance, I still paint and make jewelry. I adore any project with wood or mosaics and just learned how to cut and grind glass.

My campaign was to save my studio. Now it is to pay my employees as some have not taken a paycheck in almost 2 months. I rent a great space in Abington, it is open, warm and inviting and now I have a year lease and no way to pay it.  When we first opened, I had a dream of 3 month long classes to really be able to teach children true art. Well, that didn't work. We then changed the program to a free form arts program. When we did that, Groupon found us which was a blessing and a curse. It gave us exposure but turned us into a daycare. After our Summer Camps were over we decided to go back to the original idea but 1 month classes. A lot of our parents, even the ones who asked us for this are not supporting us because most of them came in on a coupon and they just wanted the discounts. We cannot survive like that anymore and we are not going to.

We need $15,000.00, hell, now that I am closing, I need more but I will accept what I can, to, in order; pay my employees, provide refunds to clients (less than $100), pay rents, studio bills and the loan I personally guaranteed for the business.

If we get over our amount, whther or not all the bills are paid, at least my employees will be, I will buy art supplies for the local schools.

As far as perks go, they will be set up to thank you, thank you and thank you some more for your contribution. Perks will include original handmade jewelry, original paintings by myself or my amazing staff. Each piece of art created is unique and beautiful!!

If we do not meet our goal and get partially funded, the money will go to pay my staff, refunds, rent, studio bills, in that order...

We believe that Art has a purpose. Art shows us different views of the world as we see it. That not everything is black and white, instead the world is filled with all of this amazing color and you can do whatever you want to with it. With so many schools taking away art and music, we DID find a way to make it accessible to everyone. It has been proven that the arts helps children in math, English and other classes. Art can raise test scores for students. Art is just good for everyone, even if they are only exposed for a short period of time, it can change the way you view the world.

If you love the Arts and cannot contribute monetarily, share us, tell a friend, do whatever you can. Art IS Important to everyone!

Thank you for reading.

story:
Our Story

Girls Rock Dallas is a nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering girls through music education in Dallas, Texas. GRD provides a day camp to girls, ages 8-17. Qualified volunteers will instruct campers in guitar, bass, drums and vocals. The campers will form bands and learn how to write original songs together to perform at the camp’s showcase.  The girls will also attend life-skill workshops. GRD differs from other music instruction classes by providing a safe, all-female oriented environment for the girls to interact and be themselves, thereby cultivating higher self-esteem and confidence.

Girls Rock Dallas is raising funds for our inaugural camp this summer, the week of July 23-27 at Life in Deep Ellum near downtown Dallas.

The Impact

Our program is designed to include girls who are unable to attend our camp because of financial reasons.  Money raised is vital to ensure that these girls have the opportunity to attend camp if it is something that they choose to do.

GRD provides full and partial scholarships on a need basis to allow girls who may not otherwise have the chance to participate in our camp. GRD believes that all girls, regardless of economic or social status, should have the opportunity to attend our camp.  We feel that our program creates a unique opportunity for girls in the Dallas area.  By providing a positive and creative community for the girls, they will be less tempted to engage in unbecoming activities.

 What We Need & What You Get

In order to teach these girls how to rock, we need the necessary equipment for rocking: 

  • music equipment: guitars, bass guitars, amps, PAs, mics, drums, cables, cords, gutiar strings, drum sticks, ear plugs, etc.
  • materials and supplies for our life-skill workshops
  • promotional materials
  • scholarships for campers who can't afford the full camp tuition
  • camp t-shirts
  • programs of our showcase

For your contribution to make our camp a rockin camp we have set out some pretty awesome rewards for you guys! Picks, t-shirts, hoodies, signed posters, signed guitars, and CDs of the girls’ original songs and more! Check out the perks section on the right for specific details.  Donations are tax deductible to the extent permitted by law.

 Other Ways You Can Help

If you found this page, we urge you to donate, even if it’s just a little.  We need everyone to share this campaign with as many people as they can. Tell your family, friends, frenemies, neighbors, and coworkers.   Repost our project on all of your favorite social networking sites, including Facebook and Twitter.

Don’t have any money to spare, but still want to help?  GRD is run entirely by volunteers. If you are interested in donating your time, please visit our website www.girlsrockdallas.org  for more information.  Thanks!

We are still accepting applications for girls ages 8-17 in the Dallas/Fort Worth area!  Please visit our website to apply.

Girls Rock Boot Camp/SnakeBite

We were very privileged to have had the opportunity to collaborate with 5 girls in the DFW area for the making of this video.  The video was filmed over an 8 hour period and included the girls writing and learning a song they wrote themselves, as well as taking band and individual photos. These girls are absolutely amazing and talented and we are so glad that we were able to work with them.

A HUGE thank you to everyone involved with this project! Scary Cherry and the Bang Bangs, The Crazy Ivans, Static Mind, the members of SnakeBite (and their parents) and Laurel Portie for editing the video!

Our program is designed to include girls who are unable to attend our camp because of financial reasons.  Money raised is vital to ensure that these girls have the opportunity to attend camp if it is something that they choose to do.
GRD provides full and partial scholarships on a need basis to allow girls who may not otherwise have the chance to participate in our camp. GRD believes that all girls, regardless of economic or social status, should have the opportunity to attend our camp.  We feel that our program creates a unique opportunity for girls in the Dallas area.  By providing a positive and creative community for the girls, they will be less tempted to engage in unbecoming activities.
 What We Need & What You Get

In order to teach these girls how to rock, we need the necessary equipment for rocking: 

music equipment: guitars, bass guitars, amps, PAs, mics, drums, cables, cords, gutiar strings, drum sticks, ear plugs, etc.
materials and supplies for our life-skill workshops
promotional materials
scholarships for campers who can't afford the full camp tuition
camp t-shirts
programs of our showcase
For your contribution to make our camp a rockin camp we have set out some pretty awesome rewards for you guys! Picks, t-shirts, hoodies, signed posters, signed guitars, and CDs of the girls’ original songs and more! Check out the perks section on the right for specific details.  Donations are tax deductible to the extent permitted by law.

 Other Ways You Can Help
If you found this page, we urge you to donate, even if it’s just a little.  We need everyone to share this campaign with as many people as they can. Tell your family, friends, frenemies, neighbors, and coworkers.   Repost our project on all of your favorite social networking sites, including Facebook and Twitter.
Don’t have any money to spare, but still want to help?  GRD is run entirely by volunteers. If you are interested in donating your time, please visit our website www.girlsrockdallas.org  for more information.  Thanks!
We are still accepting applications for girls ages 8-17 in the Dallas/Fort Worth area!  Please visit our website to apply.
Girls Rock Boot Camp/SnakeBite
We were very privileged to have had the opportunity to collaborate with 5 girls in the DFW area for the making of this video.  The video was filmed over an 8 hour period and included the girls writing and learning a song they wrote themselves, as well as taking band and individual photos. These girls are absolutely amazing and talented and we are so glad that we were able to work with them.
A HUGE thank you to everyone involved with this project! Scary Cherry and the Bang Bangs, The Crazy Ivans, Static Mind, the members of SnakeBite (and their parents) and Laurel Portie for editing the video!

story:
Project Shark Tank

Project Shark Tank is an effort to build a 300+ gallon marine ecosystem in the lobby of the Mentorship Academy. This tank will not only house the school’s mascot, but also provide an integral learning environment for our 9-12th grade biology and science students.

Why The Tank

  • As a project based school, we strive to bring real life examples across multiple subjects to aide in a constructive learning environment.
  • The Tank isn’t merely a fish tank, but a source for our students to observe, test hypotheses, research and explore a live aquatic habitat.

 

“The majority of our students have barely left our zip code, much less had the opportunity to experience marine life in action”

Dr. Herrington, 10th grade biology teacher

 

With Your Help We Can:

  • Build, install and maintain a 300+ gallon saltwater tank in the lobby of our downtown school
  • Add aquatic life similar to that found in the Gulf of Mexico including several species of fish, crustaceans, and live coral
  • Acquire four Cat Head and Epaulette sharks

 

The Big Impact

Your contribution will impact students on a daily basis. Here are just a few ways your donations will benefit the Mentorship Academy family:

  • 10th through 12th grade science and biology classes will have greater than ten lessons designed by a PhD instructor and planned around aquatic environments.
  • Countless cross subject matter projects will engage students to work in teams to demonstrate knowledge of the sharks, such as testing tank PH levels or demonstrating marine life’s role in local literature.
  • In addition to learning to care for and monitoring the well being of the sharks, this project will become a springboard for studying the marine animals found in the Gulf of Mexico. This project also provides a pathway for partnership with public and private entities such as university marine laboratories, National Marine Fisheries Service, and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).
  • School Spirit!  Sharks are our mascot and this project will be a symbol of school pride for all those that attend and visit our school.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to donate we’d certainly appreciate you forwarding and sharing this campaign with your friends. 
  • If you are a biologist or work in a marine/aquatic field and you’d be willing to mentor or help with curriculum development please send me a direct message.  Your time is one of the greatest gifts!

 

We sincerely thank you for considering this project.

  

The Mentorship Academy

We are a 501(c)(3) public charter high school located in downtown Baton Rouge, Louisiana.  Our mission is to develop young adults in a college preparatory environment through mentoring relationships with industry professionals, project-based learning, cross-curricular teaching, and technology integration. With two schools under the Mentorship Academy umbrella:

Mentorship Academy of Science and Technology (MAST), which prepares students for engagement in the petrochemical industry with projects, internships, and collaboration with engineering and science related companies. 

Mentorship Academy of the Digital Arts (MADA) prepares students for engagement in the growing fields of filmmaking, video game design, and digital media through collaboration with the many media companies contributing to a growing economy.

Our student-centered approach sets us apart by focusing on these key areas:

  • Personalization
  • Integrated Technology
  • College Readiness
  • Adult-World Connection

story:
My dream is to empower the youth by encouraging true bravery through the understanding of the self and subsequent realization of children’s own unique potential. My goal is to integrate self-development and dignity courses into our educational system, establishing critical life skills and techniques for children to acknowledge themselves and their peers as worthy individuals.

There seems to be an underlying but recurrent belief in our society of human inadequacy, whether it not being eligible for a university degree, taking a leadership position or simply being a good enough mother. This belief is cemented in children’s education very early on and leads to anxiety, stress and fear, as they get older. Thus, I think it is fundamental to make a positive impact in the world, starting with people in a young age to create a stronger change in the future and it is to accomplish this purpose that I gratefully receive donations.

To achieve this goal I will enroll a graduate education at Naropa University in Boulder, Colorado by the end of August 2013. I plan to dedicate the next three years in studying and practicing somatic psychology.

About me

My name is Nora, and if you already watched my video you know a few things about me, and why I am doing this.

Throughout my life I dealt with questions about being different from others, not only in my opinions but also in my way of looking and everything else that comes along with simply just “being”. 

Growing up in a Comorian* and Danish home and with an international education, I am accustomed to being surrounded by different cultures and languages both at my workplace, in my spare time, and while studying.

I have a strong interest in people and their personal development and therefore I have chosen to take my master's in psychology at this particular university that has a strong focus on the student’s personal growth to become a practicing psychologist.

You can find my CV here.

*Country in the Indian Ocean, situated at the north-west of Madagascar.

Kawawe

Kawawe is a Comorian word, based on the language bantu, meaning “to be yourself”. My father always used to teach me the value of this “word” while growing up; it was not until my 20s that I started understanding the significance of living and cultivating the authenticity of kawawe.

I am discovering kawawe every day and it’s my wish to transmit kawawe to further people.

Your Donation - My Impact

Through my four years in the largest volunteer student organization AIESEC, I had the gratifying opportunity to meet a lot of different people at different places around the world. I have worked with youth of all kinds of nationalities with the common vision to create a positive impact in society through the realization of humankind's potential. 

My work helped contribute in a large number of countries, namely in Malaysia, Denmark, Argentina, Chile and Uruguay. During my internship in Kuala Lumpur, I thought awareness about HIV/AIDS to over 200-university students. As president of AIESEC in my local committee I facilitated over 60 international internships abroad. In my latest endeavor as yearlong position in Buenos Aires as Director at AIESEC in Argentina, Chile and Uruguay, I opened 5 new AIESEC expansions in the region that contributed to over 50 leadership experiences. All contributions – donations – to a more positive impact in the world.

In my current job I work with a global business network of over 80 Goodwill Ambassadors, all with a common goal to promote Denmark globally and share the story of Denmark.

Likewise, it is now time for me to help out the youth to share their Kawawe story out in the world.

I have applied for various funds and been so fortunate to receive some funding. 

Now I really need some help in this final push in realizing my dream. Donations of any amount would be of a great value, and I would be extremely grateful for any help you could give.

story:
The beginning and the end of this video are a little silly, and the middle is informative and important! Something for everyone!

Short Summary

Hello friends, family, and indiegogo browsers!

I'm fundraising for a volunteer trip to the Timoun Kiskeya orphanage in Haiti, run by my dear friend, Amanda Keating.

In the past she and I have worked to fundraise for Hurricane Katrina Victims, and to raise awareness and end the genocide in Sudan. (Read about it here! http://oldsite.the-signal.com/?module=displaystory&story_id=50059&format=print)

We are currently working on creating a program for me to work on with the kids for one week in September. 

It's very important to me that I take time to do this this year. Your help will give me the opportunity to provide necessary assistance and specialized educational skills to Timoun Kiskeya.

What We Need & What You Get

Updates on the specifics of the budget are coming soon but for now:

About $300 will go towards supplementing my travel expenses.

The rest will go to the program itself and anything leftover from that will go to Timoun Kiskeya's running costs

Perks will include postcards, handmade art, poems, and personalized videos. 

The Impact

Though the news about Haiti is not currently at the forefront, it is still a country very much in need, and no one there more so than the children. 

Timoun Kiskeya protects children from slavery and harm while also providing them with inspiration and tools to build better futures for themselves and their country. 

I believe my experience and joy working with young children combined with my passions for sustainability, education, and community are worth sharing there. 

Other Ways You Can Help

- Like Timoun Kiskeya on facebook! https://www.facebook.com/pages/Timoun-Kiskeya/126064720907619?fref=ts

- Tell a friend!

- Join me in September! (contact meagankensil@gmail.com for more details)
