story:
FALLEN NOT FORGOTTEN

Fallen Not Forgotten, Inc. was founded in October of 2012.  Since that time we have been able to successfully raise enough funds to establish four small college scholarships:  Our first was given to Macae, the son of USMC Sergeant Joseph Wrightsman that was killed in action (KIA) in Afghanistan on 18 July 2010. Our second was established for the three-year-old daughter of Sergeant Enrique Mondragon (USA) who was KIA on Christmas Eve, 24 December 2012 while conducting dismounted patrols in Baraki Barak, Afghanistan.  And our third one, established for the now 7-year-old daughter of 1st Lieutenant Jason Mann who died while serving in Afghanistan 17 July 2008 as part of the 24th MEU.  Our most recent one was raised in honor of Chief Joel Baldwin (USN) for his daughter Cali who will be attending college next fall.  As we were concluding fundraising for Cali, Fallen Not Forgotten was informed of the death of a Marine that the President of Fallen Not Forgotten had previously served with in Iraq on two occasions.  It is with a heavy heart that Fallen Not Forgotten would like to do this current round of fundraising in memory of Gunnery Sergeant (ret) Moncie Johns – a man that has served his country in every clime and place and a continued supporter of Fallen Not Forgotten.  At this time, Fallen Not Forgotten asks for your continued support in celebration of those that have served their country.

It is time to take care of one of our own…

COLLEGE FOR HALEY

We will all take with us different memories of Mr. Moncie Johns aka “Gunny” to some and “Prospect Hollywood” to others.  I first met him as Gunnery Sergeant Johns in 2007 when he was serving as Company Gunnery Sergeant for Kilo Company 3/3 as we prepared to deploy to Iraq. During my first “field op” with the company, I made a casual comment regarding trash around packs on the deck.  In a moment of controlled rage as the pigment of his skin turned bright red while steam shot out of the ears on his now spinning head ...a fury of knife hands flew about at the cyclical rate - I witnessed all hell cut loose as the Drill Instructor in Gunny Johns unleashed an unrelenting blast of hate and discontent until every piece of trash was properly disposed of, packs covered and aligned, and a company of Marines quickly reminded of the expectations of the unit.  I later served with Gunny in 2008 when he took over as a platoon commander for Weapons Company 3/3.  A big responsibility for the most senior company within the unit – and again he excelled on a very independent deployment back to Iraq.  Upon return from that deployment Gunny retired and began his life in the civilian sector.

We have kept in touch throughout the years, with our most recent contact days ago as we laughed about life and how we were both back over in the same neck of the woods.  Gunny, now working for a private security contractor firm for DoS, was taken from us with only four days remaining in country before he returned home.  At home awaiting him are his two girls, Haley and Madison.  Haley just graduated high school and is expected to head off to Saint Cloud State University in the fall, while Madison remains in high school.  As many of you who read this know – they have previously lost their mother and now this. 

Several of you have reached out to me because you are familiar with what Fallen Not Forgotten does. In doing a quick review of Saint Cloud State University tuition expenses for a full time student, I quickly realized just how attainable this goal is if we all were to pitch in.

Residency Status

  Per Semester

  Academic Year

Minnesota Resident

  $8,151

  $16,302

Cost Breakdown

Tuition and Fees

  $3,771

  $7,542

Residence and Food Contract

  $3,780

  $7,560

Books and Supplies

  $600

  $1,200

HOW CAN YOU HELP

Fallen Not Forgotten asks that you contribute any amount that you can spare to make this goal happen – it is really that simple. So forgo your specialty drink at the local coffee shop, eat leftovers opposed to going out to lunch today at your favorite restaurant, empty out that change jar that you’ve been stowing away, share some of your tax returns, or any other creative way you can come up with to make this happen!

Nothing fancy…no gimmicks…just you the friends and family of Moncie and Fallen Not Forgotten working together to remind his girls that we have not forgotten them and appreciate everything they have given up throughout the years.

If you can’t afford a financial contribution at this time there are other ways you can help.  For example simply getting the word out via social media such as Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, smoke signals, courier pigeons, or any other way that people may connect with us. 

FEES:

To provide complete transparency the following administration fees are applied:

Indiegogo (our host): Charges 9% on all contributions unless we meet our goal. (4% is refunded if Fallen Not Forgotten reaches or exceeds our goal at the end of 60 days.)

PAYPAL:  ON TOP of the fees applied by Indiegogo, PAYPAL charge an additional 3-5%  per contribution.  

Fallen Not Forgotten, Inc:  We do not charge anything and all funds received from this site, minus the fees mentioned above, will be given to the school of Haley’s choice to assist with or cover as much of her expenses that we are able to cover.


SPECIAL NOTE FROM THE PRESIDENT OF FALLEN NOT FORGOTTEN, INC:

I am an active duty service member that has not forgotten the sacrifices paid by our service members overseas as well as their families at home.  I, like many of you, have experienced the loss of many friends throughout the past thirteen years and know in my heart that these are not “someone else’s kids” …these are “our” sons and daughters and they deserve our help to ensure they are well taken care of. 

Fallen Not Forgotten, Inc will distribute the funds directly to the school that Haley is scheduled to attend for any of the school related expenses mentioned above.  If she does not need the funds immediately we will maintain the funds until she does.  She will have access to these funds for college or a trade school until she reaches the age 25, unless she is serving in the military or attending graduate school.  (We will remove the age stipulation and maintain access to the funds as required if she is participating in any of the above.)  If at the age of 25 she has not utilized all of the funds and does not fall within one of the categories mentioned above, the funds will transfer to her younger sister Madison.  If Madison elects to not attend college or a trade school, at that time, contributors will be given the option to recover their contribution or provide the funds to another deserving gold star child. 

Thank you for visiting the site and taking the time to consider contributing!

story:
We are all connected. There are different parts of our environment that nourish this universal connection more strongly. Being in nature, sitting a meditation retreat and serving others are just a few examples. The World Peace Pagoda’s job at the Providence Zen Center is to both inspire and  support our universal connection. 

The pagoda must have a new roof before this winter! The aging wooden roof tiles are falling off. Only if the remaining $8,500 is raised by September 1 can construction be completed before winter winds set in. 

Support this space where people come to pursue world peace as Zen Master Seung Sahn advised: “Try, try, try for 10,000 years non-stop." 

Adopt a Shingle

Volunteers will inscribe the underside of a new roof shingle with your dedication to a teacher, friend or loved one. The new roof is guaranteed for 50 years. 

After you donate, send an email to director [at] providencezen.org with SHINGLE in subject heading and your dedication(s) in the body of the email.

History of the Pagoda

The Pagoda was constructed in 1992 to ask: "What if world peace is not just between people? What is world peace for an owl? A hummingbird?" 


The World Peace Pagoda was built in 1992 to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the Kwan Um School of Zen. It is located at the Providence Zen Center, the Head Temple of the Kwan Um School of Zen.

story:
Join our movement and help inspire the next generation of leaders.

Three $1,000 awards.
Three opportunities to experience the Children's Own Media Museum.
Three chances to be a part of innovative education and culture in Toronto.
Be part of the action, give today!

About Us:

The Children’s Own Media Museum (COMM) is a Toronto area not-for-profit that is currently establishing itself and building a movement of support to get to the next level.

We are committed to providing programming that inspires children, youth and families, in a place where they can learn to curate, explore, experiment, design, translate, create, make and play in the high-tech, high-touch world we live in. We are developing programming for in-school use, in co-operation with other organizations and at our own premises.

story:
What Is Unfused?

A fresh approach to one-on-one tutoring, for free.

Unfused is a student-run nonprofit that uses videoconferencing to provide free tutoring sessions to underserved high school students through a staff of trained, volunteer college students.

An effective and rewarding volunteer experience.

Our college volunteers can tutor more students per hour through Unfused than with any other service, all from their dorm room. 97% of tutors surveyed through our proof of concept program describe their experience as rewarding.

A platform for genuine mentoring.

Our service gives underserved students the chance to connect to high achieving college undergraduates.



The Ask:

Through the Unfused model, it only costs us $1.77 to facilitate a session between our pool of high school students and our staff of volunteer college tutors. So every dollar you donate truly matters.

Our 2015 mission is to provide at least 7,500 tutoring sessions. We'd love your help in reaching that goal!

Our Results:

From February to May 2014, Unfused provided tutoring sessions through a partnership with Horton's Kids, a D.C. based non-profit. We connected 30 underserved high school students with 12 volunteer college students twice a week, and the results speak for themselves! 


Testimonials

“I would have kept going, but we ran out of time.”

– Tyrell, Horton’s Kids student

"I wanted to complete volunteer tutoring that was not too much of a time commitment. I enjoy being able to give my time to students who appreciate it in D.C."

-Cynthia, Unfused Tutor & Brandeis University Student

"Before you, this kid never sat down to do work.  It’s a testament to what you guys are doing.”

– Rahaman Kilpatrick, Youth Development Coordinator, Horton’s Kids


High school students deserve a free and easy tutoring solution.


FAQ


Are you a non-profit? Can I write off my donation with my taxes?

Yes, Unfused is a 501(c)3 non-profit. Contributions to Unfused, Inc. are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by the law. Unfused, Inc.’s tax ID is 36-4753208.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?

When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes.

What payments do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

I have more questions. Who can I ask?

Please email our VP of Accounting, Jordan Hansen, at jhansen@getunfused.com if you have any questions. She will get back to you as soon as she can.
story_txt:
What Is Unfused? A fresh approach to one-on-one tutoring, for free.Unfused is a student-run nonprofit that uses videoconferencing to provide free tutoring sessions to underserved high school students through a staff of trained, volunteer college students.An effective and rewarding volunteer experience.Our college volunteers can tutor more students per hour through Unfused than with any other service, all from their dorm room. 97% of tutors surveyed through our proof of concept program describe their experience as rewarding. A platform for genuine mentoring.Our service gives underserved students the chance to connect to high achieving college undergraduates.The Ask:
Through the Unfused model, it only costs us $1.77 to facilitate a session between our pool of high school students and our staff of volunteer college tutors. So every dollar you donate truly matters.Our 2015 mission is to provide at least 7,500 tutoring sessions. We'd love your help in reaching that goal!
Our Results:

From February to May 2014, Unfused provided tutoring sessions through a partnership with Horton's Kids, a D.C. based non-profit. We connected 30 underserved high school students with 12 volunteer college students twice a week, and the results speak for themselves! 


Testimonials
“I would have kept going, but we ran out of time.”
– Tyrell, Horton’s Kids student

"I wanted to complete volunteer tutoring that was not too much of a time commitment. I enjoy being able to give my time to students who appreciate it in D.C."
-Cynthia, Unfused Tutor & Brandeis University Student
"Before you, this kid never sat down to do work.  It’s a testament to what you guys are doing.”
– Rahaman Kilpatrick, Youth Development Coordinator, Horton’s Kids
High school students deserve a free and easy tutoring solution.

story:
Magdalen's Story

Magdalen, now 27, is well, beautiful, happy and well occupied. This is very recent: even last summer, she was battling the multiple challenges she'd lived with ever since she was hit by a car at the age of six, catastrophically injuring her brain, her nervous system and inner organs. Headaches, tummy pains, cramps through the night and limping through the day; her coordination was gone, her brain wiped by heavy seizures that left her sick for weeks on end. She was dappy, frightened, lonely and overwhelmed.

Her miracle resurrection had begun in hospital in 1993, against odds right off the charts, bewildering the wonderful medical team that had believed her to be beyond rescue. "What happened?" they'd asked me. "How did that happen?" We didn't yet have answers to that, though they've come in since, little by little. This beautiful child had pulled through at the 11th hour; not long afterwards, she'd opened her eyes, smiled & said "Mummy, party, ice cream," and three weeks later, tottered down the hospital corridor and into the car bound for home and the start of her epic "journey of a thousand miles" (Lao-Tse, Chinese sage). 

My Story

I'm Magdalen's Mum, and my challenges began a little earlier: our story of total loss (thanks to squatters trashing the home we'd just put up for sale when we moved up North) is recounted in a book called "Rescued by Angels". I accidentally began a whole new career which began - almost literally -  with single-parenting in the snow! What came out of all this in the end was a radical new healing system (www.metatronic-life.com - do come visit!), but our personal security has yet to be rebuilt.

For the last nearly-two years, Magdalen's step-dad and I - both of us state pensioners -have held her through the final phase of her trauma release: major seizures and other symptoms have needed us on red alert 24/7. What she has eventually achieved has been so huge that it could not happen fast. But it's finally happened: the person who "left" at six is fully back and landed.

Magdalen's Gift

Magdalen has pushed back the frontiers in the understanding of trauma: we've witnessed miracles of healing we would never have otherwise discovered, and in time, these will be brought to many others. We have learned that so much that looks irreparable can truly be restored to health and vitality and joy.

So what's our campaign? And why?

What We Need

Magdalen's passion to help others, to take her experience and put it to good use, is one of the main factors that have kept her alive. She has just started a deep-acting, BACP course in counselling, backed up by voluntary work with Mind, the mental health charity, and with Place2Be, the charity that takes counselling into schools. 

This is not only her reward for the astounding job she has done already, but also the first step in a career that will ensure that the wisdom, understanding and knowledge she has grown already, and the skills she will now learn, are creatively harnessed. Everything she has been given in her life, she's given back royally: once she's fully qualified, she will give back - even more widely than before.

These are Magdalen's costs for the two-year period:

  • Tuition Fees: £8,250
  • Supervision Fees: £2,400
  • Personal Counselling (120 hours statutory minimum): £7,200
  • Travel between near-rural Oxfordshire and London, and low-budget overnight accommodation: £12,500

What We Offer You

One of our most popular creations at Metatronic Life is the Divine Healing Clinic, a library of musically accompanied mp3s that bring all kinds of physical and emotional rebalancing - along with deep relaxation and even bliss. I am offering a great cross-section of these in thanks for your support. Check the boxes for details - and accept our heartfelt thanks.
The Impact

Every mother believes in her child. I am coming to this not just as a mother, however, but as someone who has watched in awe as an astoundingly brave soul has faced the deepest devastation and emerged strong, joyful and determined to put every piece of her experience to a creative purpose. 

  • Magdalen is a natural healer: everyone who meets her is drawn to her, and pours out their heart.
  • She is wise way beyond her years, and has been guided all her life by visions and intentions that are global in nature. She will make a difference.
  • If you have any questions about this campaign or about our wider work, do please email me: pippa@metatronic-life.com. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are ours alone: we have committed to this course for Magdalen and will find ways to follow it through to its conclusion. Any gifts will enormously support Magdalen and will aid our own journey back to full living, giving us the time to take up work where we forcibly left off. 

  • I have excellent qualifications in the School of Life! 
  • With Magdalen supported and growing her power, I shall be free to resume the teaching and writing which are vital to ensure the growth and proliferation of the revolutionary healing work which has come through our experience, and which touches on every aspect of people's lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are well aware that many are struggling: some people just can't contribute, but you can still help us enormously if you will:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About SayKhmer

SayKhmer is a small enterprise providing Khmer language lessons in Siem Reap Cambodia. Our aim is to teach volunteers, tourists and long term visitors the basics of the local lingo so that they can interact with the locals in their native tongue. Our ethos is that learning some basic Khmer, will go a long way towards understanding the culture and gaining respect and smiles from the locals.

Since starting the venture we have had the privilege of teaching people from all corners of the globe and all walks of life in our regular classes held in Siem Reap. The feedback has been overwhelmingly positive and we thoroughly enjoy meeting and teaching all the enthusiastic people eager to learn the language.

SayKhmer Tours

In addition to our regular lessons, we are now working hard towards launching SayKhmer Tours, whereby we will offer guided tours of the surrounding countryside and lesser visited sites around Siem Reap, all whilst practicing the language as we go. It’s a unique opportunity to visit local areas and practice the language in real world situations, which we feel is the best way to learn.

We need a Tuk Tuk!

The reason for this crowd-fund campaign is so that we can raise the necessary funds to buy a SayKhmer TukTuk, to be used on the tours and to provide a regular income for our Khmer teacher. Having our own TukTuk will allow us to begin our tours for the approaching high tourist season.

The TukTuk will be driven by our super friendly native Khmer teacher, who has been with us since the beginning and without whom SayKhmer would never have been possible. When not being used for tours, the TukTuk will be available for him to use, providing the opportunity to make an income and help provide for his family.

To get involved and help us buy the SayKhmer TukTuk, please select one of the 'Perks' on the crowdfund page. We are aiming to raise between $250 and $500. This will be enough to buy a used TukTuk that we can make our own. If the target is exceeded or there are any surplus funds, it will be used to promote and launch SayKhmer Tours.

'Perks' for making a contribution include tours, lessons and even your name on the TukTuk itself!

Thank you for your support!

Aw’kun!  / Thank you!

SayKhmer

Nano, our fantastic teacher and soon to be TukTuk driver and guide.

story:
Our partner organisations have built up decades of experience and expertise in dealing with the complex challenges faced by the world today, from engaging populations in human rights issues to improving the lives of women in refugee camps and building inclusive businesses. Despite many successes, however, in some areas, knowledge continues to be siloed within organisations and academia. 


We will bring together 40 talented and passionate students across different disciplines (business, social sciences, STEM, design) to collaborate toward co-creating viable solutions to 10 real world challenges provided by leading international organisations. 

Our challenge-setters include organisations such as UNFPA  and International Rescue Committee, who are seeking fresh thinking and new perspectives on issues they face in their work. 

C4SI is an ambitious programme run  on a student sized budget. Like many students, we have more ideas than money! While we have raised enough funds to support the programme stage of C4SI, we are still in need of funding to support the final prize:  to help promote the practical implementation of the most impressive solution envisaged by the students.

Your donation will help the winning team to take a step further in making their idea a reality and boost their journey into social entrepreneurship. With this final prize, we hope to send the winning team to tailored workshops, from negotiations for start-ups to business modeling, aimed to accelerate and scale their solutions. The workshops are meant to connect the winning team to leading social innovators and experts from different sectors, as a chance for them to network and gain further feedback. The prize will also include a small support grant which covers all travel, meal and accommodation costs. 


Not only do you invest in the next generation of student entrepreneurs, but you will also receive the following as a token of our appreciation for your support:

  • 5 CHF = Special 'Thank you' e-card
  • 10 CHF = Your name on our e-book publication
  • 25 CHF  = E-book/PDF of C4SI
  • 50 CHF  = Printed booklet of C4SI
  • 100 CHF  = Ticket to DemoDay (Student's final presentations held on December 6, 2014 at the Graduate Institute, Geneva)
  • 200 CHF  = C4SI Merchandise Set
  • 1000 CHF = C4SI's winning team presents at your place! (only available for donors from Switzerland)


We are  Just Innovate, a non-profit educational initiative whose mission is to inspire and facilitate the creation of social innovations within student communities. Founded in 2012 by students at the Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies in Geneva, Just Innovate is initially focusing our efforts on universities in Switzerland with the ambition of eventually taking our activities global. 


Thank you for reading our page! Please share this campaign with everyone you know and spread the word about what we are trying to accomplish!
